b

baka 1

masc. name of a god; lit. crane ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a god; lit. crane
Sanskrit baka

Example

tena kho pana, bhikkhave, samayena bakassa brahmuno evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ hoti, idaṃ niccaṃ, idaṃ dhuvaṃ, idaṃ sassataṃ, idaṃ kevalaṃ, idaṃ acavanadhammaṃ, idañ'hi na jāyati na jīyati na mīyati na cavati na upapajjati, ito ca panaññaṃ uttari nissaraṇaṃ n'atthī'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
baka 2

masc. crane, heron ✗

bakabrahmasutta

Meaning name of a nun; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost in clairvoyance
Construction bakula + ā

Variant sakulā
bakkula

masc. name of a monk ~

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a monk
Variant bākula
baggiya

adj. part of a group; belonging to a collection [vagga + iya] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from vagga
Meaning part of a group; belonging to a collection
Construction vagga + iya > baggiya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Phonetic Change v > b
Variant vaggiya
Sanskrit vargya

Example

tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū purato'pi pacchato'pi olambentā nivāsenti.

VIN 2.7.1 parimaṇḍalavaggo
bajjha

ger. (+acc) binding; tying; hanging [√badh + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of bandhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning binding; tying; hanging
Root Family √badh
Root √badh･1 a (bind, tie)
Construction √badh + ya
Phonetic Change dhy > jjh
Sanskrit badhya
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Example

asinā hanti attānaṃ,
visaṃ khādanti mucchitā,
rajjuyā bajjha mīyanti,
pabbatām'api kandare.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
bajjhataṃ

imp. (+instr) may one be bound (by); one must be tied up (with) [√badh + ya + taṃ] ✓

Grammar imp, reflx 3rd sg of bajjhatu, pass, intrans (+instr)
Meaning may one be bound (by); one must be tied up (with)
Root Family √badh
Root √badh･1 ya (bind, tie)
Base √badh + ya > bajjha (pass)
Construction bajjha + taṃ
Phonetic Change dhy > jjh
Variant bajjhatū
Sanskrit bandhatām
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Example

so bajjhataṃ pāsasatehi chabbhi,
rammā vanā niyyatu rājadhāniṃ,
tuttehi so haññatu pācanehi,
bhisāni te brāhmaṇa yo ahāsi.

JA 488 bhisa jātakaṃ
bajjhati 1

pr. (+instr) is bound (by); is tied up (by); is caught (by); is imprisoned (by) [√badh + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of bandhati, intrans (+instr)
Meaning is bound (by); is tied up (by); is caught (by); is imprisoned (by)
Root Family √badh
Root √badh･1 ya (bind, tie)
Base √badh + ya > bajjha (pass)
Construction bajjha + ti
Phonetic Change dhy > jjh
Sanskrit badhyate
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Examples

byāpannacitto hoti paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo, ime sattā haññantu vā bajjhantu vā ucchijjantu vā vinassantu vā mā vā ahesun'ti

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

icchāya bajjhatī loko,
icchāvinayāya muccati,
icchāya vippahānena,
sabbaṃ chindati bandhanan'ti.

SN 1.69 icchāsuttaṃ
bajjhati 2

pr. is responsible (for an action) [√badh] ✗

Sanskrit badara + pāṇḍu
badaramissa

adj. mixed with jujube ✗
badarikā

fem. jujube fruit; Ziziphus jujuba; lit. from the jujube tree [badarī + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, from badarī
Meaning jujube fruit; Ziziphus jujuba; lit. from the jujube tree

Synonym koḷikā

Example

ekaṃ samayaṃ sambahulā therā bhikkhū kosambiyaṃ viharanti ghosit'ārāme. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā khemako badarik'ārāme viharati ābādhiko dukkhito bāḷhagilāno.

badālatā

fem. creeper of sweet taste ✗
baddha 1

pp. (+instr or +loc) bound (to); tied (onto); fastened (to) [√badh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of √badh (+instr or +loc)
Meaning bound (to); tied (onto); fastened (to)
Root Family √badh
Root √badh･1 a (bind, tie)
Construction √badh + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Synonym ābaddha, upanibaddha, gathita, gadhita, paṭimukka, saññutta, saṃyutta, sita
Variant bandha
Sanskrit baddha
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Examples

assakhaḷuṅko hi, sandha, doṇiyā baddho, yavasaṃ yavasan'ti jhāyati. taṃ kissa hetu? na hi, sandha, assakhaḷuṅkassa doṇiyā baddhassa evaṃ hoti, kiṃ nu kho maṃ ajja assadammasārathi kāraṇaṃ kāressati, kim'ass'āhaṃ paṭikaromī'ti.

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ

icchānidānā bhavasātabaddhā,
te duppamuñcā na hi aññamokkhā,
pacchā pure v'āpi apekkhamānā,
ime'va kāme purime'va jappaṃ.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2
baddha 2

pp. (+loc) imprisoned (in); confined (in); trapped (in); lit. bound [√badh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of bandhati (+loc)
Meaning imprisoned (in); confined (in); trapped (in); lit. bound
Root Family √badh
Root √badh･1 a (bind, tie)
Construction √badh + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Sanskrit baddha
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Examples

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave puriso bandhan'āgāre baddho assa

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, āraññako mago baddho pāsarāsiṃ adhisayeyya. so evam'assa veditabbo, anayam'āpanno byasanam'āpanno yathākāmakaraṇīyo luddassa.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
baddha 3

masc. (+gen) captive (of); prisoner (of); hostage (of); lit. bound [√badh + ta] ✓

Grammar masc, from bandhati (+gen)
Meaning captive (of); prisoner (of); hostage (of); lit. bound
Root Family √badh
Root √badh･1 a (bind, tie)
Construction √badh + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Synonym karamara, gayhaka, baddhagū
Variant bandha
Sanskrit baddha
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Examples

sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetu yam'ahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahit'atto vihareyyan'ti. upādiyamāno kho, bhikkhu, baddho mārassa, anupādiyamāno mutto pāpimato'ti.

SN 22.63 upādiyamānasuttaṃ

saddhā bandhati pātheyyaṃ,
sirī bhogānam'āsayo,
icchā naraṃ parikassati,
icchā lokasmi dujjahā,
icchābaddhā puthū sattā,
pāsena sakuṇī yathā'ti.

bandha 1

pāpakammā pamuccare.

bandhati 1

pr. (+acc) binds; ties up; imprisons; confines [√bandh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning binds; ties up; imprisons; confines
Root Family √bandh
Root √bandh･1 a (bind, tie)
Base √bandh + a > bandha
Construction bandha + ti
Synonym ussineti
Commentary (VIN 1.1.2) bandheyyuṃ vā'ti rajjubandhanena vā andubandhanena vā saṅkhalikabandhanena vā gharabandhanena vā nagarabandhanena vā gāmabandhanena vā nigamabandhanena vā bandheyyuṃ, purisaguttiṃ vā kareyyuṃ.
Sanskrit badhnāti
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso chappāṇake gahetvā nānāvisaye nānāgocare daḷhāya rajjuyā bandheyya.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, suvaṇṇakāro vā suvaṇṇakār'antevāsī vā ukkaṃ bandheyya, ukkaṃ bandhitvā ukkāmukhaṃ ālimpeyya, ukkāmukhaṃ ālimpetvā saṇḍāsena jātarūpaṃ gahetvā ukkāmukhe pakkhipeyya

VISM 2.19 paccayapariggaha kathā
bandhana 2

nt. attachment; connection; lit. binding [√bandh + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from bandhati
Meaning attachment; connection; lit. binding
Root Family √bandh
Root √bandh･1 a (bind, tie)
Construction √bandh + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Antonym abandhana
Sanskrit bandhana
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Example

yass'assu lunāni bandhanāni,
ajjhattaṃ bahiddhā ca saṅgamūlaṃ,
sabbasaṅgamūlabandhanā pamutto,
ājāniyo tādi pavuccate tathattā'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
bandhana 3

nt. bondage; confinement; imprisonment; tying up; lit. binding [√bandh + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from bandhati
Meaning bondage; confinement; imprisonment; tying up; lit. binding
Root Family √bandh
Root √bandh･1 a (bind, tie)
Construction √bandh + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Antonym abandhana
Sanskrit bandhana
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Examples

yo nibbanatho van'ādhimutto,
vanamutto vanam'eva dhāvati,
taṃ puggalam'etha passatha,
mutto bandhanam'eva dhāvati.

DHP 344 taṇhāvaggo

so aparena samayena tamhā bandhanā mucceyya sotthinā abbhayena

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
bandhana 4

nt. tying up; kidnapping; lit. binding [√bandh + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from bandhati
Meaning tying up; kidnapping; lit. binding
Root Family √bandh
Root √bandh･1 a (bind, tie)
Construction √bandh + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Commentary (DNa) bandho'ti rajjubandhan'ādīhi bandhanaṃ.
Sanskrit bandhana
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Example

tulākūṭa kaṃsakūṭa mānakūṭa ukkoṭana vañcana nikati sāciyoga chedana vadha bandhana viparāmosa ālopa sāhasākārā paṭivirato ahosi.

DN 30.21 lakkhaṇasuttaṃ
bandhana 5

nt. mend; repair; fix; lit. binding [√bandh + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from bandhati
Meaning mend; repair; fix; lit. binding
Root Family √bandh
Root √bandh･1 a (bind, tie)
Construction √bandh + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit bandhana
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Example

yo pana bhikkhu ūnapañcabandhanena pattena aññaṃ navaṃ pattaṃ cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ. tena bhikkhunā so patto bhikkhuparisāya nissajjitabbo

VIN PAT NP 22 ūnapañcabandhanasikkhāpadaṃ
bandhana 6

nt. stalk; lit. binding [√bandh + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from bandhati
Meaning stalk; lit. binding
Root Family √bandh
Root √bandh･1 a (bind, tie)
Construction √bandh + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym vaṇḍa, vaṇṭa
Sanskrit bandhana
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Example

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, paṇḍupalāso bandhanā pavutto abhabbo haritattāya, evam'eva kho, sunakkhatta, āneñj'ādhimuttassa purisapuggalassa ye lok'āmisasaṃyojane se pavutte.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
bandhanakāraṇa

nt. act of binding; reason for binding ✗

Sanskrit bandhana + agāra

Examples

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave puriso bandhan'āgāre baddho assa

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

sārambhaṃ nāma ... rājavatthunissitaṃ vā hoti, hatthisālānissitaṃ vā hoti, assasālānissitaṃ vā hoti, bandhan'āgāranissitaṃ vā hoti, pān'āgāranissitaṃ vā hoti, sūnanissitaṃ vā hoti, racchānissitaṃ vā hoti

VIN 1.2.6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ
bandhanāgārika 1

masc. jailer; prison warden; prison guard [bandhana + agāra + ika] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, from bandhanāgāra
Meaning jailer; prison warden; prison guard
Construction bandhana + agāra + ika
bandhanāgāra + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Compound kammadhāraya (bandhana + āgārika)
Commentary (ANa) bandhan'āgāriko'ti bandhan'āgāragopako.
Sanskrit bandhana + āgārika

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo orabbhiko hoti sūkariko sākuṇiko māgaviko luddo macchaghātako coro coraghātako goghātako bandhan'āgāriko, ye vā pan'aññe'pi keci kurūrakammantā.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ

tatr'idaṃ, bhante, pūraṇena kassapena kaṇh'ābhijāti paññattā, orabbhikā sūkarikā sākuṇikā māgavikā luddā macchaghātakā corā coraghātakā bandhan'āgārikā ye vā pan'aññe'pi keci kurūrakammantā.

AN 6.57 chaḷabhijātisuttaṃ
bandhanāgārika 2

masc. prisoner ✗

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
bandhanīya 1

adj. captivating; bewitching; enchanting; enthralling; lit. to be bound [√bandh + anīya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp of bandhati
Meaning captivating; bewitching; enchanting; enthralling; lit. to be bound

Root √bandh･1 a (bind, tie)
Construction √bandh + anīya
Derivative kicca (anīya)
Sanskrit bandhanīya
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, rañño vā rājamahāmattassa vā vīṇāya saddo assutapubbo assa. so vīṇāsaddaṃ suṇeyya. so evaṃ vadeyya, ambho, kassa nu kho eso saddo evaṃrajanīyo evaṃkamanīyo evaṃmadanīyo evaṃmucchanīyo evaṃbandhanīyo'ti?

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ
bandhanīya 2

ptp. should be combined, should be united [√bandh] ✗
bandhanokāsa

adj. with room to repair; with space to fix [bandhana + okāsa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with room to repair; with space to fix
Construction bandhana + okāsa
Compound catutthī tappurisa (bandhanassa + okāsa)
Antonym abandhanokāsa
Sanskrit bandhana + avakāsa

Example

abandhan'okāso nāma patto yassa dv'aṅgulā rāji na hoti. bandhan'okāso nāma patto yassa dv'aṅgulā rāji hoti. navo nāma patto viññattiṃ upādāya vuccati.

bandhava

masc. relative; family member; relation; brother [√bandh + u + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from bandhu
Meaning relative; family member; relation; brother
Root Family √bandh
Root √bandh･1 a (bind, tie)
Construction √bandh + u > av + *a
bandhu + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > av
Synonym ñātaka, bandhu
Sanskrit bāndhava
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Example

na santi puttā tāṇāya,
na pitā n'āpi bandhavā,
antaken'ādhipannassa,
n'atthi ñātīsu tāṇatā.

DHP 288 maggavaggo
bandhāpita 1

pp. (+instr) bound (by); tied up (by); chained (by); lit. caused to be bound [√bandh + *āpe + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of bandhāpeti, caus (+instr)
Meaning bound (by); tied up (by); chained (by); lit. caused to be bound
Root Family √bandh
Root √bandh･1 *āpe (bind, tie)

Construction bandhāpe + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Sanskrit bandh
Sanskrit Root √bandh 9 (bind)

Example

tena kho pana samayena raññā pasenadinā kosalena mahājanakāyo bandhāpito hoti, app'ekacce rajjūhi app'ekacce andūhi app'ekacce saṅkhalikāhi.

aṭṭhakavaggo 13

gav'assaṃ dāsaporisaṃ,
thiyo bandhū puthu kāme,

SNP 39 kāmasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 1

Example

evam'ev'ime muṇḍakā samaṇakā ibbhā kiṇhā bandhupād'āpaccā, jhāyino'smā jhāyino'smā'ti pattakkhandhā adhomukhā madhurakajātā jhāyanti pajjhāyanti nijjhāyanti apajjhāyanti.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
bandhupādāpacca

adj. born from Brahma's foot; who is the offspring of God's foot; lit. child of relative's foot [bandhu + pāda + apacca] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning born from Brahma's foot; who is the offspring of God's foot; lit. child of relative's foot
Construction bandhu + pāda + apacca
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bandhupādassa + apacca)
Commentary (MNa) bandhupād'āpaccā'ti ettha bandhū'ti brahmā adhippeto. tañ'hi brāhmaṇā pitāmaho'ti voharanti. pādānaṃ apaccā pād'āpaccā, brahmuno piṭṭhipādato jātā'ti adhippāyo. tesaṃ kira ayaṃ laddhi, brāhmaṇā brahmuno mukhato nikkhantā, khattiyā urato, vessā nābhito, suddā jāṇuto, samaṇā piṭṭhipādato'ti.
Sanskrit bandhu + pāda + apatya

Example

evam'ev'ime muṇḍakā samaṇakā ibbhā kiṇhā bandhupād'āpaccā, jhāyino'smā jhāyino'smā'ti pattakkhandhā adhomukhā madhurakajātā jhāyanti pajjhāyanti nijjhāyanti apajjhāyanti.

dutiyo tattha jāyati,
tatiyo ca catuttho ca,
idaṃ te babbukā bilanti.

JA 137 babbu jātakaṃ
babbuka

masc. small cat; kitten [babbu + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, dimin of babbu
Meaning small cat; kitten
Construction babbu + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym babbu, biḷāra
Sanskrit babhruka

Example

yatth'eko labhate babbu,
dutiyo tattha jāyati,
tatiyo ca catuttho ca,
idaṃ te babbukā bilanti.

JA 137 babbu jātakaṃ
babbujātaka

nt. Jātaka 137 (JA 137) ✗
babhūva

perf. (+nom) became; existed [√bhū + a + a] ✓

Grammar perf of bhavati, intrans (+nom)
Meaning became; existed
Root Family √bhū
Root √bhū･1 a (be, become)
Base √bhū + bhū + a > babhū (perf)
Construction babhū + a
Sanskrit babhūva
Sanskrit Root √bhū 1 (be)

Examples

dvebhūtassa dhātussa yo pubbo, so abbhāsasañño hoti. dadhāti, dadāti, babhūva.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 459

brū bhū'icc'etesaṃ dhātūnaṃ āha bhūva'icc'ete ādesā honti yathāsaṅkhyaṃ parokkhāyaṃ vibhattiyaṃ. āha, āhu, babhūva, babhūvu. parokkhāyam'iti kim'atthaṃ? abravuṃ

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 475
bara

adj. excellent, best, noble; lit. selected, wishing [pa + √var] ✗
baraṇaseyyaka

adj. made in or coming from Benares [bārāṇasī] ✗
barihisa

nt. sacrificial grass ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning sacrificial grass
Notes (MW) a bed of kuśa grass strewed over the sacrificial ground to serve as a sacred surface on which to present the oblations
Sanskrit barhis

Example

tasmiṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, yaññe n'eva gāvo haññiṃsu, na aj'eḷakā haññiṃsu, na kukkuṭasūkarā haññiṃsu, na vividhā pāṇā saṃghātaṃ āpajjiṃsu, na rukkhā chijjiṃsu yūpatthāya, na dabbhā lūyiṃsu barihisa-atthāya

DN 5.10 kūṭadantasuttaṃ
barihisatthāya

ind. for the sacrificial grass; lit. for the sake of sacrificial grass [barihisa + attha + āya] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, dat sg of barihisattha
Meaning for the sacrificial grass; lit. for the sake of sacrificial grass
Construction barihisa + attha + āya
barihisattha + āya
Variant parikammatthāya
Commentary (ANa) barihis'atthāyā'ti parikkhepakaraṇ'atthāya c'eva yaññabhūmiyaṃ attharaṇ'atthāya ca.
Sanskrit barhis + arthāya

Examples

tasmiṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, yaññe n'eva gāvo haññiṃsu, na aj'eḷakā haññiṃsu, na kukkuṭasūkarā haññiṃsu, na vividhā pāṇā saṃghātaṃ āpajjiṃsu, na rukkhā chijjiṃsu yūpatthāya, na dabbhā lūyiṃsu barihis'atthāya

DN 5.10 kūṭadantasuttaṃ

ettakā ajā haññantu yaññ'atthāya, ettakā urabbhā haññantu yaññ'atthāya, ettakā assā haññantu yaññ'atthāya, ettakā rukkhā chijjantu yūp'atthāya, ettakā dabbhā lūyantu barihis'atthāyā'ti.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
bala 1

nt. strength; power; might [√bal + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning strength; power; might
Root Family √bal
Root √bal･1 a (be strong, live)
Construction √bal + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym abala
Synonym balatā
Sanskrit bala
Sanskrit Root √bal 2 (be strong)

Examples

abhivādanasīlissa,
niccaṃ vuḍḍh'āpacāyino,
cattāro dhammā vaḍḍhanti,
āyu vaṇṇo sukhaṃ balaṃ.

DHP 109 sahassavaggo

etha, tumhe'pi, bhikkhave, ek'āsanabhojanaṃ bhuñjatha. ek'āsanabhojanaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tumhe'pi bhuñjamānā app'ābādhatañ'ca sañjānissatha app'ātaṅkatañ'ca lah'uṭṭhānañ'ca balañ'ca phāsuvihārañ'cā'ti.

MN 65 bhaddālisuttaṃ
bala 2

nt. (Dhamma) power; strength [√bal + a] ✓

Meaning (Dhamma) power; strength
Root Family √bal
Root √bal･1 a (be strong, live)
Construction √bal + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit bala

Example

te pabbajitvā sugatassa sāsane,
bhāvetva bojjh'aṅgabalāni paṇḍitā,
udaggacittā sumanā kat'indriyā,
phusiṃsu nibbānapadaṃ asaṅkhatan'ti.

UDa 2.8 suppavāsā suttavaṇṇanā
balakaraṇīya

adj. (of work) hard to do; strenuous; arduous; lit. to be done with strength [bala + karaṇīya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (of work) hard to do; strenuous; arduous; lit. to be done with strength
Construction bala + karaṇīya
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (balena + karaṇīya)
Commentary (MNa) balakaraṇīyā'ti bāhubalena kattabbā kasivāṇijj'ādikā kammantā.
Sanskrit bala + karaṇīya

Example

seyyathā'pi vā pana, bho gotama, ye kec'ime balakaraṇīyā kammantā karīyanti, sabbe te pathaviṃ nissāya pathaviyaṃ patiṭṭhāya. evam'ete balakaraṇīyā kammantā karīyanti.

balagga

nt. review; roll-call; (comm) parade ground; lit. force place [bala + agga] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning review; roll-call; (comm) parade ground; lit. force place
Construction bala + agga
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (balassa + agga)
Commentary (VIN 2.5.5.10) bal'aggaṃ nāma ettakā hatthī, ettakā assā, ettakā rathā, ettakā pattī. (VINa) balassa aggaṃ jānanti etthā'ti bal'aggaṃ, balagaṇanaṭṭhānan'ti attho.
Sanskrit bala + agāra

Example

dirattatirattaṃ ce bhikkhu senāya vasamāno uyyodhikaṃ vā bal'aggaṃ vā senābyūhaṃ vā anīkadassanaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

balaṭṭha

masc. soldier, member of an army ✗
balatā

fem. strength; power; might; lit. strength state [√bal + a + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from bala
Meaning strength; power; might; lit. strength state
Root Family √bal
Root √bal･1 a (be strong, live)

bala + tā

Commentary (MNa) balatāya samannāgato'ti balena samannāgato.
Sanskrit balatā

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, yathārūpāya balatāya diṭṭhisampanno puggalo samannāgato, aham'pi tathārūpāya balatāya samannāgato'ti.

masc. soldier, member of an army ✗
balada

adj. giving strength; who gives energy [bala + da] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning giving strength; who gives energy
Construction bala + da

Sanskrit balada

Examples

kiṃdado balado hoti,

kiṃdado hoti cakkhudo,
ko ca sabbadado hoti,
taṃ me akkhāhi pucchito'ti.

SN 1.42 kiṃdadasuttaṃ

annado balado hoti,
vatthado hoti vaṇṇado,
yānado sukhado hoti,
dīpado hoti cakkhudo.

balavago

masc. strong cow; powerful cow [balavant + go] ✓

so paṭhamaṃ patāresi ye te usabhā gopitaro gopariṇāyakā. te tiriyaṃ gaṅgāya sotaṃ chetvā sotthinā pāraṃ agamaṃsu. ath'āpare patāresi balavagāvo dammagāvo.

AN 3.51 mahācorasuttaṃ
balavant 1

adj. strong; powerful; lit. having strength quality [√bal + a + vant] ✓

Grammar adj, from bala
Meaning strong; powerful; lit. having strength quality
Root Family √bal
Root √bal･1 a (be strong, live)
Construction √bal + a + vant
bala + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Antonym dubbala
Synonym thāmavant, balasampanna, balī, bhusa
Sanskrit balavat
Sanskrit Root √bal 2 (be strong)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, balavā puriso dubbalataraṃ purisaṃ sīse vā gale vā khandhe vā gahetvā abhiniggaṇheyya abhinippīḷeyya abhisantāpeyya.

MN 20 vitakkasaṇṭhānasuttaṃ

so vata, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ime pañca āvaraṇe nīvaraṇe cetaso ajjhāruhe paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe pahāya, balavatiyā paññāya att'atthaṃ vā ñassati par'atthaṃ vā ñassati ubhay'atthaṃ vā ñassati

AN 5.51 āvaraṇasuttaṃ
balavant 2

bala + vant

Synonym bhusa
Sanskrit balavat

balavamhi

sandhi. I am strong; I am powerful [balavā + amhi] ~

Grammar sandhi, adj + pr
Meaning I am strong; I am powerful
Construction balavā + amhi
Commentary (ANa) balav'amhī'ti aham'asmi balavā.
balavamhi balattho

idiom. might is right; lit. I am powerful, power is good [balavā + amhi + bala + attho] ✓

Grammar idiom, adj + pr + nt + masc
Meaning might is right; lit. I am powerful, power is good
Construction balavā + amhi + bala + attho
Commentary (ANa) balav'amhī'ti aham'asmi balavā. balattho iti'pī'ti balena me attho iti'pi, bale vā ṭhito'mhī'ti'pi vadati.

Example

yadapi luddho lobhena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto parassa asatā dukkhaṃ uppādayati, vadhena vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balav'amhi bal'attho iti'pi tadapi akusalaṃ.

balavīriya

nt. strength and willpower; power and determination; lit. strength and energy [bala + vīriya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning strength and willpower; power and determination; lit. strength and energy
Construction bala + vīriya
Compound dvanda (bala ca vīriya ca)
Commentary (MNa) balavīriyan'ti apar'āparaṃ sañcaraṇavāyodhātu, sā parihāyī'ti attho. (SNa) balavīriyan'ti ettha balaṃ nāma vāyodhātu, vīriyaṃ kāyikacetasikavīriyam'eva.
Sanskrit bala + vīrya

Example

tesaṃ gimhānaṃ pacchime māse, tiṇ'odakasaṅkhaye, adhimattakasimānaṃ patto kāyo hoti. tesaṃ adhimattakasimānaṃ pattakāyānaṃ balavīriyaṃ parihāyi.

balasā

Meaning strongly; firmly; lit. with strength

Root √bal･1 a (be strong, live)

bala + asā

Sanskrit bala
Sanskrit Root √bal 2 (be strong)

Example

nāgaṃ'va thambhamhi daḷhāya rajjuyā,
taṃ me suguttaṃ satiyā subhāvitaṃ,
anissitaṃ sabbabhavesu hehisi.

APA 8 upāli therāpadānaṃ
balādisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.99-110 (SN46.99-110) ✗
balādisuttadvādasaka 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 47.73-84 (SN47.73-84) ✗
balādisuttadvādasaka 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 50.1-12 (SN50.1-12) ✗
balādhiṭṭhāna

adj. relying on strength; supported by (military) might [bala + adhiṭṭhāna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning relying on strength; supported by (military) might
Construction bala + adhiṭṭhāna
Commentary (ANa) bal'ādhiṭṭhānā'ti balakāy'ādhiṭṭhānā. balakāyañ'hi laddhā te laddhapatiṭṭhā nāma honti.
balānīka

adj. with powerful army; with strong force [bala + anīka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with powerful army; with strong force
Construction bala + anīka
Compound kammadhāraya (bala + anīka)
Commentary (VISMa) khantibalaṃ balānīkan'ti paramaṃ maṅgalabhūtā khanti eva balaṃ etassā'ti khantibalaṃ. vuttañ'hi khantibalā samaṇabrāhmaṇā'ti.
Sanskrit bala + anīka

Example

akkosaṃ vadhabandhañ'ca,
aduṭṭho yo titikkhati,
khantībalaṃ bal'ānīkaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 399 brāhmaṇavaggo
balābala

nt. strengths and weaknesses; relative strengths [bala + abala] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning strengths and weaknesses; relative strengths
Construction bala + abala
Compound dvanda (bala ca abala ca)
Sanskrit balābala

Example

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yo so bhattu abbhantaro antojano, dāsā'ti vā pessā'ti vā kammakarā'ti vā, tesaṃ katañ'ca katato jānāti akatañ'ca akatato jānāti, gilānakānañ'ca bal'ābalaṃ jānāti khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyañ'c'assa paccaṃsena saṃvibhajati.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ
bali 1

Root Family √bal
Root √bal･1 a (be strong, live)
Construction √bal + a + i
bala + i
Derivative taddhita (i)
Synonym āyāga
Notes PED suggest sk √bhṛ
Sanskrit bali
Sanskrit Root √bal 2 (be strong)

Examples

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kusinārāyaṃ viharati baliharaṇe vanasaṇḍe

rañño ālambananaṅgalaṃ rattasuvaṇṇaparikkhittaṃ hoti. balibaddānaṃ siṅgāni'pi rasmipatodā'pi suvaṇṇaparikkhittā honti.

DHP 280 maggavaggo

Meaning ox; bull

khattiyo dvipadaṃ seṭṭho,
balībaddo catuppadaṃ,
komārī seṭṭhā bhariyānaṃ,
yo ca puttāna pubbajo'ti.

aṭṭhakavaggo 1

bavh

ind. many; much; lots (of); a lot (of); great; large [√bah + u] ✓

Grammar ind, in comps, from bahu
Meaning many; much; lots (of); a lot (of); great; large
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah + u > bavh
Derivative kita (u)
Phonetic Change hu > vh
Antonym appa
Notes occurs before vowels
Sanskrit bahv
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

vācaṃ manañ'ca paṇidhāya sammā,
kāyena pāpāni akubbamāno,
bavhannapānaṃ gharam'āvasanto,
saddho mudū saṃvibhāgī vadaññū,
etesu dhammesu ṭhito catūsu,
dhamme ṭhito paralokaṃ na bhāye'ti.

SN 1.75 bhītāsuttaṃ

so ca hoti dubbaṇṇo duddasiko okoṭimako bavhābādho kāṇo vā kuṇī vā khañjo vā pakkhahato vā, na lābhī annassa pānassa vatthassa yānassa mālāgandhavilepanassa seyyāvasathapadīpeyyassa.

AN 3.13 āsaṃsasuttaṃ
bavhannapāna

nt. lots of food and drink [bahu + anna + pāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning lots of food and drink
Construction bahu > bavh + anna + pāna
Phonetic Change hu > vh
Compound kammadhāraya (bahu + annapāna)
Antonym appannapāna
Variant bahvannapāna
Sanskrit bahu + anna + pāna

Example

vācaṃ manañ'ca paṇidhāya sammā,
kāyena pāpāni akubbamāno,
bavhannapānaṃ gharam'āvasanto,
saddho mudū saṃvibhāgī vadaññū,
etesu dhammesu ṭhito catūsu,
dhamme ṭhito paralokaṃ na bhāye'ti.

bahi

Examples

taṃ taṃ gotama pucchāmi,
ko imaṃ vijaṭaye jaṭan'ti.

patirūpako mattikākuṇḍalo'va,
loh'aḍḍhamāso'va suvaṇṇachanno,
caranti loke parivārachannā,
anto asuddhā bahi sobhamānā'ti.

SN 47.10 bhikkhunupassayasuttaṃ

sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno aññen'aññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.

SN 3.11 sattajaṭilasuttaṃ

atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno taṃ puggalaṃ bāhāyaṃ gahetvā bahidvārakoṭṭhakā nikkhāmetvā sūcighaṭikaṃ datvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami

bahimūlatta

nt. fact of having external roots [bahi + mūla + tta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning fact of having external roots
Construction bahi + mūla + tta
bahimūla + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
bahisuṅkaghātaṃ

ind. outside the custom's station [bahi + suṅkaghāta + aṃ] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning outside the custom's station
Construction bahi + suṅkaghāta + aṃ
bahisuṅkaghāta + aṃ
Commentary (VINt) suṅkaghātato bahi bahisuṅkaghātaṃ.
bahu

adj. many; much; lots (of); a lot (of); great; large [√bah + u] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning many; much; lots (of); a lot (of); great; large
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah + u
Derivative kita (u)
Antonym appa
Synonym pacura, bahuka, mahanta, mahallaka, mahallikā, mahā
Sanskrit bahu
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

katamañ'ca, gahapati, ānaṇyasukhaṃ? idha, gahapati, kulaputto na kassaci kiñci dhāreti appaṃ vā bahuṃ vā.

AN 4.62 ānaṇyasuttaṃ

dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ bahuñ'ca apuññaṃ pasavati

AN 2.135 āyācanavaggo
bahualīkamma

nt. continuous practice; zealous exercise ✗
bahuāgata

adj. very close; very near; lit. come lots [bahu + āgata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning very close; very near; lit. come lots
Construction bahu + āgata
Commentary (SNa) bahuāgato kho my'āyan'ti mayhaṃ atthāya ayaṃ bahutaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgato, appaṃ avasiṭṭhaṃ, idāni maṃ gaṇhissatī'ti ñatvā dāruguḷo viya vinivattitvā tass'eva leḍḍussa antare paccupādi, paṭipanno paviṭṭho'ti attho.
bahuādīnava

adj. with many disadvantages; with lots of drawbacks [bahu + ādīnava] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with many disadvantages; with lots of drawbacks
Construction bahu + ādīnava
Compound kammadhāraya (bahu + ādīnava)
Sanskrit bahu + ādīnava

Example

katamā c'ānanda, ādīnavasaññā? idh'ānanda, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññ'āgāragato vā iti paṭisañcikkhati, bahudukkho kho ayaṃ kāyo bahuādīnavo.

AN 10.60 girimānandasuttaṃ
bahuitthika

adj. with many women [bahu + itthika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with many women
Construction bahu + itthika
Compound kammadhāraya (bahu + itthika)
Antonym appitthika
Variant bahukitthika, bahutthika
Sanskrit bahu + strīka

Example

seyyathā'pi, ānanda, yāni kānici kulāni bahuitthikāni appapurisakāni, tāni suppadhaṃsiyāni honti corehi kumbhatthenakehi, evam'evaṃ kho, ānanda, yasmiṃ dhammavinaye labhati mātugāmo agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjaṃ, na taṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti.

AN 8.51 gotamīsuttaṃ
bahuka

adj. many; lots (of) [√bah + u + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from bahu
Meaning many; lots (of)
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah + u + ka
bahu + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym bahu
Sanskrit bahu +
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

dānañ'ca yuddhañ'ca samānam'āhu,
app'āpi santā bahuke jinanti,
appam'pi ce saddahāno dadāti,
ten'eva so hoti sukhī paratthā'ti.

SN 1.33 sādhusuttaṃ

acchindāpeyyā'ti aññaṃ āṇāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. sakiṃ āṇatto bahukam'pi acchindati, nissaggiyaṃ hoti.

VIN 1.4.3.5 cīvarācchindanasikkhāpadaṃ
bahukaṇṭaka

adj. full of thorns; very thorny [bahu + kaṇṭaka] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning full of thorns; very thorny
Construction bahu + kaṇṭaka
bahukata

adj. (+gen) much done (by); a lot accomplished (by) [bahu + kata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+gen)
Meaning much done (by); a lot accomplished (by)
Construction bahu + kata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bahuṃ + kata)
Commentary (MNa) bahukataṃ hotī'ti ettāvatā'pi bahuṃ bhagavato sāsanaṃ kataṃ hoti
Sanskrit bahukṛta

Example

tassa ce, āvuso, bhikkhuno evaṃ buddhaṃ anussarato, evaṃ dhammaṃ anussarato, evaṃ saṅghaṃ anussarato upekkhā kusalanissitā saṇṭhāti, so tena attamano hoti. ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno bahukataṃ hoti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
bahukaraṇīya

adj. busy; with lots to do; with many duties; lit. lots to be done [bahu + karaṇīya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning busy; with lots to do; with many duties; lit. lots to be done
Construction bahu + karaṇīya
Compound kammadhāraya (bahu + karaṇīya)
Synonym bahukicca
Commentary (DNa) bahukiccā'ti balavakiccā. bahukaraṇīyā'ti tass'eva vevacanaṃ.
Notes (MW) one who has (or complains of having) much to do, who never has time for anything
Sanskrit bahukaraṇīya

Examples

handa ca dāni mayaṃ, bho gotama, gacchāma. bahukiccā mayaṃ, bahukaraṇīyā'ti. yassadāni tvaṃ, aggivessana, kālaṃ maññasī'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

mayaṃ kho, mārisa moggallāna, bahukiccā bahukaraṇīyā, app'eva sakena karaṇīyena, api ca devānaṃ'y'eva tāvatiṃsānaṃ karaṇīyena.

MN 37 cūḷataṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
bahukāra

adj. very useful; extremely helpful; of great service; lit. doing much [bahu + kāra] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning very useful; extremely helpful; of great service; lit. doing much
Construction bahu + kāra
Compound kammadhāraya (bahu + kāra)
Variant bahūpakāra
Commentary (MNa) bahukāro'ti hitakiriyāya bahūpakāro.
Sanskrit bahukāra

Examples

yoniso manasikāro,
dhammo sekhassa bhikkhuno,
n'atth'añño evaṃ bahukāro,
uttam'atthassa pattiyā,
yoniso padahaṃ bhikkhu,
khayaṃ dukkhassa pāpuṇe'ti.

ITI 16 paṭhamasekhasuttaṃ

evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno paccavekkhaṇā bahukārā hoti kusalesu dhammesu

AN 10.51 sacittasuttaṃ
bahukārasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.24 (AN3.24) ✗
bahukārasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.249 (AN4.249) ✗
bahukārasutta 3

nt. Itivuttaka 107 (ITI 107) ✗
bahukicca

adj. busy; with lots to do; with many duties; lit. lots to be done [bahu + kicca] ✓

Meaning busy; with lots to do; with many duties; lit. lots to be done
Construction bahu + kicca

Synonym bahukaraṇīya
Commentary (DNa) bahukiccā'ti balavakiccā. bahukaraṇīyā'ti tass'eva vevacanaṃ.
Sanskrit bahukṛtya

Examples

handa ca dāni mayaṃ, bho gotama, gacchāma. bahukiccā mayaṃ, bahukaraṇīyā'ti. yassadāni tvaṃ, aggivessana, kālaṃ maññasī'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

mayaṃ kho, mārisa moggallāna, bahukiccā bahukaraṇīyā, app'eva sakena karaṇīyena, api ca devānaṃ'y'eva tāvatiṃsānaṃ karaṇīyena.

bahukkhattuṃ

bahujana

masc. multitude; many people; mass of people [bahu + jana] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning multitude; many people; mass of people
Construction bahu + jana
Compound kammadhāraya (bahu + jana)
Variant bahujjana
Commentary (SNa) bahujanassā'ti assutavato andhabālaputhujjanassa.
Sanskrit bahujana

Examples

atha kho sabhiyo paribbājako tassā devatāya santike te pañhe uggahetvā ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇ'ācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā bahujanassa ... te upasaṅkamitvā te pañhe pucchati.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

yā sā vācā n'elā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅ'gamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti.

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
bahujanaasukhāya

nt. for the discomfort of many people [bahujana + asukha + āya] ~

Grammar nt, comp, dat sg of bahujanāsukha
Meaning for the discomfort of many people
Construction bahujana + asukha + āya
bahujanaasukha + āya
Antonym bahujanasukhāya
Synonym bahujanadukkhāya
Variant bahujanāsukhāya
bahujanaahitāya

nt. for the disadvantage of many people; for the harm of the people [bahujana + ahita + āya] ~

Grammar nt, comp, dat sg of bahujanāhita
Meaning for the disadvantage of many people; for the harm of the people
Construction bahujana + ahita + āya
bahujanaahita + āya
Variant bahujanāhitāya
bahujanakanta

adj. pleasing to the people; loved by the people [bahujana + kanta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning pleasing to the people; loved by the people
Construction bahujana + kanta
Compound catutthī tappurisa (bahujanassa + kanta)
Commentary (MNa) nagaravāsino hi yuttakathā honti, pitimattaṃ pitā'ti, bhātimattaṃ bhātā'ti vadanti. evarūpī kathā bahuno janassa kantā hotī'ti bahujanakantā
Sanskrit bahujana + kānta

Example

pharusaṃ vācaṃ pahāya pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato ahosiṃ, yā sā vācā n'elā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅ'gamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā ahosiṃ.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
bahujanadukkhāya

nt. for the discomfort of many people; for the suffering of the masses [bahujana + dukkha + āya] ~

Meaning charming to the people; pleasing to the masses
Construction bahujana + manāpa
Compound catutthī tappurisa (bahujanassa + manāpa)
Commentary (MNa) kantabhāven'eva bahuno janassa manāpā cittavuddhikarā'ti bahujanamanāpā
Sanskrit bahujana + manāpa (bsk)

Example

pharusaṃ vācaṃ pahāya pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato ahosiṃ, yā sā vācā n'elā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅ'gamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā ahosiṃ.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
bahujanasukha

nt. comfort of many people; ease of the masses [bahujana + sukha] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning comfort of many people; ease of the masses
Construction bahujana + sukha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bahujanassa + sukha)
Antonym bahujanāsukha
Sanskrit bahujana + sukha

Examples

ta'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, hoti bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan'ti.

AN 2.40 samacittavaggo

ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū suggahitehi suttantehi (na) byañjanappatirūpakehi atthañ'ca dhammañ'ca anulomenti te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujanahitāya paṭipannā bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ.

AN 2.42 samacittavaggo
bahujanasukhāya

nt. for the comfort of many people; for the ease of the masses [bahujana + sukha + āya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp, dat sg of bahujanasukha
Meaning for the comfort of many people; for the ease of the masses
Construction bahujana + sukha + āya
bahujanasukha + āya
Antonym bahujanāsukhāya
Sanskrit bahujana + sukhāya

Examples

ta'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, hoti bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan'ti.

AN 2.40 samacittavaggo

ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū suggahitehi suttantehi (na) byañjanappatirūpakehi atthañ'ca dhammañ'ca anulomenti te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujanahitāya paṭipannā bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ.

bahujanahitasutta

nt. Itivuttaka 84 (ITI 84) ✗

ta'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, hoti bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan'ti.

AN 2.40 samacittavaggo
bahujanāsukhāya

nt. for the discomfort of many people [bahujana + asukha + āya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp, dat sg of bahujanāsukha, neg
Meaning for the discomfort of many people
Construction bahujana + asukha + āya

Sanskrit bahujana + asukha

Examples

ta'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, hoti bahujan'āhitāya bahujan'āsukhāya, bahuno janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānaṃ.

AN 2.40 samacittavaggo

ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū duggahitehi suttantehi byañjanappatirūpakehi atthañ'ca dhammañ'ca paṭibāhanti te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujan'āhitāya paṭipannā bahujan'āsukhāya, bahuno janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānaṃ.

AN 2.42 samacittavaggo
bahujanāhitāya

nt. for the disadvantage of many people; for the harm of the people [bahujana + ahita + āya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp, dat sg of bahujanāhita, neg
Meaning for the disadvantage of many people; for the harm of the people
Construction bahujana + ahita + āya
bahujanāhita + āya
Antonym bahujanahitāya
Variant bahujanaahitāya
Sanskrit bahujana + ahitāya

Examples

ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū duggahitehi suttantehi byañjanappatirūpakehi atthañ'ca dhammañ'ca paṭibāhanti te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujan'āhitāya paṭipannā bahujan'āsukhāya, bahuno janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānaṃ.

AN 2.42 samacittavaggo

ta'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, hoti bahujan'āhitāya bahujan'āsukhāya, bahuno janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānaṃ.

AN 2.40 samacittavaggo
bahujāgara

adj. wide awake; alert; very lucid [bahu + jāgara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wide awake; alert; very lucid
Construction bahu + jāgara
Compound kammadhāraya (bahu + jāgara)
Sanskrit bahu + jāgara

Examples

appamatto pamattesu,
suttesu bahujāgaro,
abal'assaṃ'va sīghasso,
hitvā yāti sumedhaso.

DHP 29 appamādavaggo

okkhittacakkhu na ca pādalolo,
jhān'ānuyutto bahujāgarassa,
upekkham'ārabbha samāhit'atto,
takk'āsayaṃ kukkucciy'ūpachinde.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
bahujjana

masc. multitude; many people; mass of people [bahu + jana] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning multitude; many people; mass of people
Construction bahu + jana
Compound kammadhāraya (bahu + jana)
Variant bahujana
Sanskrit bahujana

Example

ahaṃ nāgo'va saṅgāme,
cāpato patitaṃ saraṃ,
ativākyaṃ titikkhissaṃ,
dussīlo hi bahujjano.

DHP 320 nāgavaggo
bahutara

adj. more; greater; bigger [√bah + u + tara] ✓

Grammar adj, compar of bahu
Meaning more; greater; bigger
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah + u + tara
bahu + tara
Derivative taddhita (tara)
Synonym atirekatara, para, mahattara, mahattarī, mahantatara
Sanskrit bahutara
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

taṃ kiṃ maññatha bhikkhave, katamaṃ nu kho bahutaraṃ, yo v'āyaṃ mayā paritto nakhasikhāyaṃ paṃsu āropito ayaṃ vā mahāpathavī'ti?

SN 20.2 nakhasikhasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye manussesu paccājāyanti. atha kho ete'y'eva bahutarā sattā ye aññatra manussehi paccājāyanti.

SN 20.2 nakhasikhasuttaṃ
bahutā

fem. numerousness; abundance; lit. fact of being many [√bah + u + tā] ~

Meaning numerousness; abundance; lit. fact of being many
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah + u + tā
bahu + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Antonym appatā
Sanskrit bahutā
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)
bahutta

nt. manifoldness, multiplicity [√bah] ✗
bahutthika

adj. with many women [bahu + itthi + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with many women
Construction bahu + itthi + ka
bahutthi + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Antonym appitthika
Variant bahuitthika, bahukitthika
Sanskrit bahu + strīka

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yāni kānici kulāni bahu'tthikāni appapurisāni tāni suppadhaṃsiyāni honti corehi kumbhatthenakehi.

SN 20.3 kulasuttaṃ
bahudantī

masc. name of an arahant; lit. having many teeth [bahu + dantī] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of an arahant; lit. having many teeth
Construction bahu + dantī
bahudukkha

adj. full of suffering; much suffering [bahu + dukkha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning full of suffering; much suffering
Construction bahu + dukkha
Compound kammadhāraya (bahu + dukkha)
Commentary (SNa) bahudukkhā'ti pañca kāmaguṇe nissāya pattabbadukkhassa bahutāya bahudukkhā. (MNa) bahudukkhā'ti diṭṭhadhammika-samparāyikadukkham'ev'ettha bahukaṃ.
Sanskrit bahu + duḥkha

Examples

app'assādā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo. aṭṭhikaṅkal'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ

kālikā hi, āvuso, kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo. sandiṭṭhiko ayaṃ dhammo akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī'ti.

SN 1.20 samiddhisuttaṃ
bahudeva

sandhi. so much; so big; much of [bahu + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning so much; so big; much of
Construction bahu + [d] + eva
Phonetic Change +d
Sanskrit bahu + eva

Examples

idha pana, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa t'ādisaṃ'y'eva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, n'āṇu'pi khāyati, kiṃ bahu'd'eva.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ

atha kho bhagavā bahu'd'eva rattiṃ abbhokāse nisajjāya vītināmetvā pāde pakkhāletvā vihāraṃ pāvisi. āyasmā'pi kho soṇo bahu'd'eva rattiṃ abbhokāse nisajjāya vītināmetvā pāde pakkhāletvā vihāraṃ pāvisi.

UD 46 soṇasuttaṃ
bahudevarattiṃ

ind. most of the night; much of the evening [bahu + eva + rattiṃ] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning most of the night; much of the evening
Construction bahu + [d] + eva + rattiṃ
Phonetic Change +d
bahudvāra

adj. with many gateways; with many entrances [bahu + dvāra] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with many gateways; with many entrances
Construction bahu + dvāra
Antonym ekadvāra
bahudhana

adj. with many riches ✗
bahudhā

ind. in many ways; in many forms [√bah + u + dhā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from bahu
Meaning in many ways; in many forms
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah + u + dhā
bahu + dhā
Derivative taddhita (dhā)
Sanskrit bahudhā
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

so sace ākaṅkhati, anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhaveyyaṃ, eko'pi hutvā bahudhā assaṃ, bahudhā'pi hutvā eko assaṃ, āvibhāvaṃ tirobhāvaṃ

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ

ātaṅkaphassena khudāya phuṭṭho,
sītaṃ atuṇhaṃ adhivāsayeyya,
so tehi phuṭṭho bahudhā anoko,
vīriyaṃ parakkammadaḷhaṃ kareyya.

aṭṭhakavaggo 16

Meaning having many daughters
Construction bahu + dhītar + a

bahudhītarasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 7.10 (SN7.10) ✗
bahunatta

adj. having many grandchildren; lit. many grandsons [bahu + nattar + a] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having many grandchildren; lit. many grandsons
Construction bahu + nattar + a
bahunattar + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Commentary (VINa) tassā kira dasa puttā dasa dhītaro ahesuṃ, bahū nattāro assā'ti bahunattā.
bahunā

adj. by many; with lots; by much [√bah + u + unā] ✓

Grammar adj, masc and nt instr sg of bahu
Meaning by many; with lots; by much
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah + u + unā
bahu + unā
Sanskrit bahunā
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

satto guhāyaṃ bahunā-abhichanno,
tiṭṭhaṃ naro mohanasmiṃ pagāḷho,
dūre vivekā hi tathāvidho so,
kāmā hi loke na hi suppahāyā.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2

bahunā'pi kho taṃ vibhajeyyaṃ,
pariyāyena t'ādiso dhammo,
saṃkhittam'atthaṃ lapayissāmi,
yāvatā me manasā pariyattaṃ.

Meaning sleeping a lot
Construction bahu + niddā + a

bahuneke

sandhi. some people with lots; lit. some with many [bahunā + eke] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + pron
Meaning some people with lots; lit. some with many
Construction bahunā + eke
Commentary (SNa) bahun'eke na dicchare'ti bahunā'pi bhogena samannāgatā ekacce na dadanti.
Sanskrit bahunā + ekāḥ

Example

appasm'eke pavecchanti,
bahun'eke na dicchare,
appasmā dakkhiṇā dinnā,
sahassena samaṃ mitā'ti.

Meaning name of a pagoda; lit. many sons
Construction bahu + putta

Example

SN 20.3 kulasuttaṃ
bahuppakāra

masc. many kinds; many sorts; lots of types ✗
bahuppada 1

adj. many footed; many legged [bahu + pada] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning many footed; many legged
Construction bahu + pada
Compound kammadhāraya (bahu + pada)
Variant bahuppāda
Commentary (ANa) bahuppadā'ti satapadi'ādayo.
Sanskrit bahupada

Examples

yāvatā, bhikkhave, sattā apadā vā dvipadā vā catuppadā vā bahuppadā vā rūpino vā arūpino vā saññino vā asaññino vā n'evasaññin'āsaññino vā, tathāgato tesaṃ aggam'akkhāyati arahaṃ sammāsambuddho.

AN 10.15 appamādasuttaṃ

apādakehi me mettaṃ,
mettaṃ dvipādakehi me,
catuppadehi me mettaṃ,
mettaṃ bahuppadehi me.

AN 4.67 ahirājasuttaṃ
bahuppada 2

bahubalakāya

AN 7.67 nagaropamasuttaṃ
bahubbīhi

masc. (gram) relative compound; attributive compound; lit. (an area with) lots of rice [bahu + vīhi] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (gram) relative compound; attributive compound; lit. (an area with) lots of rice
Construction bahu + vīhi
Compound kammadhāraya > bahubbīhi (bahu + vīhi)
Sanskrit bahuvrīhi

Examples

328, 352. aññapad'atthesu bahubbīhi.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 328

aññesaṃ padānaṃ atthesu dve nāmāni bahūni nāmāni yadā samasyante, tadā so samāso bahubbīhi sañño hoti.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 328
bahubhaṇḍa

adj. with many goods; having lots of possessions [bahu + bhaṇḍa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with many goods; having lots of possessions
Construction bahu + bhaṇḍa
Synonym bahuparikkhāra
Commentary (ANa) bahubhaṇḍo'ti bahuparikkhāro.
bahubhaṇḍasannicaya

adj. storing up many goods [bahubhaṇḍa + sannicaya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning storing up many goods
Construction bahubhaṇḍa + sannicaya
bahubhaṇda

adj. having an abundance of goods ✗
bahubhāṇisutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.214 (AN5.214) ✗
bahubhāṇī

adj. who speaks a lot; who talks much [bahu + bhāṇī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who speaks a lot; who talks much
Construction bahu + bhāṇī
Compound kammadhāraya (bahu + bhāṇī)
Commentary (ANa) bahubhāṇismin'ti paññāya aparicchinditvā bahuṃ bhaṇante. (JAa) bahubhāṇenā'ti bahubhaṇanena.
Sanskrit bahu + bhāṇin (bsk)

Example

porāṇam'etaṃ atula,
n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva,
nindanti tuṇhim'āsīnaṃ,
nindanti bahubhāṇinaṃ,
mitabhāṇim'pi nindanti,
n'atthi loke anindito.

DHP 227 kodhavaggo
bahubhāva

masc. abundance ✗
bahubherava

adj. full of terrors; very fearful [bahu + bherava] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning full of terrors; very fearful

Compound kammadhāraya (bahu + bherava)
Commentary (SNa) bahubheravan'ti saviññāṇak'āviññāṇakānaṃ bherav'ārammaṇānaṃ vasena bahubheravaṃ.
Sanskrit bahu + bhairava

Example

mah'odadhiṃ aparimitaṃ mahāsaraṃ,
bahubheravaṃ ratanagaṇānam'ālayaṃ,
najjo yathā naragaṇasaṅghasevitā,
puthū savantī upayanti sāgaraṃ.

bahula 1

adj. abundant; full of; lit. lots of [√bah + u + la] ✓

Grammar adj, from bahu
Meaning abundant; full of; lit. lots of
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah + u + la
bahu + la
Derivative taddhita (la)
Synonym ussada, bahulī
Sanskrit bahula
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

tassa evaṃ kicc'āpadesabahulassa viharato anuppannā c'eva bhogā n'uppajjanti, uppannā ca bhogā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.

DN 31.11 siṅgālasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appam'pi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
bahula 2

adj. general; usual; frequent; lit. lots of [√bah + u + la] ✓

Grammar adj, from bahu
Meaning general; usual; frequent; lit. lots of
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah + u + la
bahu + la
Derivative taddhita (la)
Sanskrit bahula
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Example

kathaṃ pana, bho assaji, samaṇo gotamo sāvake vineti, kathaṃbhāgā ca pana samaṇassa gotamassa sāvakesu anusāsanī bahulā pavattatī'ti?

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
bahulatā

fem. abundance [√bah] ✗
bahulatta

nt. abundance; copiousness; plenitude; numerousness [√bah + u + la + tta] ~

Meaning abundance; copiousness; plenitude; numerousness
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah + u + la + tta
bahula + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Sanskrit bahulatva
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)
bahulamakāsi

aor. (+acc) practised often; developed; made much (of) [bahulaṃ + akāsi] ✓

Grammar aor of bahulīkaroti, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning practised often; developed; made much (of)
Construction bahulaṃ + akāsi
Compound comp verb (bahulaṃ + akāsi)
Variant bahulīmakasi, bahulīkāsi
Commentary (MNa) bahulam'akāsī'ti bahulaṃ karoti.
Sanskrit bahulam + akṛṣi

Examples

tasmā't'iha, moggallāna, yathāsaññissa te viharato taṃ middhaṃ okkamati taṃ saññaṃ mā manas'ākāsi taṃ saññaṃ mā bahulam'akāsi

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

vihiṃsāvitakkaṃ ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu bahulam'anuvitakketi anuvicāreti, pahāsi avihiṃsāvitakkaṃ, vihiṃsāvitakkaṃ bahulam'akāsi, tassa taṃ vihiṃsāvitakkāya cittaṃ namati.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ
bahulamanuvitakketi

pr. thinks about a lot; ponders frequently [bahulaṃ + anuvitakketi] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning thinks about a lot; ponders frequently
Construction bahulaṃ + anuvitakketi
Compound comp verb (bahulaṃ + anuvitakketi)
Sanskrit bahulam + anu + vitarkayati

Example

vihiṃsāvitakkaṃ ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu bahulam'anuvitakketi anuvicāreti, pahāsi avihiṃsāvitakkaṃ, vihiṃsāvitakkaṃ bahulam'akāsi, tassa taṃ vihiṃsāvitakkāya cittaṃ namati.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ
bahulamanuvitakkenta

prp. thinking about a lot; pondering frequently [bahulaṃ + anuvitakkenta] ✓

Grammar prp of bahulamanuvitakketi, comp vb
Meaning thinking about a lot; pondering frequently
Construction bahulaṃ + anuvitakkenta
Compound comp verb (bahulaṃ + anuvitakkenta)
Sanskrit bahulam + anu + vitarkayat

Example

tatra'pi sudaṃ soṇadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo etadeva bahulam'anuvitakkento nisinno hoti, ahañ'c'eva kho pana samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ pañhaṃ puccheyyaṃ

DN 4.4 soṇadaṇḍasuttaṃ
bahulaṃ

ind. often; frequently [√bah + u + la + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of bahula
Meaning often; frequently
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah + u + la + aṃ
bahula + aṃ
Synonym abhikkhaṇaṃ, nekadhā
Sanskrit bahulam
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

ye'me pañca kāmaguṇā cetaso samphuṭṭhapubbā atītā niruddhā vipariṇatā, tatra me cittaṃ bahulaṃ gacchamānaṃ gaccheyya paccuppannesu vā appaṃ vā anāgatesu.

SN 35.117 kāmaguṇasuttaṃ

abhijjhālu nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi, anabhijjhālu nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi, byāpannacitto nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi, abyāpannacitto nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi

AN 10.51 sacittasuttaṃ
bahulājīva

adj. with an excessive lifestyle; living in luxury [bahula + ājīva] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with an excessive lifestyle; living in luxury
Construction bahula + ājīva
Synonym sambahulājīva
bahulī

adj. abundant; full of; lit. lots of [√bah + u + la] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from bahula
Meaning abundant; full of; lit. lots of
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah + u + la
bahu + la > bahulī
Derivative taddhita (la)
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Synonym ussada, bahula
Sanskrit bahula
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

yā tesaṃ'y'eva dhammānaṃ āsevanā bhāvanā bahulīkammaṃ, ayaṃ ettha samādhibhāvanā'ti.

MN 44 cūḷavedallasuttaṃ

ānāpānassatisamādhi, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato cattāro satipaṭṭhāne paripūreti, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā bhāvitā bahulīkatā satta bojjh'aṅge paripūrenti, satta bojjh'aṅgā bhāvitā bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiṃ paripūrentī'ti.

SN 54.16 dutiya bhikkhusuttaṃ
bahulīkata

adj. practised often; repeated a lot; done again and again; lit. made a lot [bahula + kata] ✓

Grammar pp of bahulīkaroti, comp vb
Meaning practised often; repeated a lot; done again and again; lit. made a lot
Construction bahula > bahulī + kata
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Compound comp verb (bahula + kata)
Antonym abahulīkata
Commentary (ANa) bahulīkatā'ti punappunaṃ katā.
Sanskrit bahulīkṛta

Examples

ānāpānassatisamādhi, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato cattāro satipaṭṭhāne paripūreti, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā bhāvitā bahulīkatā satta bojjh'aṅge paripūrenti, satta bojjh'aṅgā bhāvitā bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiṃ paripūrentī'ti.

SN 54.16 dutiya bhikkhusuttaṃ

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, kāyagatā sati no bhāvitā bhavissati bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā'ti.

SN 47.20 janapadakalyāṇīsuttaṃ
bahulīkatatta

nt. fact of having practised often; fact of having repeated a lot; fact of having done again and again; lit. made a lot state [bahula + kata + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp, from bahulīkata
Meaning fact of having practised often; fact of having repeated a lot; fact of having done again and again; lit. made a lot state
Construction bahula > bahulī + kata + tta
bahulīkata + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Sanskrit bahulīkṛta + tva

Examples

imesañ'ca pan'āhaṃ, āvuso, catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkantamānusikāya ubho sadde suṇāmi dibbe ca mānuse ca ye dūre santike cā'ti

SN 52.13 dibbasotasuttaṃ

imassa kho, bhikkhave, ekassa indriyassa bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā khīṇ'āsavo bhikkhu aññaṃ byākaroti, khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, n'āparaṃ itthattāyā'ti pajānāmī'ti.

SN 48.45 paṭhamapubbārāmasuttaṃ
bahulīkamma

nt. frequent practice; zealous application; lit. doing often [bahula + kamma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp, from bahulīkaroti
Meaning frequent practice; zealous application; lit. doing often
Construction bahula > bahulī + kamma
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Compound kammadhāraya (bahula + kamma)
Commentary (DSa) bahulīkamman'ti punappunaṃ karaṇaṃ.
Sanskrit bahulī + karman

Examples

yā tesaṃ'y'eva dhammānaṃ āsevanā bhāvanā bahulīkammaṃ, ayaṃ ettha samādhibhāvanā'ti.

MN 44 cūḷavedallasuttaṃ

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, attānaṃ rakkhanto paraṃ rakkhati? āsevanāya, bhāvanāya, bahulīkammena, evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, attānaṃ rakkhanto paraṃ rakkhati.

SN 47.19 sedakasuttaṃ
bahulīkaraṇa

nt. continuous practice, zealous exercise ✗
bahulīkari

aor. took up seriously, increased ✗
bahulīkaroti

pr. (+acc) practices often; devotes oneself (to); cultivates; lit. makes a lot [bahula + karoti] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning practices often; devotes oneself (to); cultivates; lit. makes a lot
Construction bahula > bahulī + karoti
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Compound comp verb (bahula + karoti)
Sanskrit bahulīkaroti

Examples

so taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti. tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni sabbaso pahīyanti anusayā byantīhonti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ

niddaṃ na bahulīkareyya,
jāgariyaṃ bhajeyya ātāpī,
tandiṃ māyaṃ hassaṃ khiḍḍaṃ,
methunaṃ vippajahe savibhūsaṃ.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
bahulīkaronta

Construction bahula > bahulī + karonta
Phonetic Change a > ī before √kar
Compound comp verb (bahula + karonta)
Sanskrit bahulīkurvat

Examples

so taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti. tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni sabbaso pahīyanti anusayā byantīhonti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ

taṃ nimittaṃ āsevantena bhāventena bahulīkarontena mettāya vuttanayen'eva tikacatukkajjhānavasena appanā vaḍḍhetabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā

kaccāyana samāsakappa 330

bahuvacanaggahaṇaṃ kim'atthaṃ? ku'icc'etassa anappatatthesu'pi kvaci kā hoti, kāpurisā.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 336

Example

chetvā vase tam'pi kadā bhavissati.

bahussuta 1

adj. well learned; knowledgeable; lit. much heard [bahu + suta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning well learned; knowledgeable; lit. much heard
Construction bahu + suta
Compound kammadhāraya (bahu + suta)
Antonym appassuta
Commentary (SNa) bahussutassā'ti pariyattibahussutassa paṭivedhabahussutassa ca. (ANa) bahussuto hotī'ti bahuṃ assa sutaṃ hoti, nav'aṅgaṃ satthusāsanaṃ pāḷianusandhipubb'āparavasena uggahitaṃ hotī'ti attho.
Sanskrit bahuśruta

Examples

tasmā hi
dhīrañ'ca paññañ'ca bahussutañ'ca,
dhorayhasīlaṃ vatavantam'ariyaṃ,
taṃ t'ādisaṃ sappurisaṃ sumedhaṃ,
bhajetha nakkhattapathaṃ'va candimā.

DHP 208 sukhavaggo

yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, paris'āvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṃ deseti … evaṃ so ten'aṅgena paripūro hoti.

AN 10.8 jhānasuttaṃ
bahussuta 2

masc. well learned monk; knowledgeable man; lit. much heard [bahu + suta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning well learned monk; knowledgeable man; lit. much heard
Construction bahu + suta
Compound kammadhāraya (bahu + suta)
Sanskrit bahuśruta

Example

paripāceti nāma pubbe adātu'kāmānaṃ akattu'kāmānaṃ, ayyo bhāṇako, ayyo bahussuto, ayyo suttantiko, ayyo vinayadharo, ayyo dhammakathiko, detha ayyassa, karotha ayyassā'ti esā paripāceti nāma.

bahūpakāra

Meaning extremely helpful (for); very useful (for); highly supportive (of); lit. doing so much

Compound kammadhāraya (bahu + upakāra)
Sanskrit bahu + upakāra

Examples

puṇṇo nāma, āvuso, āyasmā mantāṇiputto amhākaṃ navakānaṃ sataṃ bah'ūpakāro hoti. so amhe iminā ovādena ovadati, upādāya, āvuso ānanda, asmī'ti hoti, no anupādāya.

SN 22.83 ānandasuttaṃ

sekhassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno appattamānasassa anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ patthayamānassa viharato ajjhattikaṃ aṅgan'ti karitvā n'āññaṃ ek'aṅgam'pi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ bah'ūpakāraṃ yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, yoniso manasikāro.

SN 47.7 makkaṭasuttaṃ
bādhayati

pr. (+acc) oppresses; torments; afflicts; injures; causes discomfort [√bādh + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of bādhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning oppresses; torments; afflicts; injures; causes discomfort
Root Family √bādh
Root √bādh･1 *aya (press, oppress)
Base √bādh + aya > bādhaya (caus)
Construction bādhaya + ti
Synonym ābādhati
Sanskrit bādhayati
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

Example

kadā nu maṃ tandi khudā pipāsā,
vāt'ātapā kīṭasarīsapā vā,
na bādhayissanti na taṃ giribbaje,
atth'atthiyaṃ taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
bādhayi

aor. oppressed; afflicted; troubled; discomforted [√bādh] ✗
bādhā

fem. hindrance, prevention [√bādh] ✗
bādhi 1

aor. hindered, obstructed, afflicted [√bādh] ✗
bādhi 2

aor. ensnared [√bādh] ✗
bādhita 1

pp. snared; trapped [√bādh + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of bādhati
Meaning snared; trapped
Root Family √bādh
Root √bādh･1 a (press, oppress)
Construction √bādh + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Variant bandhita
Sanskrit bādhita
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

Example

tasiṇāya purakkhatā pajā,
parisappanti saso'va bādhito,
saṃyojanasaṅgasattakā,
dukkham'upenti punappunaṃ cirāya.

DHP 342 taṇhāvaggo
bādhita 2

pp. oppressed, afflicted, harassed [√bādh] ✗
bādhita 3

pp. prevented [√bādh] ✗
bādhitvā 1

abs. having hindered, having obstructed [√bādh] ✗
bādhitvā 2

abs. having afflicted [√bādh] ✗
bādhitvā 3

abs. having ensnared [√bādh] ✗
bādhī

masc. catcher [√bādh + ī] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from bādheti
Meaning catcher
Root Family √bādh
Root √bādh･1 a (press, oppress)
Construction √bādh + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Sanskrit bādhin
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

Example

tena kho pana samayena ariṭṭhassa nāma bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ hoti

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
bādhīyamāna

prp. (+instr) being oppressed (by); being harassed (by) [√bādh + īya + māna] ~

Grammar prp of bādhīyati, pass, intrans (+instr)
Meaning being oppressed (by); being harassed (by)
Root Family √bādh
Root √bādh･1 īya (press, oppress)
Base √bādh + īya > bādhīya (pass)
Construction bādhīya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Sanskrit bādhyamāna
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)
bādhetabba

ptp. could be caught; could be captured; lit. to be caused to oppress [√bādh + *e + tabba] ~

Grammar ptp of bādheti, caus
Meaning could be caught; could be captured; lit. to be caused to oppress
Root Family √bādh
Root √bādh･1 *e (press, oppress)
Base √bādh + e > bādhe (caus)
Construction bādhe + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Notes (SNa) bādhetabbaṃ maññeyyā'ti yathā vinivijjhitvā na nikkhamati, evaṃ paṭibāhitabbaṃ maññeyya bandhitabbaṃ vā.
Sanskrit bādhayitavya
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)
bādheti 1

pr. (+acc) (of fish) catches [√bādh + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of bādhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of fish) catches
Root Family √bādh
Root √bādh･1 *e (press, oppress)
Base √bādh + e > bādhe (caus)
Construction bādhe + ti
Synonym gaṇhāti
Sanskrit bādhayati
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

Example

tena kho pana samayena sambahulā kumārakā antarā ca sāvatthiṃ antarā ca jetavanaṃ macchake bādhenti.

UD 44 kumārakasuttaṃ

bārasa

adj. twelve ✗
bārāṇasī 1

fem. name of a city; modern Varanasi ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning name of a city; modern Varanasi
Sanskrit vārāṇasī

Examples

ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko bārāṇasiyaṃ viharanti isipatane migadāye.

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ

atīte bārāṇasiyaṃ brahmadatte rajjaṃ kārente bodhisatto kāsigāmake kumbhakārakule nibbattitvā kumbhakārakammaṃ katvā puttadāraṃ posesi.

JAa 178 kacchapa jātaka vaṇṇanā
bārāṇasī 2

fem. name of the royal capital of king Kikī [bārāṇasī] ✗
bārāṇasīṇaseyyaka

adj. made in or coming from Benares [bārāṇasī] ✗
bārāṇaseyyaka

adj. coming from Bārāṇasī [bārāṇasī + eyya + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from bārāṇasī
Meaning coming from Bārāṇasī

Sanskrit vārāṇaseya

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma umāpupphaṃ nīlaṃ nīlavaṇṇaṃ nīlanidassanaṃ nīlanibhāsaṃ, seyyathā vā pana taṃ vatthaṃ bārāṇaseyyakaṃ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhaṃ nīlaṃ nīlavaṇṇaṃ nīlanidassanaṃ nīlanibhāsaṃ.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
bāla 1

adj. foolish; ignorant; stupid; immature ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning foolish; ignorant; stupid; immature
Antonym paṇḍita, dhīra, abāla
Synonym andha, apaṇḍita, avicakkhaṇa, aviddasu, duppañña, duppaññajātika, dummedha, dummedhī, bālavant, mūḷharūpa, mogha
Sanskrit bāla

Examples

dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ bahuñ'ca apuññaṃ pasavati

AN 2.135 āyācanavaggo

evam'pi viggayha vivādayanti,
bālo paro akusalo'ti c'āhu,
sacco nu vādo katamo imesaṃ,
sabb'eva h'īme kusalā vadānā.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
bāla 2

masc. fool; idiot; immature person ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning fool; idiot; immature person
Antonym paṇḍita, dhīra
Synonym aviddasu, duppañña, dummedha, manda
Commentary (MNa) bāle ca paṇḍite cā'ti bālā ca paṇḍitā ca.
Notes see SCPN §10 (Eastern Forms)
Sanskrit bāla

Examples

yo bālo maññati bālyaṃ,
paṇḍito v'āpi tena so,
bālo ca paṇḍitamānī,
sa ve bālo'ti vuccati.

DHP 63 bālavaggo

atha pāpāni kammāni,
karaṃ bālo na bujjhati,
sehi kammehi dummedho,
aggidaḍḍho'va tappati.

bāla 3

khādanā apanīyati,

par'āgāresu bhikkhati.

bālakaloṇakāragāma

masc. name of a village; lit. young salt makers village [bālaka + loṇa + kāra + gāma] ~

Meaning name of a village; lit. young salt makers village
Construction bālaka + loṇa + kāra + gāma
Commentary (MNa) bālakaloṇakāragāmo'ti upāligahapatissa bhogagāmo.
bālakī

adj. from the village of Bālaka; living in Bālaka; (or) (comm) very foolish [bālaka + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from bālaka
Meaning from the village of Bālaka; living in Bālaka; (or) (comm) very foolish
Construction bālaka + ī
Commentary (MNa) bālakiniyā'ti upālissa kira bālakaloṇakāragāmo nāma atthi, tato āyaṃ gahetvā manussā āgatā, so, etha bhaṇe, amhākaṃ satthāraṃ mahānigaṇṭhaṃ passissāmā'ti tāya parisāya parivuto tattha agamāsi. taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, bālakiniyā parisāyā'ti, bālakagāmavāsiniyā'ti attho ... apica bālakiniyā'ti bālavatiyā bāl'ussannāyā'ti'pi attho.

Example

tena kho pana samayena nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto mahatiyā gihiparisāya saddhiṃ nisinno hoti bālakiniyā parisāya upālipamukhāya.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
bālakhiḍḍā

fem. childish game; foolish amusement [bāla + khiḍḍā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning childish game; foolish amusement
Construction bāla + khiḍḍā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bālassa + khiḍḍā)
Sanskrit bāla + krīḍā

Example

seyyathāpi, upāli, daharo kumāro mando uttānaseyyako sakena muttakarīsena kīḷati. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, upāli, nanv'āyaṃ kevalā paripūrā bālakhiḍḍā'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

adj. foolish; lit. foolish type [bāla + jātika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning foolish; lit. foolish type
Construction bāla + jātika
Compound kammadhāraya (bāla + jātika)
Antonym abālajātika
Sanskrit bāla + jātīya

Example

tatra, bhikkhave, ye te makkaṭā abālajātikā alolajātikā, te taṃ lepaṃ disvā ārakā parivajjanti. yo pana so hoti makkaṭo bālajātiko lolajātiko, so taṃ lepaṃ upasaṅkamitvā hatthena gaṇhāti.

Example

attani ca, bhikkhave, attaniye ca saccato thetato anupalabbhamāne, yam'pi taṃ diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, so loko so attā, so pecca bhavissāmi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassāmī'ti, nan'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, kevalo paripūro bāladhammo'ti?

nt. chattering of fools; prattling of idiots [bāla + lāpana] ✓

Sanskrit bāla + lāpana

Example

aniccā, bhikkhave, kāmā tucchā musā mosadhammā. māyākatam'etaṃ, bhikkhave, bālalāpanaṃ.

bālalāpinī

fem. chattering of fools; prattle of idiots [bāla + lāpinī] ✓

Commentary (SNa) māyāyaṃ bālalāpinī'ti yv'āyaṃ viññāṇakkhandho nāma, ayaṃ bālamahājanalapāpanikamāyā nāma.
Sanskrit bāla + lāpin

Example

et'ādis'āyaṃ santāno,
māy'āyaṃ bālalāpinī,
vadhako esa akkhāto,
sāro ettha na vijjati.

yo hi, gahapati, imaṃ kāyaṃ pariharanto muhuttam'pi ārogyaṃ paṭijāneyya, kimaññatra bālyā?

bāvariya

Sanskrit bāhulatāntara
bāhā 1

fem. arm; forearm [√bah + *ā] ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning arm; forearm
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah > bāh + *ā
Derivative kita (*ā)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant bāhu
Sanskrit bāhu
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno taṃ puggalaṃ bāhāyaṃ gahetvā bahidvārakoṭṭhakā nikkhāmetvā sūcighaṭikaṃ datvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

so passeyya mahantaṃ alagaddaṃ. tam'enaṃ bhoge vā naṅguṭṭhe vā gaṇheyya. tassa so alagaddo paṭiparivattitvā hatthe vā bāhāya vā aññatarasmiṃ vā aṅgapaccaṅge ḍaṃseyya.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
bāhā 2

fem. post, handle [√bah] ✗

Example

acchariyaṃ, moggallāna, abbhutaṃ, moggallāna! yāva bāhāgahaṇā'pi nāma so moghapuriso āgamessatī'ti

bāhābala

nt. manual labour; hard work; lit. arm strength [bāhā + bala] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning manual labour; hard work; lit. arm strength
Construction bāhā + bala
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bāhānaṃ + bala)
Sanskrit bāhubala

Examples

katamañ'ca, gahapati, atthisukhaṃ? idha, gahapati, kulaputtassa bhogā honti uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā.

AN 4.62 ānaṇyasuttaṃ

kodhanassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa kodh'ābhibhūtassa kodhaparetassa, ye'pi'ssa te honti bhogā uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā, te'pi rājāno rājakosaṃ pavesenti kodh'ābhibhūtassa.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
bāhābalaparicita

adj. built up by hard work; lit. gathered by strength of arm [bāhābala + paricita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning built up by hard work; lit. gathered by strength of arm
Construction bāhābala + paricita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (bāhābalena + paricita)
Sanskrit bāhubala + paricita

Examples

katamañ'ca, gahapati, atthisukhaṃ? idha, gahapati, kulaputtassa bhogā honti uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā.

AN 4.62 ānaṇyasuttaṃ

kodhanassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa kodh'ābhibhūtassa kodhaparetassa, ye'pi'ssa te honti bhogā uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatā bāhābalaparicitā sed'āvakkhittā dhammikā dhammaladdhā, te'pi rājāno rājakosaṃ pavesenti kodh'ābhibhūtassa.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
bāhita

pp. abolished; abandoned; removed; renounced; lit. caused to be outside [√bah + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of bāheti, caus
Meaning abolished; abandoned; removed; renounced; lit. caused to be outside
Root Family √bah
Root √bah･1 *e (be outside)
Base √bah + *e > bāhe (caus)
Construction bāhe + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym paṭinissaṭṭha, pahīna, vippahīna
Notes PED and BHS suggests denominative of bahi rather than causative of √vah
Sanskrit vāhita
Sanskrit Root bahis - (out)

Examples

bāhitapāpo'ti brāhmaṇo,
samacariyā samaṇo'ti vuccati,
pabbājayam'attano malaṃ,
tasmā pabbajito'ti vuccati.

DHP 388 brāhmaṇavaggo

bāhit'āssa honti pāpakā akusalā dhammā saṃkilesikā ponobbhavikā sadarā dukkhavipākā āyatiṃ jātijarāmaraṇiyā

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
bāhitatta

nt. fact of being abolished; fact of being removed; fact of being renounced; lit. caused to be outside state [√bah + *e + ita + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from bāhita, caus
Meaning fact of being abolished; fact of being removed; fact of being renounced; lit. caused to be outside state
Root Family √bah
Root √bah･1 *e (be outside)
Base √bah + *e > bāhe (caus)
Construction bāhe + ita + tta
bāhita + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Notes PED and BHS suggests denominative of bahi rather than causative of √vah
Sanskrit vāhita +
Sanskrit Root bahis - (out)

Example

sattannaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ bāhitattā brāhmaṇo hoti. katamesaṃ sattannaṃ?

AN 7.87 brāhmaṇasuttaṃ
bāhitapāpa

adj. abolished evil; banished wrongdoing [bāhita + pāpa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning abolished evil; banished wrongdoing
Construction bāhita + pāpa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bāhita + pāpaṃ)
Commentary (NIDD1a) bāhitapāpadhammenā'ti pahīnalāmakadhammena.
Sanskrit vāhita + pāpa

Example

bāhitapāpo'ti brāhmaṇo,
samacariyā samaṇo'ti vuccati,
pabbājayam'attano malaṃ,
tasmā pabbajito'ti vuccati.

DHP 388 brāhmaṇavaggo
bāhitapāpatta

nt. fact of having abolished evil; fact of having banished wrongdoing [bāhita + pāpa + tta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp, from bāhitapāpa
Meaning fact of having abolished evil; fact of having banished wrongdoing
Construction bāhita + pāpa + tta
bāhitapāpa + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Sanskrit vāhita + pāpatva
bāhitapāpadhamma

adj. who has removed wrongdoing; who has banished bad things [bāhita + pāpadhamma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has removed wrongdoing; who has banished bad things
Construction bāhita + pāpadhamma
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bāhita + pāpadhamme)
Commentary (NPt) yo brāhmaṇo bāhitapāpadhammattā bāhitapāpadhammo bhave
Sanskrit vāhita + pāpa + dharma

Example

yo brāhmaṇo bāhitapāpadhammo,
nihuṃhuṅko nikkasāvo yat'atto,
vedantagū vūsitabrahmacariyo,
dhammena so brahmavādaṃ vadeyya,
yass'ussadā n'atthi kuhiñ'ci loke'ti.

UD4 huṃhuṅkasuttaṃ
bāhiti

adj. foreign [√bah + *e + iti] ~

Grammar adj, from bahi, caus
Meaning foreign
Root Family √bah
Root √bah･1 *e (be outside)
Base √bah + *e > bāhe (caus)
Construction bāhe + iti
Derivative kita (iti)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit bāhya
Sanskrit Root bahis - (out)
bāhitikasutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 88 (MN88) ✗
bāhitikā 1

fem. foreign [√bah + *e + iti + ikā] ~

Grammar fem, from bāhiti, caus
Meaning foreign
Root Family √bah
Root √bah･1 *e (be outside)
Base √bah + *e > bāhe (caus)
Construction bāhe + iti + ikā
bāhiti + ikā
Derivative taddhita (ikā)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit bāhya
Sanskrit Root bahis - (out)
bāhitikā 2

fem. mantle; cloak; lit. which keeps (the cold) out [√bah] ✗
bāhiteyya

adj. able to be banished; lit. to be caused to carry away [√bah + *e + ita + eyya] ✓

Grammar adj, from bāhita, caus
Meaning able to be banished; lit. to be caused to carry away
Root Family √bah
Root √bah･1 *e (be outside)
Base √bah + *e > bāhe (caus)
Construction bāhe + ita + eyya
bāhita + eyya
Derivative taddhita (eyya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) yathākāmakaraṇīyo bāhiteyyo'ti mayā attano ruciyā yaṃ icchāmi, taṃ kattabbo, bāhitvā ca pana jajjharikāgumbato'pi nīcataro lakuṇḍaṭakataro kātabbo bhavissasī'ti attho.
Notes PED and BHS suggests denominative of bahi rather than causative of √vah
Sanskrit vāhitavya
Sanskrit Root bahis - (out)

Example

sace kho tvaṃ bhikkhu pathaviṃ ajjhosissasi opasāyiko me bhavissasi vatthusāyiko yathākāmakaraṇīyo bāhiteyyo

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
bāhitvā

abs. (+acc) having cast off; having banished; having removed; having expelled; lit. having caused to carry away [√bah + *e + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of bāheti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having cast off; having banished; having removed; having expelled; lit. having caused to carry away
Root Family √bah
Root √bah･1 *e (be outside)
Base √bah + *e > bāhe (caus)
Construction bāhe + itvā
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant bahetvā
Notes PED and BHS suggests denominative of bahi rather than causative of √vah
Sanskrit vāhayitvā
Sanskrit Root bahis - (out)

Example

bāhitvā sabbapāpakāni,
vimalo sādhusamāhito ṭhit'atto,
saṃsāram'aticca kevalī so,
asito tādi pavuccate sa brahmā.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
bāhiya

masc. name of an ascetic; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in quick realization; Bāhiya Dārucīriya; lit. foreigner [√bah + i + *iya] ✓

Grammar masc, from bahi
Meaning name of an ascetic; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in quick realization; Bāhiya Dārucīriya; lit. foreigner
Root Family √bah
Root √bah･1 a (be outside)
Construction √bah > bāh + i + *iya
bahi + *iya
Derivative taddhita (*iya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (AN 1.216) etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ khippābhiññānaṃ yadidaṃ bāhiyo dārucīriyo.
Sanskrit bāhya
Sanskrit Root bahis - (out)

Example

atha kho bāhiyassa dārucīriyassa bhagavato imāya saṃkhittāya dhammadesanāya tāva'd'eva anupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimucci

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ
bāhiyajātaka

nt. Jātaka 108 (JA 108) ✗
bāhiyasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.89 (SN35.89) ✗
bāhiyasutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 47.15 (SN47.15) ✗
bāhiyasutta 3

nt. Udāna 10 (UD 10) ✗
bāhira 1

adj. outer; external [√bah + *i + ra] ✓

Grammar adj, from bahi
Meaning outer; external
Root Family √bah
Root √bah･1 a (be outside)
Construction √bah > bāh + *i + ra
bahi + *ra
Derivative taddhita (*ra)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym ajjhattika
Sanskrit bāhya
Sanskrit Root bahis - (out)

Examples

kathañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhamm'ānupassī viharati chasu ajjhattikabāhiresu āyatanesu?

DN 22.12 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, cha kho, āvuso, ajjhattikāni āyatanāni eko anto, cha bāhirāni āyatanāni dutiyo anto, viññāṇaṃ majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ
bāhira 2

adj. outlying; remote [√bah + *i + ra] ✓

Grammar adj, from bahi
Meaning outlying; remote
Root Family √bah
Root √bah･1 a (be outside)
Construction √bah > bāh + *i + ra
bahi + *ra
Derivative taddhita (*ra)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym parantī
Sanskrit bāhya
Sanskrit Root bahis - (out)

Example

tena hi, bhaṇe, yo bāhiresu janapadesu āyo sañjāyati tato upaḍḍhaṃ antepure pavesetha, upaḍḍhaṃ tatth'eva dānaṃ detha samaṇa-brāhmaṇa-kapaṇ'addhika-vanibbaka-yācakānan'ti.

SN 2.23 serīsuttaṃ
bāhira 3

nt. outside; external [√bah + *i + ra] ✓

Grammar nt, from bahi
Meaning outside; external
Root Family √bah
Root √bah･1 a (be outside)
Construction √bah > bāh + *i + ra
bahi + *ra
Derivative taddhita (*ra)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym ajjhattika
Sanskrit bāhya
Sanskrit Root bahis - (out)

Examples

kiṃ te jaṭāhi dummedha,
kiṃ te ajinasāṭiyā,
abbhantaraṃ te gahanaṃ,
bāhiraṃ parimajjasī'ti.

JA 138 godhajātakaṃ

kadā nu kaṭṭhe ca tiṇe latā ca,
khandhe ime'haṃ amite ca dhamme,
ajjhattikān'eva ca bāhirāni ca,
samaṃ tuleyyaṃ tadidaṃ kadā me.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
bāhiraaniccanandikkhayasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.159 (SN35.159) ✗
bāhiraka 1

adj. outsider; non-Buddhist; of other religions [√bah + *i + ra + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from bāhira
Meaning outsider; non-Buddhist; of other religions
Root Family √bah
Root √bah･1 a (be outside)
Construction √bah > bāh + *i + ra + ka
bāhira + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym ajjhattika
Commentary (SNa) bāhirakā'ti sāsanato bahibhūtā.
Sanskrit bāhya
Sanskrit Root bahis - (out)

Examples

etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, bāhirakānaṃ diṭṭhigatānaṃ yadidaṃ no c'assaṃ, no ca me siyā, na bhavissāmi, na me bhavissatī'ti.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ

ye pana te suttantā kavikatā kāveyyā citt'akkharā cittabyañjanā bāhirakā sāvakabhāsitā, tesu bhaññamānesu sussūsissanti, sotaṃ odahissanti, aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhāpessanti, te ca dhamme uggahetabbaṃ pariyāpuṇitabbaṃ maññissanti.

bāhirālepa

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning medicinal oil for external use
Construction bāhira + ālepa
Commentary (KVt) bāhirālepan'ti tel'ādiṃ.
bāhirāsa

adj. with external desires; full of worldly desire [bāhira + āsa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with external desires; full of worldly desire
Construction bāhira + āsa
Compound kammadhāraya (bāhira + āsa)
Commentary (THa) bāhir'āsassā'ti bāhiresu āyatanesu āsāvato, kāmesu avītarāgassā'ti attho.
Sanskrit bāhya + āśas

Example

unnaḷassa pamattassa,
bāhir'āsassa bhikkhuno,
sīlaṃ samādhi paññā ca,
pāripūriṃ na gacchati.

TH 243 soṇakoḷivisattheragāthā
bāhirima

adj. outermost; external; far outside [√bah + *i + *ra + ima] ✓

Grammar adj, superlative of bāhira
Meaning outermost; external; far outside
Root Family √bah
Root √bah･1 a (be outside)
Construction √bah > bāh + *i + *ra + ima
bāhira + ima
Derivative taddhita (ima)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym abbhantarima
Commentary (VINa) bāhirimena mānenā'ti kuṭiyā bahikuṭṭamānena dvādasa vidatthiyo, minantena pana sabbapaṭhamaṃ dinno mahāmattikapariyanto na gahetabbo.
Sanskrit bāhya
Sanskrit Root bahis - (out)

Example

pamāṇikā kāretabbā. tatr'idaṃ pamāṇaṃ, dīghaso dvādasa vidatthiyo, sugatavidatthiyā'ti bāhirimena mānena.

VIN 1.2.6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ
bāhire

ind. outside; externally; lit. in the outside [√bah + *i + *ra + e] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of bāhira
Meaning outside; externally; lit. in the outside
Root Family √bah
Root √bah･1 a (be outside)
Construction √bah > bāh + *i + *ra + e
bāhira + e
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit bāhyam
Sanskrit Root bahis - (out)

Example

ākāse'va padaṃ n'atthi,
samaṇo n'atthi bāhire,
papañc'ābhiratā pajā,
nippapañcā tathāgatā.

DHP 254 malavaggo
bāhu

masc. arm; forearm [√bah + *u] ✓

Grammar masc, from bahati
Meaning arm; forearm
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah > bāh + *u
Derivative kita (*u)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant bāhā
Sanskrit bāhu
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā codenti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno saṅghamajjhe bāhuvikkhepaṃ karoti.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, sace so puriso taṃ ādittaṃ tiṇ'ukkaṃ na khippam'eva paṭinissajjeyya tassa sā ādittā tiṇ'ukkā hatthaṃ vā daheyya bāhuṃ vā daheyya aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgapaccaṅgaṃ daheyya

MN 54.2 potaliyasuttaṃ
bāhukā

fem. name of a river [√bah + u + *kā] ✓

Grammar fem, from bahu
Meaning name of a river
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah > bāh + u + *kā
Derivative kita (*kā)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) bāhukan'ti idam'eva hi ettha vacanaṃ tadatthadīpakaṃ, sesāni visesatthadīpakāni. yath'eva hi bāhukaṃ, evaṃ adhikakk'ādīni'pi loko gacchati nhānena pāpaṃ pavāhetuṃ.
Sanskrit bāhukā
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Example

gacchati pana bhavaṃ gotamo bāhukaṃ nadiṃ sināyitun'ti? kiṃ, brāhmaṇa, bāhukāya nadiyā? kiṃ bāhukā nadī karissatī'ti?

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
bāhujañña 1

adj. densely populated; populous; lit. having many people [bahu + jana + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from bāhujana
Meaning densely populated; populous; lit. having many people
Construction bahu + jana + ya
bahujana + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Sanskrit bāhujanya

Example

ekam'antaṃ nisinno kho mahānāmo sakko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, idaṃ, bhante, kapilavatthu iddhañ'c'eva phītañ'ca bāhujaññaṃ ākiṇṇamanussaṃ sambādhabyūhaṃ.

Meaning having many people

bahujana + ya
