Sanskrit bāhujanya
bāhujañña 3

adj. belonging to the public ✗
bāhuṭṭhika

nt. arm bone [bāhu + aṭṭhika] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning arm bone
Construction bāhu + aṭṭhika
Compound kammadhāraya (bāhu + aṭṭhika)
Sanskrit bāhu + asthika

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ aṭṭhikāni apagatasambandhāni disā vidisā vikkhittāni, aññena hatth'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena pād'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena gopphak'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena jaṅgh'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena ūru'ṭṭhikaṃ aññena kaṭi'ṭṭhikaṃ aññena phāsuk'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena piṭṭhi'ṭṭhikaṃ aññena khandh'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena bāhu'ṭṭhikaṃ aññena gīv'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena hanuk'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena dant'aṭṭhikaṃ aññena sīsakaṭāhaṃ.

DN 22.7 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
bāhudantī

masc. name of an arahant; lit. having many teeth [bahu + danta + *ī] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of an arahant; lit. having many teeth
Construction bahu > bāhu + danta + *ī
bahudanta + *ī
Derivative taddhita (*ī)
Phonetic Change a > ā
bāhuppacālakasikkhāpada

nt. Sekhiya 17; lit. rule about swinging the arms [bāhuppacālaka + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Sekhiya 17; lit. rule about swinging the arms
Construction bāhuppacālaka + sikkhāpada
bāhuppacālakaṃ

ind. swinging the arms; swaying the arms [bāhu + pacālaka + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of bāhuppacālaka
Meaning swinging the arms; swaying the arms
Construction bāhu + pacālaka + aṃ
bāhuppacālaka + aṃ
Sanskrit bāhu + pracālaka

Examples

na bāhuppacālakaṃ antaraghare gamissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

VIN PAT SE 17 bāhuppacālakasikkhāpadaṃ

na bāhuppacālakaṃ antaraghare gantabbaṃ. bāhuṃ paggahetvā gantabbaṃ. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca bāhuppacālakaṃ antaraghare gacchati bāhuṃ olambento, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.2 ujjagghikavaggo
bāhubalī

adj. strong in the arm; with arm strength [bāhu + balī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning strong in the arm; with arm strength
Construction bāhu + balī
Commentary (MNa) bāhubalī'ti bāhubalasampanno.
bāhumatī

fem. name of a holy river; lit. having strong arms [√bah + *u + mant + ī] ✓

Grammar fem, from bahu
Meaning name of a holy river; lit. having strong arms
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah > bāh + *u + mant + ī
bāhumant + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit bāhumatī
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Example

bāhukaṃ adhikakkañ'ca,
gayaṃ sundarikaṃ m'api,
sarassatiṃ payāgañ'ca,
atho bāhumatiṃ nadiṃ.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
bāhuraggi

masc. name of an arahant ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of an arahant
Variant bahudantī, bahunandi
Sanskrit bāhu + agni

Example

upako palagaṇḍo ca,
pukkusāti ca te tayo,
bhaddiyo khaṇḍadevo ca,
bāhuraggi ca siṅgiyo.
te hitvā mānusaṃ dehaṃ,
dibbayogaṃ upaccagun'ti.

SN 1.50 ghaṭīkārasuttaṃ
bāhulika

adj. excessive; living luxuriously; extravagant [√bah + u + la + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from bahula
Meaning excessive; living luxuriously; extravagant
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah > bāh + u + la + *ika
bahula + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym nabāhulika
Variant bāhullika
Sanskrit bāhulya + ika
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

ye'me, bho gotama, puggalā ... sāmaññe anapekkhavanto sikkhāya na tibbagāravā bāhulikā sāthalikā okkamane pubbaṅ'gamā paviveke nikkhittadhurā ... na tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

idh'āvuso satthu pavivittassa viharato sāvakā vivekaṃ n'ānusikkhanti, yesañ'ca dhammānaṃ satthā pahānam'āha, te ca dhamme nappajahanti, bāhulikā ca honti, sāthalikā, okkamane pubbaṅ'gamā, paviveke nikkhittadhurā

MN 3 dhammadāyādasuttaṃ
bāhulla 1

nt. (+gen) excess (of); over-abundance (of); lit. abundant state [√bah + u + la + *ya] ✓

bahula + *ya

Sanskrit bāhula
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Example

viggāhikāya, moggallāna, kathāya sati kathābāhullaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ
bāhulla 2

nt. luxury; opulence; extravagance; self-indulgence; hedonism; lit. abundant state [√bah + u + la + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from bahula
Meaning luxury; opulence; extravagance; self-indulgence; hedonism; lit. abundant state
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah > bāh + u + la + *ya
bahula + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) āvatto bāhullāyā'ti rasagiddho hutvā paṇītapiṇḍapāt'ādīnaṃ atthāya āvatto.
Sanskrit bāhula
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Example

yato kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, oḷārikaṃ āhāraṃ āhāresiṃ odanakummāsaṃ, atha me te pañca bhikkhū nibbijja pakkamiṃsu, bāhulliko samaṇo gotamo, padhānavibbhanto, āvatto bāhullāyā'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
bāhullaya

nt. abundance, luxurious living [√bah] ✗
bāhullika

adj. excessive; living luxuriously; extravagant; (comm) excessive in requisites [√bah + u + la + *ya + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from bāhulla
Meaning excessive; living luxuriously; extravagant; (comm) excessive in requisites
Root Family √bah
Root √bah×1 a (increase)
Construction √bah > bāh + u + la + *ya + ika
bāhulla + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant bāhulika
Commentary (MNa) bāhulliko'ti paccayabāhulliko. (MNa) bāhulliko'ti cīvarabāhull'ādīnaṃ atthāya paṭipanno.
Sanskrit bāhulya + ika
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

yato kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, oḷārikaṃ āhāraṃ āhāresiṃ odanakummāsaṃ, atha me te pañca bhikkhū nibbijja pakkamiṃsu, bāhulliko samaṇo gotamo, padhānavibbhanto, āvatto bāhullāyā'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

disvāna aññam'aññaṃ saṇṭhapesuṃ, ayaṃ kho, āvuso, samaṇo gotamo āgacchati bāhulliko padhānavibbhanto āvatto bāhullāya. so n'eva abhivādetabbo, na paccuṭṭhātabbo, n'āssa pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
bāhuvikkhepa

masc. arm-waving; gesticulation; lit. throwing around the arms [bāhu + vikkhepa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning arm-waving; gesticulation; lit. throwing around the arms
Construction bāhu + vikkhepa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bāhū + vikkhepa)
Sanskrit bāhuvikṣepa

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā codenti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno saṅghamajjhe bāhuvikkhepaṃ karoti.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ
bāhusacca

Grammar nt, abstr, comp, from bahussuta
Meaning fact of being deeply learned; fact of having profound knowledge
Construction bahu > bāhu + suta > sata + *ya
bahusuta + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
u > a
ty > cc
Sanskrit bahu + śrautya

Examples

ahaṃ kho'mhi bahussuto, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na bahussutā'ti. so tena bāhusaccena attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti. ayam'pi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

sajjhāyakiriyā bāhusaccassa āhāro, sussūsā paripucchā paññāya āhāro

bāheti

pr. (+acc) keeps away, wards off, removes [√bah] ✗
bāhetvā

abs. (+acc) having removed; having dispelled; having driven out; lit. having caused to carry [√bah + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of bāheti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having removed; having dispelled; having driven out; lit. having caused to carry
Root Family √bah
Root √bah･1 *e (be outside)
Base √bah + *e > bāhe (caus)
Construction bāhe + tvā
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym paṭivinodetvā, vinodetvā
Variant bāhitvā
Commentary (DHPa) bāhetvā panuditvā
Notes PED and BHS suggests denominative of bahi rather than causative of √vah
Sanskrit vāhetvā
Sanskrit Root bahis - (out)

Example

yo'dha puññañ'ca pāpañ'ca,
bāhetvā brahmacariyavā,
saṅkhāya loke carati,
sa ve bhikkhū'ti vuccati.

DHP 267 dhammaṭṭhavaggo
bāhesi

aor. (+acc) kept away, warded off, removed [√bah] ✗

masc. fisherman [baḷisa] ✗
bāḷisikopamasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.230 (SN35.230) ✗

Synonym adhimatta
Sanskrit bāḍha
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √baṃh 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

bāḷhagilānasutta

bidala

Meaning drop; drip

DHPa 1.1.9 nandatthera vatthu
bindu 2

nt. (gram) dot over a letter representing the niggahīta letter, represented in Roman script by ṃ, ṁ or ŋ ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning (gram) dot over a letter representing the niggahīta letter, represented in Roman script by ṃ, ṁ or ŋ
Sanskrit bindu

Examples

aṃiti akārato paraṃ yo bindu sūyate, taṃ niggahītaṃ nāma.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa

bindu cūḷāmaṇ'ākāro,
niggahītan'ti vuccate,
kevalass'āppayogattā,
akāro sannidhīyate.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa

SN 20.8 kaliṅgarasuttaṃ
bila 1

nt. (of meat) piece; portion [√bil + a] ✓

Grammar nt, from bilati
Meaning (of meat) piece; portion
Root Family √bil
Root √bil･1 a (break, chop)
Construction √bil + a
Derivative kita (a)
Non IA viḷavu "cleft, crack" (Tamil)
Sanskrit bilma
Sanskrit Root √bil 6, 10 (split)

Examples

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā gāviṃ vadhitvā catumahāpathe bilaso vibhajitvā nisinno assa

DN 22.6 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, ānanda, puriso daliddo assako anāḷhiko, tassa akāmakassa bilaṃ olaggeyyuṃ, idaṃ te, ambho purisa, maṃsañca khāditabbaṃ, mūlañ'ca anuppadātabban'ti.

AN 6.57 chaḷabhijātisuttaṃ
bila 2

nt. den; hole; cave [√bil + a] ✓

Grammar nt, from bilati
Meaning den; hole; cave
Root Family √bil
Root √bil･1 a (break, chop)
Construction √bil + a
Derivative kita (a)
Non IA viḷavu "cleft, crack" (Tamil)
Sanskrit bila
Sanskrit Root √bil 6, 10 (split)

Example

devo ca vassati devo ca gaḷagaḷāyati,
ekako c'āhaṃ bherave bile viharāmi,
tassa mayhaṃ ekakassa bherave bile viharato,
n'atthi bhayaṃ vā chambhitattaṃ vā lomahaṃso vā.

bilaṅgikasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 7.4 (SN7.4) ✗
bilati

pr. (+acc) divides into portions; breaks into pieces [√bil + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning divides into portions; breaks into pieces
Root Family √bil
Root √bil･1 a (break, chop)
Base √bil + a > bila
Construction bila + ti
Sanskrit bilati
Sanskrit Root √bil 6, 10 (split)

Example

yatth'eko labhate babbu,
dutiyo tattha jāyati,
tatiyo ca catuttho ca,
idaṃ te babbukā bilanti.

JA 137 babbu jātakaṃ
bilaso

ind. into pieces; into portions [√bil + a + so] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of bila
Meaning into pieces; into portions
Root Family √bil
Root √bil･1 a (break, chop)
Construction √bil + a + so
bila + so
Derivative taddhita (so)
Sanskrit bilmāt
Sanskrit Root √bil 6, 10 (split)

Example

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā gāviṃ vadhitvā catumahāpathe bilaso vibhajitvā nisinno assa

masc. Viṣṇu ✗
biḷaṅga

masc. sour gruel ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning sour gruel
Synonym thusodaka, sovīraka
Variant bilaṅga
Sanskrit vidagdha

Example

ekam'antaṃ nisinnaṃ kho anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ bhagavā etadavoca, api nu te, gahapati, kule dānaṃ dīyatī'ti? dīyati me, bhante, kule dānaṃ. tañ'ca kho lūkhaṃ kaṇājakaṃ biḷaṅgadutiyan'ti.

AN 9.20 velāmasuttaṃ
biḷāra

masc. cat ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning cat
Synonym babbu, babbuka
Sanskrit biḍāla, viḍāla

Examples

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, biḷāro sandhisamalasaṅkaṭīre ṭhito ahosi mudumūsiṃ maggayamāno, yadā'yaṃ mudumūsi gocarāya pakkamissati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā khādissāmī'ti.

SN 20.10 biḷārasuttaṃ

tathā tu kassāmi yathā'pi issaro,
yaṃ labbhati tena'pi hotu me alaṃ,
na t'āhaṃ kassāmi yathā atandito,
biḷārabhastaṃ'va yathā sumadditaṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
biḷāranikkhamanamatta

adj. big enough for a cat to exit; large enough for a cat to slip out [biḷāra + nikkhamana + matta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning big enough for a cat to exit; large enough for a cat to slip out
Construction biḷāra + nikkhamana + matta
Compound kammadhāraya (biḷāranikkhamana + matta)
Sanskrit biḍāla, viḍāla + niṣkramaṇa + mātra

Example

so tassa nagarassa samantā anupariyāyapathaṃ anukkamati. anupariyāyapathaṃ anukkamamāno na passeyya pākārasandhiṃ vā pākāravivaraṃ vā, antamaso biḷāranikkhamanamattam'pi.

AN 10.95 uttiyasuttaṃ

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning cat-skin bag
Construction biḷāra + bhastā
Compound kammadhāraya (biḷāra + bhastā)
Commentary (MNa) biḷārabhastā'ti biḷāracammapasibbakā.
Sanskrit biḍāla + bhastrā

Examples

tathā tu kassāmi yathā'pi issaro,
yaṃ labbhati tena'pi hotu me alaṃ,
na t'āhaṃ kassāmi yathā atandito,
biḷārabhastaṃ'va yathā sumadditaṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, biḷārabhastā madditā sumadditā suparimadditā, mudukā tūlinī chinnasassarā chinnabhabbharā. atha puriso āgaccheyya kaṭṭhaṃ vā kathalaṃ vā ādāya.

bīja 3

adj. fertile; productive ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning fertile; productive
Sanskrit bīja

Example

MN 27 cūḷa hatthipadopamasuttaṃ
bījagāmabhūtagāma

masc. seeds and plants [bījagāma + bhūtagāma] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning seeds and plants
Construction bījagāma + bhūtagāma
Compound dvanda (bījagāma ca bhūtagāma ca)
Commentary (SNa) bījagāmabhūtagāmā'ti ettha pañcavidham'pi bījaṃ bījagāmo nāma, tadeva paṇṇasampannaṃ nīlabhāvato paṭṭhāya bhūtagāmo'ti veditabbaṃ.
Sanskrit bīja + grāma + bhūtagrāma

Example

seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, ye kec'ime bījagāmabhūtagāmā vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjanti, sabbe te pathaviṃ nissāya pathaviyaṃ patiṭṭhāya. evam'ete bījagāmabhūtagāmā vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjanti.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
bījagāmabhūtagāmasamārambha

masc. injuring seeds and plants [bījagāma + bhūtagāma + samārambha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning injuring seeds and plants
Construction bījagāma + bhūtagāma + samārambha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (bījagāmabhūtagāmaṃ + samārambha)
Commentary (MNa) bījagāmabhūtagāmasamārambhā'ti mūlabījaṃ khandhabījaṃ phaḷubījaṃ aggabījaṃ bījabījanti pañcavidhassa bījagāmassa c'eva yassa kassaci nīlatiṇarukkh'ādikassa bhūtagāmassa ca samārambhā, chedana-bhedana-pacan'ādibhāvena vikopanā paṭivirato'ti attho.
Sanskrit bīja + grāma + bhūtagrāma + samālambha

Example

so bījagāmabhūtagāmasamārambhā paṭivirato ahosiṃ, ekabhattiko ahosiṃ ratt'ūparato virato vikālabhojanā.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
bījasaññī

adj. (+loc) percipient of plant (as); conscious of a plant (as); lit. percipient of seed [bīja + saññī] ✓

Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bījassa + saññī)
Commentary (VINa) bīje bījasaññī'tiādim'āha. tattha yathā, sālīnaṃ ce'pi odanaṃ bhuñjatī'tiādīsu sālitaṇḍulānaṃ odano, sālīnaṃ odano'ti vuccati, evaṃ bījato sambhūto bhūtagāmo, bījan'ti vutto'ti veditabbo.
Sanskrit bīja + saṃjñin

Example

bīje bījasaññī chindati vā chedāpeti vā, bhindati vā bhedāpeti vā, pacati vā pacāpeti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.

DHP 335 taṇhāvaggo

tassā ubhosu tīresu kāsā ce'pi jātā assu, te naṃ ajjholambeyyuṃ, kusā ce'pi jātā assu, te naṃ ajjholambeyyuṃ, pabbajā ce'pi jātā assu, te naṃ ajjholambeyyuṃ, bīraṇā ce'pi jātā assu, te naṃ ajjholambeyyuṃ, rukkhā ce'pi jātā assu, te naṃ ajjholambeyyuṃ.

fem. name of a goddess ✗
bu

abbrev. abbreviation of Buddha(vaṃsa) ✗
bujjhati

pr. (+acc) knows; understands; is aware (of) [√budh + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning knows; understands; is aware (of)
Root Family √budh
Root √budh･3 ya (know, wake up)
Base √budh + ya > bujjha
Construction bujjha + ti
Phonetic Change dhy > jjh
Synonym avabujjhati, ājānāti, jānāti, pajānāti, munāti, vijānāti, vedeti, sampajānāti
Sanskrit budhyate
Sanskrit Root √budh 4, 1 (know, wake)

Examples

atha pāpāni kammāni,
karaṃ bālo na bujjhati,
sehi kammehi dummedho,
aggidaḍḍho'va tappati.

DHP 136 daṇḍavaggo

sārattā kāmabhogesu,
giddhā kāmesu mucchitā,
atisāraṃ na bujjhanti,
migā kūṭaṃ'va oḍḍitaṃ,
pacchā'saṃ kaṭukaṃ hoti,
vipāko hissa pāpako'ti.

SN 3.6 appakasuttaṃ
bujjhana

nt. awakening, attaining knowledge [√budh] ✗
bujjhanaka

adj. intelligent, prudent [√budh] ✗
bujjhanta

prp. knowing, understanding [√budh] ✗
bujjhamāna

prp. being aware of; knowing [√budh + ya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of bujjhati, intrans
Meaning being aware of; knowing
Root Family √budh
Root √budh･3 ya (know, wake up)
Base √budh + ya > bujjha
Construction bujjha + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change dhy > jjh
Synonym jānaṃ, sampajāna
Sanskrit budhyamāna
Sanskrit Root √budh 4, 1 (know, wake)

Example

tato adinnaṃ parivajjayeyya,
kiñci kvaci sāvako bujjhamāno,
na hāraye harataṃ n'ānujaññā,
sabbaṃ adinnaṃ parivajjayeyya.

SNP 26 dhammikasuttaṃ
cūḷavaggo 14
bujjhi

aor. knew, understood, perceived [√budh] ✗
bujjhitabba

ptp. to be known; should be understood [√budh] ✗
bujjhitar

masc. who awakes or becomes enlightened [√budh] ✗
bujjhitvā

abs. having known, having understood, having perceived [√budh] ✗
buḍḍha

adj. aged, old [√vaḍḍh] ✗
buḍḍhatara

adj. older [√vaḍḍh] ✗
buddha 1

masc. Buddha; Awakened One [√budh + ta] ✓

Grammar masc, pp of bujjhati
Meaning Buddha; Awakened One
Root Family √budh
Root √budh･3 ya (know, wake up)
Construction √budh + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Commentary (SNa) buddhassā'ti catunnaṃ saccānaṃ buddhatt'ādīhi kāraṇehi vimokkh'antika-paṇṇattivasena evaṃ laddhanāmassa.
Sanskrit buddha
Sanskrit Root √budh 4, 1 (know, wake)

Examples

aññā hi lābh'ūpanisā,
aññā nibbānagāminī,
evam'etaṃ abhiññāya,
bhikkhu buddhassa sāvako,
sakkāraṃ n'ābhinandeyya,
vivekam'anubrūhaye.

DHP 75 bālavaggo

gāth'ābhigītaṃ me abhojaneyyaṃ,
sampassataṃ brāhmaṇa n'esa dhammo,
gāth'ābhigītaṃ panudanti buddhā,
dhamme satī brāhmaṇa vutti'r'esā.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
buddha 2

pp. awakened; woke up; understood [√budh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of bujjhati
Meaning awakened; woke up; understood
Root Family √budh
Root √budh･3 ya (know, wake up)
Construction √budh + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Commentary (DHPa) catunnaṃ saccānaṃ buddhattā buddhaṃ
Sanskrit buddha
Sanskrit Root √budh 4, 1 (know, wake)

Examples

kiṃ pattinam'āhu bhikkhunaṃ,
sorataṃ kena kathañ'ca dantam'āhu.
buddho'ti kathaṃ pavuccati,
puṭṭho me bhagavā byākarohi.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

chetvā naddhiṃ varattañ'ca,
sandānaṃ sah'anukkamaṃ,
ukkhittapalighaṃ buddhaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 398 brāhmaṇavaggo
buddhakārakadhamma

masc. practices bringing about Buddhahood ✗
buddhakāla

masc. time when a Buddha appears ✗
buddhakicca

nt. Enlightened One's function ✗
buddhakolāhala

masc. announcement about coming of a Buddha ✗
buddhakkhetta

nt. sphere where a Buddha's power exists, Buddha field ✗
buddhagata

adj. immersed in the Buddha; focused on the Buddha; lit. gone to the Buddha [buddha + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning immersed in the Buddha; focused on the Buddha; lit. gone to the Buddha
Construction buddha + gata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (buddhaṃ + gata)
Sanskrit buddha + gata

Example

suppabuddhaṃ pabujjhanti,
sadā gotamasāvakā,
yesaṃ divā ca ratto ca,
niccaṃ buddhagatā sati.

DHP 296 pakiṇṇakavaggo
buddhagarahī

adj. blaming the Buddha; finding fault with the Awakened One [buddha + garahī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning blaming the Buddha; finding fault with the Awakened One
Construction buddha + garahī
Commentary (VINa) na mayaṃ, bhante ānanda, buddhagarahino'ti bhante ānanda, mayaṃ na buddhaṃ garahāma, na buddhassa dosaṃ dema. na dhammagarahino, na saṅghagarahino.
buddhagāthābhigītomhi

sandhi. I was chanted over by the Buddha's verse [buddha + gāthā + abhigīto + amhi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, masc + fem + pp + pr
Meaning I was chanted over by the Buddha's verse
Construction buddha + gāthā + abhigīto + amhi
Sanskrit buddha + gāthā + abhigīta + asmi

Example

sattadhā me phale muddhā,
jīvanto na sukhaṃ labhe,
buddhagāth'ābhigīto'mhi,
no ce muñceyya candiman'ti.

SN 2.9 candimasuttaṃ
buddhaguṇa

masc. virtues of a Buddha ✗
buddhaguṇakathā

fem. discussion of the Buddha's qualities ✗
buddhaguṇā

masc. qualities of a Buddha; special characteristics of a Buddha [buddha + guṇa + ā] ~

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning qualities of a Buddha; special characteristics of a Buddha
Construction buddha + guṇa + ā
buddhaguṇa + ā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (buddhānaṃ + guṇā)
Sanskrit buddha + guṇa
buddhaṅkura

masc. who is destined to be a Buddha ✗
buddhacakkhu

nt. eye of complete understanding; lit. Buddha's eye [buddha + cakkhu] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning eye of complete understanding; lit. Buddha's eye
Construction buddha + cakkhu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (buddhassa + cakkhu)
Commentary (MNa) buddhacakkhunā'ti indriyaparopariyattañāṇena ca āsay'ānusayañāṇena ca. imesañ'hi dvinnaṃ ñāṇānaṃ buddhacakkhūti nāmaṃ, sabbaññutaññāṇassa samantacakkhū'ti, tiṇṇaṃ maggañāṇānaṃ dhammacakkhū'ti.
Sanskrit buddhacakṣus

Example

atha kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmuno ca ajjhesanaṃ viditvā sattesu ca kāruññataṃ paṭicca buddhacakkhunā lokaṃ volokesiṃ.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
buddhañāṇa

nt. Enlightened One's knowledge, boundless knowledge ✗
buddhatā

fem. state of being a Buddha; quality of being enlightened [√budh + ta + tā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, from buddha
Meaning state of being a Buddha; quality of being enlightened
Root Family √budh
Root √budh･3 ya (know, wake up)
Construction √budh + ta + tā
buddha + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Sanskrit Root √budh 4, 1 (know, wake)
buddhatta

nt. Buddhahood; state of being a Buddha [√budh + ta + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from buddha
Meaning Buddhahood; state of being a Buddha
Root Family √budh
Root √budh･3 ya (know, wake up)
Construction √budh + ta + tta
buddha + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Sanskrit buddhatva
Sanskrit Root √budh 4, 1 (know, wake)

Example

ayaṃ buddhattāya abhinīhāraṃ katvā nipanno, samijjhissati imassa patthanā, ito kappasatasahass'ādhikānaṃ catunnaṃ asaṅkhyeyyānaṃ matthake gotamo nāma buddho bhavissati.

masc. son of the Buddha; child of the Buddha; disciple of an awakened one [buddha + putta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp

Construction buddha + putta

Example

tath'ev'ime catubbaṇṇā,

jahanti purimaṃ nāmaṃ,
buddhaputtā'ti ñāyare.

APA 3 sāriputta therāpadānaṃ
buddhapūjā

fem. veneration of the Buddha; offering to the Buddha [buddha + pūjā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning veneration of the Buddha; offering to the Buddha
Construction buddha + pūjā
Compound sattamī tappurisa (buddhe + pūjā)
Sanskrit budhapūjā

Example

yadetaṃ, mahārāja, tathāgato na bhaṇeyya, pattacīvaram'pi attano pariyādāpetvā bhikkhū buddhapūjaṃ y'eva kareyyun'ti. sādhu, bhante nāgasena, evam'etaṃ tathā sampaṭicchāmī'ti.

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho

Construction buddha + pamukha

Sanskrit buddha + pramukha

Examples

atha kho brahmāyu brāhmaṇo satt'āhaṃ buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi.

et'āhaṃ bhante veḷuvanaṃ uyyānaṃ buddhappamukhassa bhikkhusaṅghassa dammī'ti

buddhabhāsita

adj. spoken by the Buddha; preached by the Awakened One [buddha + bhāsita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning spoken by the Buddha; preached by the Awakened One
Construction buddha + bhāsita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (buddhena + bhāsita)
Synonym tathāgatabhāsita
Commentary (VINa) buddhabhāsito'ti sakalaṃ vinayapiṭakaṃ abhidhammapiṭakaṃ dhammapadaṃ cariyāpiṭakaṃ udānaṃ itivuttakaṃ jātakaṃ suttanipāto vimānavatthu petavatthu brahmajāl'ādīni ca suttāni
Sanskrit buddha + bhāṣita

Example

dhammo nāma buddhabhāsito, sāvakabhāsito, isibhāsito, devatābhāsito, atth'ūpasañhito, dhamm'ūpasañhito.

buddhavandanāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 11.17 (SN11.17) ✗
buddhavara

masc. excellent Buddha [buddha + vara] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning excellent Buddha
Construction buddha + vara
Compound kammadhāraya (buddha + vara)
Commentary (THIa) agamī buddhavarassa santikan'ti sammāsambuddhassa santikaṃ upagacchi upasaṅkami.
Sanskrit buddha + vara

Example

muttā ca tato sā bhikkhunī,
agamī buddhavarassa santikaṃ,
passiya varapuññalakkhaṇaṃ,
cakkhu āsi yathā purāṇakan'ti.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
buddhavisaya

masc. (+gen) scope of understanding (of); domain of discernment (of) [buddha + visaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp (+gen)
Meaning scope of understanding (of); domain of discernment (of)
Construction buddha + visaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (buddhānaṃ + visaya)
Commentary (ANa) buddhavisayo'ti buddhānaṃ visayo, sabbaññutaññāṇ'ādīnaṃ buddhaguṇānaṃ pavatti ca ānubhāvo ca.
Sanskrit buddha + viśaya

Example

buddhānaṃ, bhikkhave, buddhavisayo acinteyyo, na cintetabbo, yaṃ cintento ummādassa vighātassa bhāgī assa.

AN 4.77 acinteyyasuttaṃ
buddhaveneyya

adj. to be converted by a Buddha ✗
buddhavevacana

nt. synonym for the Buddha [buddha + vevacana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning synonym for the Buddha
Construction buddha + vevacana
Commentary (VINa) buddhavevacanāni vā'ti buddhassa vā pariyāyanāmāni ... asakyaputtiyassa vā. tattha vaṇṇapaṭṭhāne āgataṃ nāmasahassaṃ upāligāthāsu (ma ni 2.76) nāmasataṃ aññāni ca guṇato labbhamānāni nāmāni buddhavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. sabbāni'pi dhammassa nāmāni dhammavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. esa nayo sabbattha.

buddhasāsana

nt. Buddha’s teaching; Buddha’s message; Buddha’s religion [buddha + sāsana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Buddha’s teaching; Buddha’s message; Buddha’s religion
Construction buddha + sāsana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (buddhassa + sāsana)
Synonym tathāgatasāsana
Sanskrit buddha + śāsana

Examples

bhāvehi jhānāni ca indriyāni ca,
balāni bojjh'aṅgasamādhibhāvanā,
tisso ca vijjā phusa buddhasāsane,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

ārabbhatha nikkhamatha,
yuñjatha buddhasāsane,
dhunātha maccuno senaṃ,
naḷ'āgāraṃ'va kuñjaro.

SN 6.14 aruṇavatīsuttaṃ
buddhasutā

fem. daughter of the Buddha; nun [buddha + sutā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning daughter of the Buddha; nun
Construction buddha + sutā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (buddhassa + sutā)
Commentary (THIa) buddhasutaṃ buddhassa bhagavato orasadhītaraṃ maṃ
Sanskrit buddha + sutā

Example

apathena payātum'icchasi,
candaṃ kīḷanakaṃ gavesasi,
meruṃ laṅghetum'icchasi,
yo tvaṃ buddhasutaṃ maggayasi.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
buddhasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 51.8 (SN51.8) ✗
buddhaseṭṭha

masc. supreme Buddha; foremost Buddha [buddha + seṭṭha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning supreme Buddha; foremost Buddha
Construction buddha + seṭṭha
Compound kammadhāraya (buddha + seṭṭha)
Sanskrit buddha + śreṣṭha

Example

yaṃ buddhaseṭṭho parivaṇṇayī suciṃ,
samādhim'ānantarikañ'ñam'āhu,
samādhinā tena samo na vijjati,
idam'pi dhamme ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1
buddhāna

masc. of Buddhas; of Awakened Ones [√budh + ta + ānaṃ] ~

Grammar masc, gen pl of buddha, irreg
Meaning of Buddhas; of Awakened Ones
Root Family √budh
Root √budh･3 ya (know, wake up)
Construction √budh + ta + ānaṃ > āna
buddhānaṃ > āna
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Sanskrit Root √budh 4, 1 (know, wake)
buddhānamuppāda

masc. arising of Buddhas; coming into existence of Enlightened Beings [buddhānaṃ + uppāda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning arising of Buddhas; coming into existence of Enlightened Beings
Construction buddhānaṃ + uppāda
Compound alutta chaṭṭhī tappurisa (buddhānaṃ + uppāda)
Sanskrit buddhānām + utpāda

Examples

kiccho manussapaṭilābho,
kicchaṃ maccāna jīvitaṃ,
kicchaṃ saddhammassavanaṃ,
kiccho buddhānam'uppādo.

DHP 182 buddhavaggo

sukho buddhānam'uppādo,
sukhā saddhammadesanā,
sukhā saṅghassa sāmaggī,
samaggānaṃ tapo sukho.

DHP 194 buddhavaggo
buddhānavandana

nt. worship of the Buddhas [buddhānaṃ + vandana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning worship of the Buddhas
Construction buddhānaṃ + vandana
Compound alutta chaṭṭhī tappurisa (buddhānaṃ + vandana)
Sanskrit buddhānām + vandana

Example

āraddhavīriye pahit'atte,
niccaṃ daḷhaparakkame,
samagge sāvake passa,
etaṃ buddhāna'vandanaṃ.

API 17 mahāpajāpatigotamītherīapadānaṃ
buddhānasāsana

nt. Buddhas' teaching; Buddhas' message; Buddhas' religion [buddhānaṃ + sāsana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Buddhas' teaching; Buddhas' message; Buddhas' religion
Construction buddhānaṃ + sāsana
Compound alutta chaṭṭhī tappurisa (buddhānaṃ + sāsana)
Commentary (ANa) saraṃ buddhāna'sāsanan'ti buddhānaṃ sāsanaṃ sarantena.
Sanskrit buddha + śāsana

Example

ko sutvā nappasīdeyya,
api kaṇh'ābhijātiyo,
tasmā hi attakāmena,
mahattam'abhikaṅkhatā,
saddhammo garukātabbo,
saraṃ buddhāna'sāsanan'ti.

buddhānaṃ

buddhānubhāva

buddhānussati

fem. reflection on (the qualities of) the Buddha [buddha + anussati] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning reflection on (the qualities of) the Buddha
Construction buddha + anussati
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (buddhassa + anussati)

Sanskrit buddha + anusmṛti

Example

ayaṃ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotaṃ samāpanno buddh'ānussatiṃ bhāveti.

buddhārammaṇa

adj. having its foundation in the Buddha ✗
buddhālambana

adj. having its foundation in the Buddha ✗
buddhāsana

nt. Buddha's seat [buddha + āsana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Buddha's seat
Construction buddha + āsana
buddhi 1

fem. discernment; wisdom; intelligence [√budh + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from bujjhati
Meaning discernment; wisdom; intelligence
Root Family √budh
Root √budh･3 ya (know, wake up)
Construction √budh + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Synonym paṇḍiccā, bhūri, mati, medhā
Sanskrit buddhi
Sanskrit Root √budh 4, 1 (know, wake)

Examples

paññāpāramitaṃ patto,
mahābuddhi mahāmati,
ajaḷo jaḷasamāno,
sadā carati nibbuto.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

ākhyātasāgaram'ath'ajjatanītaraṅgaṃ,
dhātujjalaṃ vikaraṇ'āgamakālamīnaṃ,
lop'ānubandh'ariyam'atthavibhāgatīraṃ,
dhīrā taranti kavino puthubuddhināvā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa, paṭhamakaṇḍa

fem. recognition [√budh] ✗
buddhicarita

nt. intelligent temperament ✗
buddhija

buddhimant

adj. wise, intelligent [√budh] ✗
buddhivisesa

masc. special discernment; individual intelligence; distinction of intelligence [buddhi + visesa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning special discernment; individual intelligence; distinction of intelligence
Construction buddhi + visesa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (buddhiyā + visesa)
Sanskrit buddhi + viśeṣa

Example

sāsan'atthaṃ samuddiṭṭhaṃ,
may'ākhyātaṃ samāsato,
sakaṃ buddhivisesena,
cintayantu vicakkhaṇā.

buddhosmi

sandhi. I am awakened [buddho + asmi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, masc + pr

Example

abhiññeyyaṃ abhiññātaṃ,
bhāvetabbañ'ca bhāvitaṃ,
pahātabbaṃ pahīnaṃ me,
tasmā buddho'smi brāhmaṇa.

TH 253 selattheragāthā
budha 1

masc. wise man [√budh] ✗
budha 2

adj. possessed of wit [√budh] ✗
budha 3

masc. planet Mercury; lit. intelligent [√budh + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from bujjhati
Meaning planet Mercury; lit. intelligent
Root Family √budh
Root √budh･3 ya (know, wake up)
Construction √budh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit budha
Sanskrit Root √budh 4, 1 (know, wake)

Example

ayaṃ vasabhasaṃvacchare hem'anta-utu. asmiṃ utumhi māghamāsassa kāḷapakkhe chaṭṭhamaṃ, budhavāram'idan'ti daṭṭhabbaṃ.

bundi

masc. fire-lighting twig? ✗
bundika

masc. base; foot; lowest part [bundha + ika] ✓

Grammar masc, from bundha
Meaning base; foot; lowest part
Construction bundha + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Commentary (VINa) bundik'ābaddho'ti aṭanīhi mañcapāde ḍaṃsāpetvā pallaṅkasaṅkhepena kato.
Sanskrit budhna

Example

mañco nāma cattāro mañcā, masārako, bundik'ābaddho, kuḷīrapādako, āhaccapādako.

VIN 2.5.2.4 paṭhamasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ
bubbula

nt. bubble [bubbuḷa] ✗
bubbulaka

nt. bubble [bubbuḷa] ✗
bubbuḷa

nt. bubble ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning bubble
Variant pubbuḷa, pubbuḷaka, pupphuḷa
English Cognate bubble
Sanskrit budbuda

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, saradasamaye thullaphusitake deve vassante udake udakabubbuḷaṃ uppajjati c'eva nirujjhati ca.

bubhukkhati

pr. is hungry; lit. wants to eat [√bhuj + kha + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, desid of bhuñjati, intrans
Meaning is hungry; lit. wants to eat
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 kha (use, eat, enjoy)
Base √bhuj + bhuj + sa > bubhukkha (desid)
Construction bubhukkha + ti
Sanskrit bubhukṣati
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Examples

bhuja ghasa hara su pā'icc'evam'ādīhi dhātūhi tum'icch'atthesu kha cha sa'icc'ete paccayā honti vā. bhottum'icchati, bubhukkhati, ghasitum'icchati, jighacchati, haritum'icchati, jigīsati, sotum'icchati, sussusati, pātum'icchati, pivāsati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 434

ādibhūtānaṃ vaṇṇānaṃ ekassarānaṃ kvaci dvebhāvo hoti. titikkhati, jigucchati, tikicchati, vīmaṃsati, bubhukkhati, pivāsati, daddallati, dadāti, jahāti, caṅkamati. kvacī'ti kim'atthaṃ? kampati, calati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 458
bubhukkhi

aor. wished to eat [√bhuj] ✗
bubhukkhita

adj. hungry; lit. wanted to eat [√bhuj + kha + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of bubhukkhati, desid
Meaning hungry; lit. wanted to eat
Root Family √bhuj
Root √bhuj･2 kha (use, eat, enjoy)
Base √bhuj + bhuj + sa > bubhukkha (desid)
Construction bubhukkha + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym chāta
Sanskrit bubhukṣita
Sanskrit Root √bhuj 6, 7 (enjoy)

Example

idh'ūragānaṃ pavaro paviṭṭho,
selassa vaṇṇena pamokkham'icchaṃ,
brahmañ'ca vaṇṇaṃ apacāyamāno,
bubhukkhito no visahāmi bhottuṃ.

JA 154 uraga jātaka
bumū

masc. name of a people [bumu + ū] ~

Grammar masc pl
Meaning name of a people
Construction bumu + ū
buli

masc. name of clan who received a portion of the Buddha's relics ✗
bulubulukārakaṃ

ind. making a splooshing noise ✗
begabbhari

masc. name of a deity; lit. carrying force [vega + bhari] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a deity; lit. carrying force
Construction vega > bega + bhari
Phonetic Change v > b
beda

masc. Veda; sacred Brahmanical scriptures [√vid + *a] ~

Grammar masc, from vedeti
Meaning Veda; sacred Brahmanical scriptures
Root Family √vid
Root √vid･1 a (know)
Construction √vid > ved > bed + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Variant veda
Notes (Apte) ṛgveda, yajurveda and sāmaveda, which are collectively called trayī 'the sacred triad'; but a fourth, the atharvaveda, was subsequently added to them.
Sanskrit veda
Sanskrit Root √vid 1, 2, 6 (know)
belaṭṭhaputta

masc. name of an ascetic teacher; lit. son of Belaṭṭha [belaṭṭha + putta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of an ascetic teacher; lit. son of Belaṭṭha
Construction belaṭṭha + putta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (belaṭṭhassa + putta)
Commentary (SNa) belaṭṭhaputto'ti belaṭṭhassa putto.
Sanskrit vairaṭīputra (bsk)

Examples

ye'pi te, bho gotama, samaṇabrāhmaṇā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā bahujanassa, seyyath'idaṃ, pūraṇo kassapo, makkhali gosālo, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto, sañcayo belaṭṭhaputto, pakudho kaccāyano, ajito kesakambalo

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ

ayam'pi kho sañcayo belaṭṭhaputto saṅghī c'eva gaṇī ca gaṇ'ācariyo ca ñāto yasassī titthakaro sādhusammato bahujanassa.

SN 44.9 kutūhalasālāsuttaṃ

Meaning name of a monk
Construction belaṭṭha + sīsa
Variant veḷaṭṭhasīsa
Commentary (VINa) belaṭṭhasīso nāma jaṭilasahassabbhantaro mahāthero.

beluva 1

masc. wood apple tree; bael tree; Aegle marmelos ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning wood apple tree; bael tree; Aegle marmelos
Variant beḷuva
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aegle_marmelos
Sanskrit bilva

Examples

mahāvanaṃ ajjhogāhetvā beluvalaṭṭhikāya mūle divāvihāraṃ nisīdi

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ

atha kho dasamo gahapati aṭṭhakanāgaro pāṭaliputte taṃ karaṇīyaṃ tīretvā yena vesālī yena beluvagāmako yen'āyasmā ānando ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

MN 52 aṭṭhakanāgarasuttaṃ
beluva 2

nt. wood apple tree; bael tree; Aegle marmelos ~

Grammar nt
Meaning wood apple tree; bael tree; Aegle marmelos
Variant beḷuva
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aegle_marmelos
beluvagāmaka

masc. name of a village; lit. wood apple village [beluva + gāmaka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a village; lit. wood apple village
Construction beluva + gāmaka
Compound kammadhāraya (beluva + gāmaka)
Variant veḷuvagāmaka
Commentary (MNa) beluvagāmake'ti vesāliyā dakkhiṇapasse avidūre beluvagāmako nāma atthi, taṃ gocaragāmaṃ katvā'ti attho.
Sanskrit bilva + grāmaka

Example

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ānando vesāliyaṃ viharati beluvagāmake. tena kho pana samayena dasamo gahapati aṭṭhakanāgaro pāṭaliputtaṃ anuppatto hoti kenaci'd'eva karaṇīyena.

MN 52 aṭṭhakanāgarasuttaṃ

kapilavatthusmiṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto yena mahāvanaṃ ten'upasaṅkami divāvihārāya. mahāvanaṃ ajjhogāhetvā beluvalaṭṭhikāya mūle divāvihāraṃ nisīdi.

AN 10.89 kokālikasuttaṃ
bojjha

nt. understanding; knowledge; (comm) developing the factors of awakening; lit. to be realized [√budh + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, from ptp of bujjhati
Meaning understanding; knowledge; (comm) developing the factors of awakening; lit. to be realized
Root Family √budh
Root √budh･3 ya (know, wake up)
Construction √budh > bodh + *ya
Derivative kicca (*ya)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym veda
Variant bojjhaṅgatapasā
Commentary (SNa) n'āññatra bojjhā tapasā'ti bojjh'aṅgabhāvanañ'ca tapoguṇañ'ca aññatra muñcitvā sotthiṃ na passāmī'ti attho. (SNt) cattāri'pi saccāni bujjhati paṭivijjhatī'ti bodhi, sati'ādidhammasāmaggī, tasmā bojjhā bodhito.
Sanskrit bodhya
Sanskrit Root √budh 4, 1 (know, wake)

Example

n'āññatra bojjhā tapasā,
n'āññatr'indriyasaṃvarā,
n'āññatra sabbanissaggā,
sotthiṃ passāmi pāṇinan'ti.

SN 2.17 subrahmasuttaṃ
bojjhaṅga

masc. element of awakening; factor of enlightenment [bodhi + aṅga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning element of awakening; factor of enlightenment
Construction bodhi + aṅga
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (bodhiyā + aṅga)
Synonym sambodhiyaṅga, sambojjhaṅga
Sanskrit bodhyaṅga

Examples

kathañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhamm'ānupassī viharati sattasu bojjh'aṅgesu

DN 22.13 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

samaṇo, āvuso, gotamo sāvakānaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ deseti, etha tumhe, bhikkhave, pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe satta bojjh'aṅge yathābhūtaṃ bhāvethā'ti.

bojjhasutta

boddhabba

ptp. should be known; should be understood [√budh] ✗
bodha

masc. waking up; understanding; enlightenment [√budh + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from bujjhati
Meaning waking up; understanding; enlightenment
Root Family √budh
Root √budh･3 ya (know, wake up)
Construction √budh > bodh + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (MNa) siyā nu kho eso maggo bodhāyā'ti bhaveyya nu kho etaṃ ānāpānassatipaṭhamajjhānaṃ bujjhan'atthāya maggo'ti.
Sanskrit bodha
Sanskrit Root √budh 4, 1 (know, wake)

Examples

buddho so bhagavā bodhāya dhammaṃ deseti, danto so bhagavā damathāya dhammaṃ deseti, santo so bhagavā samathāya dhammaṃ deseti, tiṇṇo so bhagavā taraṇāya dhammaṃ deseti, parinibbuto so bhagavā parinibbānāya dhammaṃ desetī'ti

MN 35 cūḷa saccakasuttaṃ

na kho pan'āhaṃ imāya kaṭukāya dukkarakārikāya adhigacchāmi uttari manussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanavisesaṃ. siyā nu kho añño maggo bodhāyā'ti?

bodhana

nt. enlightenment, knowledge [√budh] ✗

Construction bodha + pakkha + iya
bodhipakkha + iya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Variant bodhipakkhiya, bodhapakkhika
Commentary (ANa) bodhipakkhiyānaṃ dhammānan'ti satipaṭṭhān'ādīnaṃ sattatiṃsadhammānaṃ.
bodhāyasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.21 (SN46.21) ✗
bodhi 1

fem. enlightenment; awakening [√budh + *i] ✓

Grammar fem, from bujjhati
Meaning enlightenment; awakening
Root Family √budh
Root √budh･3 ya (know, wake up)
Construction √budh > bodh + *i
Derivative kita (*i)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit bodhin
Sanskrit Root √budh 4, 1 (know, wake)

Example

idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako saddho hoti, saddahati tathāgatassa bodhiṃ, iti'pi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho

AN 7.6 vitthatadhanasuttaṃ
bodhi 2

Grammar fem, from bujjhati
Meaning place of the Buddha's enlightenment; lit. awakening

Root √budh･3 ya (know, wake up)
Construction √budh > bodh + *i
Derivative kita (*i)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit bodhi
Sanskrit Root √budh 4, 1 (know, wake)

Example

bodhivandanattha + āya
bodhisatta 1

masc. Buddha before his awakening; lit. awakening being [bodhi + satta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning Buddha before his awakening; lit. awakening being
Construction bodhi + satta
Compound kammadhāraya (bodhi + satta)
Notes (MW) one whose essence is perfect knowledge Bhikkhu Sujāta: Rather than the usual sense of "enlightenment being" (Sanskrit: bodhisattva), it would seem a more relevant sense would be "one striving for awakening" (Sanskrit: bodhiśakta). These two words have different forms in Sanskrit, but are the same in Pali (bodhisatta).
Sanskrit bodhisattva

Examples

pubb'eva me, bhikkhave, sambodhā anabhisambuddhassa bodhisattass'eva sato etadahosi

SN 35.117 kāmaguṇasuttaṃ

atha kh,o bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi

itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.

puna caparaṃ bhikkhave bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ ... sunakhehi vā khajjamānaṃ byagghehi vā khajjamānaṃ dīpīhi vā khajjamānaṃ siṅgālehi vā khajjamānaṃ vividhehi vā pāṇakajātehi khajjamānaṃ

byagghapajja

masc. epithet of the Koliyans; lit. related to the tiger's path [byaggha + pajja] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning epithet of the Koliyans; lit. related to the tiger's path
Construction byaggha + pajja
Compound kammadhāraya (byaggha + pajja)
Commentary (ANa) byagghapajjā'ti te ālapanto evam'āha. kolanagarassa hi kolarukkhe hāretvā katattā kolanagaran'ti ca byagghapathe māpitattā byagghapajjan'ti ca dve nāmāni. etesañ'ca pubbapurisā tattha vasiṃsū'ti byagghapajjavāsitāya byagghapajjavāsino byagghapajjā'ti vuccanti. te ālapanto evam'āha.
Sanskrit vaiyāghrapadya

Example

cattār'imāni, byagghapajjā, pārisuddhipadhāniy'aṅgāni tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena sammadakkhātāni sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya.

tesaṃ no, bhante, āyasmatā mahākaccānena imehi ākārehi imehi padehi imehi byañjanehi attho vibhatto'ti

ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū suggahitehi suttantehi (na) byañjanappatirūpakehi atthañ'ca dhammañ'ca anulomenti te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujanahitāya paṭipannā bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ.

masc. (gram) negative, negation ✗
byatta

adj. experienced; learned; competent; trained; lit. distinguished [vi + √añj + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of byañjayati
Meaning experienced; learned; competent; trained; lit. distinguished
Root Family vi √añj
Root √añj･8 *e (distinguish)
Construction vi > vy > by + √añj + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change vi > by
j > t
Antonym abyatta
Variant viyatta, vyatta
Commentary (SNa) byatto'ti veyyattiyena samannāgato visadañāṇo.
Sanskrit vyakta
Sanskrit Root √añj 7 (anoint)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno evaṃ vadeyya, na tāv'āhaṃ, āvuso, etasmiṃ sikkhāpade sikkhissāmi, yāva na aññaṃ bhikkhuṃ byattaṃ vinayadharaṃ paripucchāmī'ti, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 71 sahadhammikasikkhāpadaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gāvī pabbateyyā paṇḍitā byattā khettaññū kusalā visame pabbate carituṃ.

AN 9.35 gāvīupamāsuttaṃ
byattatara

adj. more experienced; more learned; more competent [vi + √añj + ta + tara] ~

Grammar adj, compar of byatta
Meaning more experienced; more learned; more competent
Root Family vi √añj
Root √añj･8 *e (distinguish)
Construction vi > vy > by + √añj + ta + tara
byatta + tara
Derivative taddhita (tara)
Phonetic Change vi > by
j > t
Sanskrit Root √añj 7 (anoint)
byattaya

masc. (gram) reversal; inversion; change; exception [vi + ati + √i + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning (gram) reversal; inversion; change; exception
Root Family vi ati √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Construction vi > vy > by + ati > aty > att + √i > ay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change vi > by
i > ay
Synonym vipariyāya
Variant vyattaya
Sanskrit vyatyaya
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Example

yāvat'atthī'ti vuccatī'ti yāvatā ete cha ārammaṇā atthī'ti vuccanti. vacanabyattayo veditabbo.

SNPa 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttavaṇṇanā
byatti 1

fem. clarification [vi + √añj + ti] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, from byañjayati
Meaning clarification
Root Family vi √añj
Root √añj･8 *e (distinguish)
Construction vi > vy > by + √añj + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change vi > by
j > t
Sanskrit vyakti
Sanskrit Root √añj 7 (anoint)
byatti 2

fem. particular distinction [vi + √añj] ✗
byatti 3

fem. (logic) extension, pervasion, concomitance [vi + √añj] ✗
byatha

adj. shaky; tottering; wavering; wobbly [√vyath + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from byathati
Meaning shaky; tottering; wavering; wobbly
Root Family √vyath
Root √vyath･1 a (fear, shake)
Construction √vyath > byath + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change v > b
Variant vyatha, vyaya, khyatha
Sanskrit vyathana
Sanskrit Root √vyath 1 (waver)

Examples

cakkhu aniccaṃ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi. rūpā aniccā vipariṇāmino aññathābhāvino. itth'etaṃ dvayaṃ calañ'c'eva byathañ'ca aniccaṃ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi. cakkhuviññāṇaṃ aniccaṃ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi.

SN 35.93 dutiyadvayasuttaṃ

phuṭṭho, bhikkhave, vedeti, phuṭṭho ceteti, phuṭṭho sañjānāti. itth'ete'pi dhammā calā c'eva byathā ca aniccā vipariṇāmino aññathābhāvino.

SN 35.93 dutiyadvayasuttaṃ
byathati

pr. (+gen) shakes; trembles; is afraid (of) [√vyath + a + ti] ~

Grammar pr, intrans (+gen)
Meaning shakes; trembles; is afraid (of)
Root Family √vyath
Root √vyath･1 a (fear, shake)
Base √vyath + a > vyatha > byatha (irreg)
Construction byatha + ti
Phonetic Change v > b
Synonym pavedhati
Commentary (ANa) na byathatī'ti vedhati na chambhati.
Sanskrit vyathate
Sanskrit Root √vyath 1 (waver)
byanta

nt. end; conclusion; finish [vi + anta] ~

Grammar nt, from anta
Meaning end; conclusion; finish
Construction vi > vy > by + anta
Phonetic Change vi > by
Synonym pariyosāna, byanti, vivasāna
Variant vyanta
Sanskrit vyanta
byanti

nt. end; conclusion; finish [vi + anta + i] ✓

Grammar nt, from anta
Meaning end; conclusion; finish
Construction vi > vy > by + anta + i
byanta + i
Derivative taddhita (i)
Phonetic Change vi > by
a > i before √kar
Synonym pariyosāna, byanta, vivasāna
Variant vyanti
Sanskrit vyanta

Examples

vitakk'ūpasame ca yo rato,
asubhaṃ bhāvayate sadā sato,
esa kho byanti kāhiti,
esa checchati mārabandhanaṃ.

DHP 350 taṇhāvaggo

so yāni ca porāṇāni iṇamūlāni tāni ca byantiṃ kareyya

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
byantikata

adj. ended; eliminated; stopped [byanta + kata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning ended; eliminated; stopped
Construction byanta > byanti + kata
Phonetic Change v > b
a > i before √kar
Commentary (SNa) byantikatā'ti ... vigatantā nirantā katā.
byantikaroti

pr. removes; eliminates; gets rid of; puts an end to; lit. makes ending [byanta + karoti] ~

Grammar pr, comp vb, intrans
Meaning removes; eliminates; gets rid of; puts an end to; lit. makes ending
Construction byanta > byantī + karoti
Phonetic Change v > b
a > ī before √kar
Compound comp verb (byanta + karoti)
Synonym niddhamati
Variant vyantīkaroti, byantīkaroti
Sanskrit vyantīkṛ
byantibhāva

masc. (+instr) ending (by); destruction (through) [byanti + bhāva] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp (+instr)
Meaning ending (by); destruction (through)
Construction byanti + bhāva
Compound kammadhāraya (byanti + bhāva)
Variant byantībhāva
Sanskrit vyantībhāva

Example

iti purāṇānaṃ kammānaṃ tapasā byantibhāvā, navānaṃ kammānaṃ akaraṇā, āyatiṃ anavassavo, āyatiṃ anavassavā kammakkhayo, kammakkhayā dukkhakkhayo, dukkhakkhayā vedanākkhayo, vedanākkhayā sabbaṃ dukkhaṃ nijjiṇṇaṃ bhavissatī'ti.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
byantibhūta

adj. (+instr) finished (with); done (with) [byanta + bhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+instr)
Meaning finished (with); done (with)
Construction byanta > byanti + bhūta
Phonetic Change a > i before √bhū
Compound kammadhāraya (byanta + bhūta)
Commentary (ANa) byantibhūtan'ti vigatantabhūtaṃ ekadesenā'pi anallīnaṃ visaṃyuttaṃ visaṃsaṭṭhaṃ ... atha vā byantibhūtan'ti vigatavāyan'ti attho.
Sanskrit vyanta + bhūta

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhante, khīṇ'āsavassa bhikkhuno vivekaninnaṃ cittaṃ hoti vivekapoṇaṃ vivekapabbhāraṃ vivekaṭṭhaṃ nekkhamm'ābhirataṃ byantibhūtaṃ sabbaso āsavaṭṭhāniyehi dhammehi.

AN 8.28 dutiyabalasuttaṃ
byantihoti

pr. is removed; is eliminated; is got rid of; is ended [byanta + hoti] ~

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning is removed; is eliminated; is got rid of; is ended
Construction byanta > byanti + hoti
Phonetic Change v > b
a > i before √hū
Variant byantīhoti, vyantihoti
byantiṃ karoti

idiom. makes an end of; finishes; gets rid of; lit. makes ending ✓

Grammar idiom, nt + pr
Meaning makes an end of; finishes; gets rid of; lit. makes ending
Variant vyantiṃ karoti
Commentary (MNa) byantī kareyyā'ti vigat'antāni kareyya. yathā tesaṃ kākaṇikamattopi pariyanto nāma nāvasissati, evaṃ kareyya, sabbaso paṭiniyyāteyyā'ti attho.

Examples

vitakk'ūpasame ca yo rato,
asubhaṃ bhāvayate sadā sato,
esa kho byanti kāhiti,
esa checchati mārabandhanaṃ.

DHP 350 taṇhāvaggo

so yāni ca porāṇāni iṇamūlāni tāni ca byantiṃ kareyya

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
byantīkata

pp. removed; eliminated; got rid of; put an end to; lit. made end [byanta + kata] ✓

Grammar pp of byantīkaroti, comp vb
Meaning removed; eliminated; got rid of; put an end to; lit. made end
Construction byanta > byantī + kata
Phonetic Change v > b
a > ī before √kar
Compound comp verb (byanta + kata)
Synonym pahīna
Variant vyantīkata
Sanskrit vyantīkṛ

Example

tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate santi adhicittam'anuyuttassa bhikkhuno majjhimasahagatā upakkilesā kāmavitakko byāpādavitakko vihiṃsāvitakko, tam'enaṃ sacetaso bhikkhu dabbajātiko pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
byantīkaroti

pr. removes; eliminates; gets rid of; puts an end to; lit. makes ending [byanta + karoti] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb, intrans
Meaning removes; eliminates; gets rid of; puts an end to; lit. makes ending
Construction byanta > byantī + karoti
Phonetic Change v > b
a > ī before √kar
Compound comp verb (byanta + karoti)
Synonym niddhamati
Variant vyantīkaroti, byantikaroti
Commentary (SNa) na byantīkarotī'ti bhaṅgamattam'pi anavasesento na vigatantaṃ karoti.
Sanskrit vyantīkṛ

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ n'ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti

MN 2.7 sabbāsavasuttaṃ

evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, santi adhicittam'anuyuttassa bhikkhuno oḷārikā upakkilesā kāyaduccaritaṃ vacīduccaritaṃ manoduccaritaṃ, tam'enaṃ sacetaso bhikkhu dabbajātiko pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
byantībhāva

byantīhoti

pr. is removed; is eliminated; is got rid of; is ended [byanta + hoti] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb, intrans
Meaning is removed; is eliminated; is got rid of; is ended
Construction byanta > byantī + hoti
Phonetic Change v > b
a > ī before √hū
Compound comp verb (byanta + hoti)

Commentary (SNa) na byantīkarotī'ti bhaṅgamattam'pi anavasesento na vigatantaṃ karoti.
Sanskrit vyantībhū

Example

so taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti. tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni sabbaso pahīyanti anusayā byantīhonti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
byappatha

masc. way of speech; mode of speaking [vi + ā + √path + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from patha
Meaning way of speech; mode of speaking
Root Family vi ā √path
Root √path･1 a (go, move)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √path + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change vi > by
āp > app
Variant byapathi, vyappathi
Commentary (VINa) byappatho'ti vacanapatho, vācā'y'eva hi aññesam'pi diṭṭh'ānugatim'āpajjantānaṃ pathabhūtato byappatho'ti vuccati.
Notes see PED byappatha for discussion on etymology. ABD suggests vācā + patha
Sanskrit vyāpṛta (busy)
Sanskrit Root √path √panth 1 (go)

Example

ky'āssa byappathayo assu,
ky'āss'assu idha gocarā,
kāni sīlabbatān'āssu,
pahit'attassa bhikkhuno.

aṭṭhakavaggo 16

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
byappanā

fem. focusing; mental fixing; absorbing [vi + √ar + *āpe + anā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, from byappeti, caus
Meaning focusing; mental fixing; absorbing
Root Family vi √ar
Root √ar･1 *āpe (move, attain)
Base √ar + āpe > arāpe > appe (caus, irreg)
Construction vi > vy > by + appe + anā
Derivative kita (anā)
Phonetic Change vi > by
Variant vyappanā
Sanskrit vi + arpaṇa
Sanskrit Root √ṛ 1 (go, send)

Example

yo kho, bhikkhave, ariyacittassa anāsavacittassa ariyamaggasamaṅgino ariyamaggaṃ bhāvayato takko vitakko saṅkappo appanā byappanā cetaso abhiniropanā vacīsaṅkhāro, ayaṃ, bhikkhave, sammāsaṅkappo ariyo anāsavo lok'uttaro maggaṅgo.

MN 117 mahācattārīsakasuttaṃ
byappita

pp. gone away [vi + √ar] ✗
byabhicarati

pr. (gram) is an exception, is irregular [vi + abhi + √car] ✗
byabhicāra

masc. (gram) exception, irregularity [vi + abhi + √car] ✗
byavadhāna

nt. (gram) (a letter which causes) intervention; obstruction; lit. coming in-between [vi + ava + √dhā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from avadhāna
Meaning (gram) (a letter which causes) intervention; obstruction; lit. coming in-between

Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)

Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change vi > by
Variant vyavadhāna
Sanskrit vyavadhāna
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Example

sare'ty'asmiṃ opasilesiko kāsasattamī, tato vaṇṇakālabyavadhāne kāriyaṃ na hoti.

bālāvatāra sarasandhi
byavahāra

masc. business activity; trading; commerce; business dealing [vi + ava + √har + *a] ~

Grammar masc, from voharati
Meaning business activity; trading; commerce; business dealing
Root Family vi ava √har
Root √har･1 a (carry)
Construction vi > vy > by + ava + √har > hār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change v > b
a > ā
Variant vohāra, byohāra
Commentary (MNa) vohāro'ti byavahāravohāro'pi paṇṇatti'pi vacanam'pi cetanā'pi. tattha, yo hi koci manussesu, vohāraṃ upajīvati, evaṃ vāseṭṭha jānāhi, vāṇijo so na brāhmaṇo'ti. (ma. ni. 2.457) ayaṃ byavahāravohāro nāma.
Sanskrit vyavahāra
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

evaṃ dīgharattaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ paccanubhūtaṃ tibbaṃ paccanubhūtaṃ byasanaṃ paccanubhūtaṃ, kaṭasī vaḍḍhitā.

SN 15.1 tiṇakaṭṭhasuttaṃ

yo'pi c'ettha katakusalo hoti, tam'pi ñāti-roga-bhoga-byasana-ādīnaṃ aññatarena byasanena samannāgataṃ disvā vā sutvā vā tesaṃ abhāve'pi vaṭṭadukkhaṃ anatikkantattā, dukkhito'va ayan'ti.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
byasanamāpanna

adj. met with disaster; suffered a calamity [byasanaṃ + āpanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning met with disaster; suffered a calamity
Construction byasanaṃ + āpanna
Phonetic Change ṃ > m
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (byasanaṃ + āpanna)
Sanskrit vyasana + āpanna

Example

ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā ime pañca kāmaguṇe gathitā mucchitā ajjhopannā anādīnavadassāvino anissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjanti, te evam'assu veditabbā, anayam'āpannā byasanam'āpannā yathākāmakaraṇīyā pāpimato.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
byasanasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.130 (AN5.130) ✗
byasanasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 11.6 (AN11.6) ✗
byā

ind. indeed; truly; certainly; exactly [iva] ✓

Grammar ind, emph
Meaning indeed; truly; certainly; exactly
Construction iva > eva > veyya > veyyā > vyā > byā
Phonetic Change v > b
Synonym khu, kho, nāma, hi
Sanskrit iva

Example

evaṃbyākho ahaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā ye'me antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato n'ālaṃ antarāyāyā'ti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
byākata 1

pp. answered; replied; lit. made distinct [vi + ā + √kar + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of byākaroti
Meaning answered; replied; lit. made distinct
Root Family vi ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √kar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change vi > by
rt > t
Antonym abyākata
Variant vyākata
Sanskrit vyākṛta
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Examples

evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, byākataṃ kho, āvuso, amhehi sabbeh'eva yathāsakaṃ paṭibhānaṃ.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ

acchariyaṃ, āvuso, abbhutaṃ, āvuso! yathā taṃ sutavatā sāvakena samma'd'eva satthusāsanaṃ ājānantena, evam'eva āyasmatā puṇṇena mantāṇiputtena gambhīrā gambhīrapañhā anumassa anumassa byākatā.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
byākata 2

pp. taught; defined; explained; lit. made distinct [vi + ā + √kar + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of byākaroti
Meaning taught; defined; explained; lit. made distinct
Root Family vi ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √kar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change vi > by
rt > t
Antonym abyākata
Synonym desita, niddiṭṭha, pavedita

Sanskrit vyākṛta
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Example

maṃ ce'pi tumhe, bhikkhave, etam'atthaṃ paṭipuccheyyātha, aham'pi taṃ evam'evaṃ byākareyyaṃ yathā taṃ mahākaccānena byākataṃ

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ
byākata 3

rt > t

Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Examples

AN 8.23 paṭhamahatthakasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena sambahulehi bhikkhūhi bhagavato santike aññā byākatā hoti, khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, n'āparaṃ itthattāyā'ti pajānāmā'ti.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
byākata 4

nt. answer; reply; lit. made distinct [vi + ā + √kar + ta] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of byākaroti
Meaning answer; reply; lit. made distinct
Root Family vi ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √kar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change vi > by
rt > t
Synonym veyyākaraṇa
Variant vyākata
Sanskrit vyākṛta
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Example

te maṃ catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ upādāy'upādāya pañhaṃ puccheyyuṃ, puṭṭho puṭṭho c'āhaṃ tesaṃ byākareyyaṃ, byākatañ'ca me byākatato dhāreyyuṃ, na ca maṃ dutiyakaṃ uttari paṭipuccheyyuṃ.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
byākataṭṭhāna

nt. declared matter; explained detail [byākata + ṭhāna] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning declared matter; explained detail
Construction byākata + ṭhāna
byākattar

masc. (+acc) who answers; who replies; respondent; lit. who makes distinct [vi + ā + √kar + tar] ~

Grammar masc, agent, from byākaroti, trans (+acc)
Meaning who answers; who replies; respondent; lit. who makes distinct
Root Family vi ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √kar + tar
Derivative kita (tar)
Phonetic Change vi > by
r > t
Variant vyākattar
Sanskrit vyākartṛ
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)
byākaraṇa 1

nt. answering; replying; lit. making distinct [vi + ā + √kar + aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from byākaroti
Meaning answering; replying; lit. making distinct
Root Family vi ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √kar + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Phonetic Change vi > by
Synonym vissajjana
Variant vyākaraṇa
Sanskrit vyākaraṇa
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Example

cattār'imāni, bhikkhave, pañhabyākaraṇāni. katamāni cattāri? atthi, bhikkhave, pañho ek'aṃsabyākaraṇīyo, atthi, bhikkhave, pañho vibhajjabyākaraṇīyo.

AN 4.42 pañhabyākaraṇasuttaṃ
byākaraṇa 2

nt. stating; declaring; announcing; lit. making distinct [vi + ā + √kar + aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from byākaroti
Meaning stating; declaring; announcing; lit. making distinct
Root Family vi ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √kar + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Phonetic Change vi > by

Variant vyākaraṇa
Sanskrit vyākaraṇa
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Example

pañc'imāni, bhikkhave, aññābyākaraṇāni. katamāni pañca?

AN 5.93 byākaraṇasuttaṃ

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
byākaraṇa 4

nt. (gram) prose [vi + ā + √kar] ✗
byākaraṇasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.93 (AN5.93) ✗
byākaraṇasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.84 (AN10.84) ✗
byākaraṇīya

ptp. should be answered; to be replied (to); lit. to be made distinct [vi + ā + √kar + aṇīya] ✓

Grammar ptp of byākaroti
Meaning should be answered; to be replied (to); lit. to be made distinct
Root Family vi ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √kar + aṇīya
Derivative kicca (aṇīya)
Phonetic Change vi > by
Variant vyākaraṇīya
Sanskrit vyākaraṇīya
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Example

sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno ek'aṃsabyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na ek'aṃsena byākaroti, vibhajjabyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na vibhajja byākaroti, paṭipucchābyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na paṭipucchā byākaroti, ṭhapanīyaṃ pañhaṃ na ṭhapeti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ
byākaramāna

prp. (+acc) answering; replying; lit. making distinct [vi + ā + √kar + o + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of byākaroti, trans (+acc)
Meaning answering; replying; lit. making distinct
Root Family vi ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Base √kar + o > karo
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + karo > kara + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change vi > by
Synonym byākaronta, vyākaronta
Variant vyākaramāna
Sanskrit vyākurvāṇa
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Examples

idha no, āvuso sāriputta, bhagavā kiṃvādī kim'akkhāyī, kathaṃ byākaramānā ca mayaṃ vuttavādino c'eva bhagavato assāma, na ca bhagavantaṃ abhūtena abbhācikkheyyāma

SN 12.25 bhūmijasuttaṃ

kacc'āhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ byākaramāno vuttavādī c'eva bhagavato homi, na ca bhagavantaṃ abhūtena abbhācikkhāmi, dhammassa c'ānudhammaṃ byākaromi, na ca koci sahadhammiko vād'ānuvādo gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgacchatī'ti?

Examples

tena hi, gāmaṇi, taññ'ev'ettha paṭipucchissāmi. yathā te khameyya tathā naṃ byākareyyāsī'ti.

SN 42.6 asibandhakaputtasuttaṃ

sādhu sādhu, ānanda, yathā taṃ sāriputto sammā byākaramāno byākareyya. paṭiccasamuppannaṃ kho, ānanda, sukhadukkhaṃ vuttaṃ mayā.

SN 12.25 bhūmijasuttaṃ
byākareyya 3

opt. (+acc) could state; could declare; could announce; lit. should make distinct [vi + ā + √kar + eyya] ✓

Grammar opt of byākaroti, trans (+acc)
Meaning could state; could declare; could announce; lit. should make distinct
Root Family vi ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √kar + eyya
Phonetic Change vi > by
Variant vyākareyya, viyākareyya
Sanskrit vyākaret
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Examples

atha kho āyasmato soṇassa arahattappattassa etadahosi, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkameyyaṃ, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato santike aññaṃ byākareyyan'ti.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ

sādhu sādhu, bhikkhave, yathā te mahāsāvakā sammā byākaramānā byākareyyuṃ, saddakaṇṭakā hi, bhikkhave, jhānā, vuttā mayā.

AN 5.93 byākaraṇasuttaṃ

so ākaṅkhamāno attanāva attānaṃ byākareyya khīṇanirayo'mhi khīṇatiracchānayoni khīṇapettivisayo khīṇ'āpāyaduggativinipāto sot'āpanno'ham'asmi avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo'ti

byākāsi 1

aor. (+acc) answered; replied; lit. made distinct [vi + ā + √kar + si] ✓

Grammar aor of byākaroti, trans (+acc)
Meaning answered; replied; lit. made distinct
Root Family vi ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √kar > kā + si
Phonetic Change vi > by
kar > kā (Kacc 491, 523)
Synonym paccabhāsi, paṭibhāsi, byākāsi, viyākāsi
Variant vyākāsi
Sanskrit vyākṛ
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

Examples

yā me kaṅkhā pure āsi,
taṃ me byākāsi cakkhumā,
addhā munī'si sambuddho,
n'atthi nīvaraṇā tava.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

dv'āhaṃ sakkaṃ apucchissaṃ,
na me byākāsi cakkhumā,
yāvatatiyañ'ca devīsi,
byākarotī'ti me sutaṃ.

Meaning troubles; agitates; disturbs; lit. causes shaking

Construction byāthaya + ti

byāthita

pp. troubled; agitated; shaken; perturbed; reeling [√vyath + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of byathati
Meaning troubled; agitated; shaken; perturbed; reeling

Root √vyath･1 a (fear, shake)

byathita > byāthita

with metrically lengthened ā

Variant vyathita

Sanskrit Root √vyath 1 (waver)

Example

ubbiggā tasitā bhītā,
bhantā byāthitamānasā,
mahājanā samāgamma,
dīpaṅkaram'upāgamuṃ.

BV 2.170 sumedha patthanā kathā
byādāna

nt. averting, turning away ✗
byādiṇṇa

pp. split apart; divided [vi + ā + √dar + na] ✓

Grammar pp of vi ā √dar
Meaning split apart; divided
Root Family vi ā √dar
Root √dar･1 a (break, split apart)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √dar > dir + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change vi > by
a > i
rn > ṇṇ
Antonym abyādiṇṇa
Variant vyādiṇṇa
Sanskrit vyādīrṇa
Sanskrit Root √dṝ √dṛ 2, 9 (pierce, split)

Example

evañ'hi so, bhikkhave, majjhe nadiyā soto vikkhitto visaṭo byādiṇṇo n'eva dūraṅ'gamo assa na sīghasoto na hārahārī .

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ

kiñ'ca, bhikkhave, atthavasaṃ paṭicca, byādhidhammo'mhi, byādhiṃ anatīto'ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā?

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
byādhika

adj. sick; diseased; ill; lit. upset [vi + ā + √dhā + i + ka] ~

Meaning sick; diseased; ill; lit. upset
Root Family vi ā √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √dhā + i + ka
byādhi + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change vi > by
Antonym abyādhika
Synonym akallaka, ātura, ābādhika, gilāna
Variant vyādhika
Commentary (NIDD1a) byādhikan'ti byādhipīḷitaṃ. (MNt) byādhikan'ti sañcātabyādhiṃ.
Sanskrit vyādhi +
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)
byādhita

pp. sick; diseased; afflicted; lit. upset [vi + ā + √dhā + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of byādheti
Meaning sick; diseased; afflicted; lit. upset
Root Family vi ā √dhā
Root √dhā･1 a (place, support)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √dhā + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change vi > by
Variant vyādhita
Sanskrit vyādhita
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu byādhito hoti byādhin'ābhibhūto. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo asamayo padhānāya.

AN 5.54 samayasuttaṃ

ruppanti rūpesu janā pamattā'ti. ruppantī'ti ruppanti kuppanti pīḷiyanti ghaṭṭayanti, byādhitā domanassitā honti.

NIDD2 2.16 piṅgiyamāṇavapucchāniddeso
byādhitapurisa

masc. sick man; diseased person ✗
byādhidhamma

adj. liable to get sick; of a nature to get ill; lit. sickness nature [byādhi + dhamma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning liable to get sick; of a nature to get ill; lit. sickness nature
Construction byādhi + dhamma
Compound kammadhāraya (byādhi + dhamma)
Variant vyādhidhamma
Commentary (MNa) byādhidhammo'ti byādhisabhāvo.
Sanskrit vyādhidharmin

Examples

byādhidhammo'mhi, byādhiṃ anatīto'ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ

byādhidhammaṃ mā byādhiyī'ti n'atthi koci pāṭibhogo, samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā devo vā māro vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmiṃ

AN 4.182 pāṭibhogasuttaṃ
byādhidhammomhi

sandhi. I am liable to get sick; I am subject to disease [byādhi + dhammo + amhi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, masc + masc + pr
Meaning I am liable to get sick; I am subject to disease
Construction byādhi + dhammo + amhi
Sanskrit vyādhidharmin + asmi

Example

byādhidhammo'mhi, byādhiṃ anatīto'ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
byādhinābhibhūta

adj. overcome by sickness; overpowered by illness [byādhinā + abhibhūta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning overcome by sickness; overpowered by illness
Construction byādhinā + abhibhūta
byādhipanudanaosadhi

masc. medicinal herb which dispels illness [byādhi + panudana + osadhi] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning medicinal herb which dispels illness
Construction byādhi + panudana + osadhi
byādhipārijuñña

nt. decline through sickness [byādhi + pārijuñña] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning decline through sickness
Construction byādhi + pārijuñña
byādhippabāḷha

masc. serious illness; severe sickness ✗
byādhibhaya

nt. peril of illness; danger of disease [byādhi + bhaya] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning peril of illness; danger of disease
Construction byādhi + bhaya
Commentary (ANa) tattha jarābhayan'ti jaraṃ paṭicca uppajjanakabhayaṃ. itaresu'pi es'eva nayo. vuttam'pi c'etaṃ, jaraṃ paṭicca uppajjati bhayaṃ bhayānakaṃ chambhitattaṃ lomahaṃso cetaso utrāso. byādhiṃ paṭicca, maraṇaṃ paṭicca uppajjati bhayaṃ bhayānakaṃ chambhitattaṃ lomahaṃso cetaso utrāso'ti (vibha. 921).
byādhimaraṇa

nt. illness and death ✗
byādhiyati

pr. is sick; is ill; is diseased [vi + ā + √dhā + iya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, pass of byādhayati, intrans
Meaning is sick; is ill; is diseased
Root Family vi ā √dhā
Root √dhā･1 iya (place, support)
Base √dhā + iya > dhiya (pass)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + dhiya + ti
Phonetic Change vi > by
Variant byādhīyati, vyādhiyati
Sanskrit vyādhīyate
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)
byādhiyamāna

prp. being sick; being ill [vi + ā + √dhā + iya + māna] ~

Grammar prp of byādhiyati, pass, intrans
Meaning being sick; being ill
Root Family vi ā √dhā
Root √dhā･1 iya (place, support)
Base √dhā + iya > dhiya (pass)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + dhiya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change vi > by
Variant vyādhiyamāna
Sanskrit vyādhīyamāna
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)
byādhiyi

aor. was sick; was ill; was diseased [vi + ā + √dhā + iya + i] ✓

Grammar aor of byādhiyati, pass, intrans
Meaning was sick; was ill; was diseased
Root Family vi ā √dhā
Root √dhā･1 iya (place, support)
Base √dhā + iya > dhiya (pass)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + dhiya + i
Phonetic Change vi > by
Variant byādhīyi, vyādhīyi
Sanskrit vyādhā
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)

Example

byādhidhammaṃ mā byādhiyī'ti n'atthi koci pāṭibhogo, samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā devo vā māro vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmiṃ

AN 4.182 pāṭibhogasuttaṃ
byādhīyati

pr. is sick; is ill; is diseased [vi + ā + √dhā + īya + ti] ~

aor. was sick; was ill; was diseased [vi + ā + √dhā + īya + i] ~

Meaning was sick; was ill; was diseased

Phonetic Change vi > by
Variant byādhiyi, vyādhīyi
Sanskrit vyādhā
Sanskrit Root √dhā 1, 2, 3 (put)
byāpaka 1

adj. coextensive, spread throughout ✗
byāpaka 2

nt. (logic) concomitant ✗
byāpajjati 1

pr. (+acc) hates; dislikes; is repelled (by); is hostile (to) [vi + ā + √pad + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning hates; dislikes; is repelled (by); is hostile (to)
Root Family vi ā √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + pajja + ti
Phonetic Change vi > by
dy > jj
Variant vyāpajjati
Commentary (MNa) byāpajjatī'ti byāpādaṃ uppādeti. (ANa) byāpajjatī'ti pakatiṃ pajahati.
Sanskrit vyāpadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā piyarūpe rūpe adhimuccati, appiyarūpe rūpe byāpajjati, anupaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati parittacetaso.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appam'pi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
byāpajjati 2

pr. (+acc) hurts; harms; injures [vi + ā + √pad + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning hurts; harms; injures
Root Family vi ā √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + pajja + ti
Phonetic Change vi > by
dy > jj
Synonym khanati, tāpayati, dukkhāpeti, dussati, paritāpeti, bādheti, byābādheti, vihiṃsati, hanti, hiṃsati
Variant vyāpajjati
Sanskrit vyāpadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Example

ekako kho pan'āhaṃ araññe viharanto upakkhalitvā vā papateyyaṃ, bhattaṃ vā bhuttaṃ me byāpajjeyya, pittaṃ vā me kuppeyya, semhaṃ vā me kuppeyya

dy > jj

byāpajji

aor. (+acc) hated; disliked; had ill-will (towards); was repelled (by); was hostile (to) [vi + ā + √pad + ya + i] ✓

Grammar aor of byāpajjati, trans (+acc)
Meaning hated; disliked; had ill-will (towards); was repelled (by); was hostile (to)
Root Family vi ā √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Base √pad + ya > pajja
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + pajja + i
Phonetic Change vi > by
dy > jj
Variant vyāpajji
Sanskrit vyāpādi
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Example

yā nūn'āhaṃ bhante, aññaṃ jātiṃ kodhanā ahosiṃ upāyāsabahulā, appam'pi vuttā samānā abhisajjiṃ kuppiṃ byāpajjiṃ patitthīyiṃ kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātvākāsiṃ, s'āhaṃ, bhante, etarahi dubbaṇṇā durūpā supāpikā dassanāya.

AN 4.197 mallikādevīsuttaṃ
byāpatti

fem. failure; disaster; misfortune [vi + ā + √pad + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from byāpajjati
Meaning failure; disaster; misfortune
Root Family vi √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √pad + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change vi > by
d > t
Synonym vipatti
Commentary (NIDD1a) cittassa byāpattī'ti cittassa vipannatā viparivattanākāro.
Sanskrit vyāpatti
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Example

tatra, bhikkhave, tividhā kāyakammantasandosabyāpatti akusalasañcetanikā dukkh'udrayā dukkhavipākā hoti, catubbidhā vacīkammantasandosabyāpatti akusalasañcetanikā dukkh'udrayā dukkhavipākā hoti

AN 10.217 paṭhamasañcetanikasuttaṃ
byāpanicchā

fem. (gram) repetition, reduplication ✗
byāpanna

adj. malevolent; evil; hating; lit. gone wrong [vi + ā + √pad + na] ✓

Grammar pp of byāpajjati
Meaning malevolent; evil; hating; lit. gone wrong
Root Family vi ā √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √pad + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change vi > by
d > n
Synonym pāpimant
Variant vyāpanna
Sanskrit vyāpanna
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Example

byāpannacitto hoti paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo, ime sattā haññantu vā bajjhantu vā ucchijjantu vā vinassantu vā mā vā ahesun'ti

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
byāpannakāyakammanta

adj. malevolent in physical action; lit. gone wrong body action [byāpanna + kāyakammanta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning malevolent in physical action; lit. gone wrong body action
Construction byāpanna + kāyakammanta
Antonym abyāpannakāyakammanta
byāpannacitta

adj. with a malicious mind; evil-minded; hateful; full of ill-will; lit. gone wrong mind [byāpanna + citta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a malicious mind; evil-minded; hateful; full of ill-will; lit. gone wrong mind
Construction byāpanna + citta
Compound kammadhāraya > bahubbīhi (byāpanna + citta)
Antonym abyāpannacitta
Variant vyāpannacitta
Commentary (MNa) byāpannaṃ pūtibhūtaṃ cittam'etesan'ti byāpannacittā.
Sanskrit vyāpannacitta

Examples

byāpannacitto hoti paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo, ime sattā haññantu vā bajjhantu vā ucchijjantu vā vinassantu vā mā vā ahesun'ti

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno abhijjhālussa abhijjhā appahīnā hoti, byāpannacittassa byāpādo appahīno hoti, kodhanassa kodho appahīno hoti

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
byāpannacittapaduṭṭhamanasaṅkappasandosahetu

ind. due to the defilement of being hateful and having bad intention [byāpannacitta + paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappa + sandosahetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to the defilement of being hateful and having bad intention
Construction byāpannacitta + paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappa + sandosahetu
Sanskrit vyāpannacitta + praduṣṭa + manaḥsaṃkalpa + saṃdoṣa + hetu

Example

ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā byāpannacittā paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappā araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti, byāpannacittapaduṭṭhamanasaṅkappasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṃ bhayabheravaṃ avhāyanti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
byāpannacittasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.272 (AN4.272) ✗

byāpannasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.111 (AN3.111) ✗
byāpāda

masc. dislike; ill-will; hatred; hostility; enmity; malevolence; lit. going wrong [vi + ā + √pad + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from byāpajjati
Meaning dislike; ill-will; hatred; hostility; enmity; malevolence; lit. going wrong
Root Family vi ā √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √pad > pād + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change vi > by
a > ā
Antonym abyāpāda
Synonym dosa, manopadosa, sampadosa
Variant vyāpāda
Commentary (ANa) byāpajjati iminā cittaṃ pūtikummās'ādayo viya purimapakatiṃ pajahatī'ti byāpādo.
Sanskrit vyāpāda
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Examples

mettaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. mettañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato yo byāpādo so pahīyissati.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno abhijjhālussa abhijjhā appahīnā hoti, byāpannacittassa byāpādo appahīno hoti, kodhanassa kodho appahīno hoti

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
byāpādacchanda

masc. interest in ill-will; desire for dislike [byāpāda + chanda] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning interest in ill-will; desire for dislike
Construction byāpāda + chanda

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning serving as a basis for dislike; giving support to ill-will
Construction byāpāda + ṭhāniya

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning state of ill-will

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning delight in ill-will; pleasure in hatred

byāpādanīvaraṇa

nt. obstacle of ill-will; hindrance of disliking [byāpāda + nīvaraṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning obstacle of ill-will; hindrance of disliking
Construction byāpāda + nīvaraṇa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (byāpādassa + nīvaraṇa)
Sanskrit vyāpāda + nīvaraṇa

Example

caṅgavāran'ti kho, bhikkhu, pañcann'etaṃ nīvaraṇānaṃ adhivacanaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, kāmacchandanīvaraṇassa, byāpādanīvaraṇassa, thīnamiddhanīvaraṇassa, uddhaccakukkuccanīvaraṇassa, vicikicchānīvaraṇassa.

MN 23 vammikasuttaṃ
byāpādapaccayā

ind. dependent on ill-will; due to enmity [byāpāda + paccayā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning dependent on ill-will; due to enmity
Construction byāpāda + paccayā
Compound abyayībhāva (byāpāda + paccayā)
Sanskrit vyāpāda + pratyayāt

Example

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco ... sahā'pi dukkhena sahā'pi domanassena byāpannacitto hoti, byāpādapaccayā ca dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti

MN 46 mahādhammasamādānasuttaṃ
byāpādapadosa

masc. ill-will and hatred [byāpāda + padosa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ill-will and hatred
Construction byāpāda + padosa
Compound dvanda (byāpāda ca padosa ca)
Variant vyāpādapadosa, byāpādappadosa
Commentary (MNa) ubhayam'etaṃ kodhass'ev'ādhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit vyāpāda + pradoṣa

Example

byāpādapadosaṃ pahāya abyāpannacitto viharati, sabbapāṇabhūtahit'ānukampī byāpādapadosā cittaṃ parisodheti

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
byāpādapariyuṭṭhāna

nt. being obsessed by dislike; being possessed by hatred; being consumed by ill-will [byāpāda + pariyuṭṭhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning being obsessed by dislike; being possessed by hatred; being consumed by ill-will
Construction byāpāda + pariyuṭṭhāna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (byāpādena + pariyuṭṭhāna)
Sanskrit vyāpāda + paryavasthāna

Example

byāpanno kho pana ayam'āyasmā, byāpādapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā bahulaṃ viharati. byāpādapariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānam'etaṃ.

AN 10.86 adhimānasuttaṃ
byāpādapariyuṭṭhita

adj. obsessed by dislike; possessed by hatred; consumed by ill-will [byāpāda + pariyuṭṭhita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning obsessed by dislike; possessed by hatred; consumed by ill-will
Construction byāpāda + pariyuṭṭhita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (byāpādena + pariyuṭṭhita)
Variant vyāpādapariyuṭṭhita
Sanskrit vyāpāda + paryavasthita

Examples

byāpādapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati byāpādaparetena uppannassa ca byāpādassa nissaraṇaṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti. so byāpādaṃ'y'eva antaraṃ katvā jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati avajjhāyati.

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ

sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāmarāgapariyuṭṭhito hoti, pariyuṭṭhitacitto'va hoti. sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhu byāpādapariyuṭṭhito hoti, pariyuṭṭhitacitto'va hoti. sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhu thīnamiddhapariyuṭṭhito hoti, pariyuṭṭhitacitto'va hoti.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
byāpādapariyesanā

fem. quest for ill-will; search for dislike [byāpāda + pariyesanā] ~

Grammar fem, act, comp
Meaning quest for ill-will; search for dislike
Construction byāpāda + pariyesanā
byāpādapariḷāha

masc. fever for ill-will; burning passion for dislike [byāpāda + pariḷāha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fever for ill-will; burning passion for dislike
Construction byāpāda + pariḷāha
byāpādapareta

adj. afflicted with dislike; overcome by ill-will; overwhelmed by dislike [byāpāda + pareta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning afflicted with dislike; overcome by ill-will; overwhelmed by dislike
Construction byāpāda + pareta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (byāpādena + pareta)
Variant vyāpādapareta
Sanskrit vyāpāda + parīta

Example

byāpādapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati byāpādaparetena uppannassa ca byāpādassa nissaraṇaṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti. so byāpādaṃ'y'eva antaraṃ katvā jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati avajjhāyati.

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ
byāpādappadosa

masc. ill-will and hatred [byāpāda + padosa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ill-will and hatred
Construction byāpāda + padosa
