Variant vyāpādapadosa, byāpādapadosa
Sanskrit vyāpāda + pradoṣa

Example

byāpādappadosaṃ pahāya abyāpannacitto viharati, sabbapāṇabhūtahit'ānukampī byāpādappadosā cittaṃ parisodheti.

MN 27 cūḷahatthipadopamasuttaṃ
byāpādavant

adj. full of ill-will; full of hatred; malevolent; lit. having going wrong quality [vi + ā + √pad + *a + vant] ✓

Grammar adj, from byāpāda
Meaning full of ill-will; full of hatred; malevolent; lit. having going wrong quality
Root Family vi ā √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √pad > pād + *a + vant
byāpāda + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Phonetic Change vi > by
a > ā
Antonym abyāpādavant
Variant vyāpādavant
Sanskrit vyāpāda +
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

Example

yena kho, jīvaka, rāgena yena dosena yena mohena byāpādavā assa so rāgo so doso so moho tathāgatassa pahīno ucchinnamūlo tāl'āvatthukato anabhāvaṃkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo.

MN 55 jīvakasuttaṃ
byāpādavitakka

masc. malevolent thought; thought of ill-will [byāpāda + vitakka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning malevolent thought; thought of ill-will
Construction byāpāda + vitakka
Compound kammadhāraya (byāpāda + vitakka)
Antonym abyāpādavitakka
Variant vyāpādavitakka
Commentary (MNa) byāpādavitakko'ti byāpādapaṭisaṃyutto
Sanskrit vyāpāda + vitarka

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso uppannaṃ byāpādavitakkaṃ n'ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti

MN 2.7 sabbāsavasuttaṃ

tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate santi adhicittam'anuyuttassa bhikkhuno majjhimasahagatā upakkilesā kāmavitakko byāpādavitakko vihiṃsāvitakko, tam'enaṃ sacetaso bhikkhu dabbajātiko pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
byāpādasaṅkappa

Meaning malevolent intention; malicious wish; intention of ill-ill
Construction byāpāda + saṅkappa

Antonym abyāpādasaṅkappa
Variant vyāpādasaṅkappa
Sanskrit vyāpāda + saṃkalpa

Example

katamo ca, bhikkhave, micchāsaṅkappo? kāmasaṅkappo, byāpādasaṅkappo, vihiṃsāsaṅkappo, ayaṃ, bhikkhave, micchāsaṅkappo.

byābādha

masc. injury; harm; affliction [vi + ā + √bādh + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from byābādheti
Meaning injury; harm; affliction

Phonetic Change vi > by
Variant vyābādha
Sanskrit vyābādha
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

Examples

idha, bhikkhu, paṇḍito mahāpañño n'ev'attabyābādhāya ceteti na parabyābādhāya ceteti na ubhayabyābādhāya ceteti attahitaparahitaubhayahitasabbalokahitam'eva cintayamāno cinteti

AN 4.186 ummaggasuttaṃ

yaṃ nu kho ahaṃ idaṃ kāyena kammaṃ kattukāmo idaṃ me kāyakammaṃ attabyābādhāya'pi saṃvatteyya, parabyābādhāya'pi saṃvatteyya, ubhayabyābādhāya'pi saṃvatteyya, akusalaṃ idaṃ kāyakammaṃ dukkh'udrayaṃ dukkhavipākan'ti?

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ
byābādheti 1

pr. (+acc) obstructs; impedes; (comm) hurts; harms [vi + ā + √bādh + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of vi ā √bādh, trans (+acc)
Meaning obstructs; impedes; (comm) hurts; harms
Root Family vi ā √bādh
Root √bādh･1 *e (press, oppress)
Base √bādh + e > bādhe (caus)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + bādhe + ti
Phonetic Change vi > by
Variant vyābādheti
Commentary (MNa) na aññam'aññaṃ byābādhentī'ti aññam'aññaṃ na upahananti.
Sanskrit vyābādhayate
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

Example

satt'ime kāyā akaṭā akaṭavidhā animmitā animmātā vañjhā kūṭaṭṭhā esikaṭṭhāyiṭṭhitā, te na iñjanti na vipariṇamanti na aññam'aññaṃ byābādhenti n'ālaṃ aññam'aññassa sukhāya vā dukkhāya vā sukhadukkhāya vā.

MN 76 sandakasuttaṃ
byābādheti 2

pr. (+acc) hurts; harms [vi + ā + √bādh + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of vi ā √bādh, trans (+acc)
Meaning hurts; harms
Root Family vi ā √bādh
Root √bādh･1 *e (press, oppress)
Base √bādh + e > bādhe (caus)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + bādhe + ti
Phonetic Change vi > by
Synonym khanati, tāpayati, dukkhāpeti, paritāpeti, bādheti, byāpajjati, vihiṃsati, hiṃsati
Variant vyābādheti
Commentary (ITIa) na kañci byābādhemī'ti hīn'ādīsu kañci'pi sattaṃ taṇhātas'ādiyogato tasaṃ vā tadabhāvato pahīnasabbakilesavipphanditattā thāvaraṃ vā na bādhemi na dukkhāpemi.
Sanskrit vyābādhayate
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

Example

abyāpajjh'ārāmo, bhikkhave, tathāgato abyāpajjharato. tam'enaṃ, bhikkhave, tathāgataṃ abyāpajjh'ārāmaṃ abyāpajjharataṃ es'eva vitakko bahulaṃ samudācarati, imāy'āhaṃ iriyāya na kiñci byābādhemi tasaṃ vā thāvaraṃ vā'ti.

ITI 38 vitakkasuttaṃ
byābhaṅgihattha

adj. with flail in hand; with a threshing stick in hand [byābhaṅgi + hattha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with flail in hand; with a threshing stick in hand
Construction byābhaṅgi + hattha
Compound sattamī tappurisa (byābhaṅgi + hatthe)
Sanskrit vyābhagna + hasta

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yavakalāpī cātumahāpathe nikkhittā assa. atha cha purisā āgaccheyyuṃ byābhaṅgihatthā. te yavakalāpiṃ chahi byābhaṅgīhi haneyyuṃ. evañ'hi sā, bhikkhave, yavakalāpī suhatā assa chahi byābhaṅgīhi haññamānā.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

api c'āhaṃ, āvuso, imasmiṃ'y'eva byāmamatte kaḷevare sasaññimhi samanake lokañ'ca paññāpemi lokasamudayañ'ca lokanirodhañ'ca lokanirodhagāminiñ'ca paṭipadan'ti.

byāmappabhā

fem. halo extending around the Buddha ✗

byāyamati

pr. makes effort; strives [vi + ā + √yam] ✗

pr. makes effort; strives [vi + ā + √yam] ✗
byāruddha

pp. (+instr) opposed (to); hostile (to); averse (to); at odds (with) [vi + ā + √rudh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of byārujjhati (+instr)
Meaning opposed (to); hostile (to); averse (to); at odds (with)

Root √rudh･2 ṃa (obstruct)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √rudh + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change vi > by
dht > ddh
Synonym paṭiviruddha
Variant vyāruddha
Sanskrit viruddha
Sanskrit Root √rudh 2, 7 (obstruct)

Examples

macche app'odake yathā,
aññam'aññehi byāruddhe,
disvā maṃ bhayam'āvisi.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15

osāne'tv'eva byāruddhe,
disvā me aratī ahu,
ath'ettha sallam'addakkhiṃ,
duddasaṃ hadayanissitaṃ.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
byārosa

masc. causing anger; infuriating [vi + ā + √rus + *e + a] ✓

Grammar masc, act, from byāroseti, caus
Meaning causing anger; infuriating
Root Family vi ā √rus
Root √rus･1 *e (be angry)
Base √rus + *e > rose (caus)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + rose + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change vi > by
u > o
Synonym byārosanā
Variant vyārosa
Sanskrit vyāroṣa
Sanskrit Root √ruṣ 1, 4, 6, 10 (be vexed)

Examples

te'p'ime tayo niruttipathe adhivacanapathe paññattipathe na garahitabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ amaññiṃsu. taṃ kissa hetu? nindā-ghaṭṭana-byārosa-upārambha-bhayā'ti.

SN 22.62 niruttipathasuttaṃ

taṃ kissa hetu? nindā-byārosa-upārambha-bhayā'ti.

MN 117 mahācattārīsakasuttaṃ
byārosanā

fem. causing anger; infuriating [vi + ā + √rus + *e + anā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, from byāroseti, caus
Meaning causing anger; infuriating
Root Family vi ā √rus
Root √rus･1 *e (be angry)
Base √rus + *e > rose (caus)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + rose + anā
Derivative kita (anā)
Phonetic Change vi > by
u > o
Synonym byārosa
Variant vyārosanā
Sanskrit vyāroṣa
Sanskrit Root √ruṣ 1, 4, 6, 10 (be vexed)

Example

na paro paraṃ nikubbetha,
n'ātimaññetha katthaci naṃ kañci,
byārosanā paṭighasaññā,
n'āññam'aññassa dukkham'iccheyya.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ
byāvaṭa 1

pp. (+instr or +loc) engaged (with); occupied (with); employed (with); busy (with); lit. actively involved [vi + ā + √par + ta] ~

Grammar pp of vi ā √par (+instr or +loc)
Meaning engaged (with); occupied (with); employed (with); busy (with); lit. actively involved
Root Family vi ā √par
Root √par×1 a (be active)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √par > var + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change vi > by
p > v
rt > ṭ
Antonym abyāvaṭa
Synonym payutta, pasuta, vihita
Variant vyāvaṭa
Commentary (UDa) byāvaṭo'ti ussukko. (JAa) tattha ahaṃ kammesu byāvaṭo'ti ahaṃ samma pārāvata, rājakammesu byāvaṭo okāsaṃ alabhanto parūḷhakacchanakhalomo ahosin'ti vadati.
Sanskrit vyāpṛta
Sanskrit Root √pṛ 5 (be busy)
byāvaṭa 2

pp. (+loc) worrying (about); fussing (over); concerned (about); taking issue (with); involved (with); lit. actively involved [vi + ā + √par + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of vi ā √par (+loc)
Meaning worrying (about); fussing (over); concerned (about); taking issue (with); involved (with); lit. actively involved
Root Family vi ā √par
Root √par×1 a (be active)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √par > var + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change vi > by
p > v
rt > ṭ
Antonym abyāvaṭa
Synonym apekkhavant
Variant vyāvaṭa
Sanskrit vyāpṛta
Sanskrit Root √pṛ 5 (be busy)

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā codenti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno evam'āha, kiṃ nu kho tumhe āyasmanto atibāḷhaṃ mayi byāvaṭā yāva idān'āhaṃ sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattissāmī'ti.

DHP 287 maggavaggo
byāsiccati

pr. (+loc) is defiled (by); is polluted (by); (comm) is soaked with defilements; lit. is soaked [vi + ā + √sic + ya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, pass of byāsiñcati, intrans (+loc)
Meaning is defiled (by); is polluted (by); (comm) is soaked with defilements; lit. is soaked
Root Family vi ā √sic
Root √sic･2 ya (sprinkle, pour)
Base √sic + ya > sicca (pass)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + sicca + ti
Phonetic Change vi > by
y > c
Variant byāsiñcati
Commentary (SNa) byāsiñcatī'ti viāsiñcati, kilesatintaṃ hutvā vattati.
Sanskrit vyāsiñcati
Sanskrit Root √sic 6 (pour out)
byāsiñcati

pr. (+loc) is defiled (by); is polluted (by); (comm) is soaked with defilements; lit. soaks [vi + ā + √sic + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+loc)
Meaning is defiled (by); is polluted (by); (comm) is soaked with defilements; lit. soaks
Root Family vi ā √sic
Root √sic･2 ṃa (sprinkle, pour)
Base √sic + ṃa > siñca
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + siñca + ti
Phonetic Change vi > by
Variant byāsiccati
Commentary (SNa) byāsiñcatī'ti viāsiñcati, kilesatintaṃ hutvā vattati.
Sanskrit vyāsiñcati
Sanskrit Root √sic 6 (pour out)

Example

man'indriyaṃ asaṃvutassa, bhikkhave, viharato cittaṃ byāsiñcati manoviññeyyesu dhammesu, tassa byāsittacittassa pāmojjaṃ na hoti. pāmojje asati pīti na hoti. pītiyā asati passaddhi na hoti. passaddhiyā asati dukkhaṃ hoti.

VIN PAT SE 43 sakabaḷasikkhāpadaṃ

tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sakabaḷena mukhena byāharanti

VIN 2.7.5 kabaḷavaggo
byāharitabba

ptp. (+instr) should be spoken (with); should talk (with); lit. to be spoken [vi + ā + √har + itabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of byāharati (+instr)
Meaning should be spoken (with); should talk (with); lit. to be spoken
Root Family vi ā √har
Root √har･1 a (carry)
Construction vi > vy > by + ā + √har + itabba
Derivative kicca (itabba)
Phonetic Change vi > by
Variant vyāharitabba
Sanskrit vyāhartavya
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

Example

na sakabaḷena mukhena byāharitabbaṃ. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca sakabaḷena mukhena byāharati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.5 kabaḷavaggo
byūha 1

masc. (of army) array; formation; parade [vi + √yūh + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from byūhati
Meaning (of army) array; formation; parade
Root Family vi √yūh
Root √yūh･1 a (carry, bring)
Construction vi > vy > by + √yūh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change vi > by
Variant vyūha
Sanskrit vyūha
Sanskrit Root √ūh 1 (remove)

Examples

dirattatirattaṃ ce bhikkhu senāya vasamāno uyyodhikaṃ vā bal'aggaṃ vā senābyūhaṃ vā anīkadassanaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 50 uyyodhikasikkhāpadaṃ

cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
byūha 2

nt. alley; alleyway; cul-de-sac [vi + √yūh + a] ✓

Grammar nt, from byūhati
Meaning alley; alleyway; cul-de-sac
Root Family vi √yūh
Root √yūh･1 a (carry, bring)
Construction vi > vy > by + √yūh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change vi > by
Variant vyūha
Commentary (VINa) byūhan'ti anibbijjhitvā ṭhitā gatapaccāgataracchā.
Sanskrit vyūha
Sanskrit Root √ūh 1 (remove)

Example

antaragharaṃ nāma rathikā byūhaṃ siṅghāṭakaṃ gharaṃ.

VIN 2.6.1 paṭhamapāṭidesanīyasikkhāpadaṃ
byūha 3

masc. mass or collection [vi + √yūh] ✗
byūhati

pr. (+acc) shifts; arranges; forms a heap [vi + √yūh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning shifts; arranges; forms a heap
Root Family vi √yūh
Root √yūh･1 a (carry, bring)
Base √yūh + a > yūha
Construction vi > vy > by + yūha + ti
Phonetic Change vi > by
Variant vyūhati
Commentary (VINa) byūhati vā'ti atha pana saussāho'va paṃsuṃ viyūhati, ekapasse rāsiṃ karoti, khaṇanadukkaṭaṃ paṭippassambhati, viyūhanadukkaṭe patiṭṭhāti. (VINt) byūhato'ti paṃsuṃ ekato rāsiṃ karontassa. viyūhati ekapasse rāsiṃ karotī'ti.
Sanskrit vyūhati
Sanskrit Root √ūh 1 (remove)

Example

tattha jātakaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ vā lataṃ vā chindati, āpatti dukkaṭassa. tattha paṃsuṃ khaṇati vā byūhati vā uddharati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
byūḷha

pp. arrayed for battle; assembled; amassed; lit. carried apart [vi + √yūh + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of viyūhati
Meaning arrayed for battle; assembled; amassed; lit. carried apart
Root Family vi √yūh
Root √yūh･1 a (carry, bring)
Construction vi > vy > by + √yūh + ta > yūḍha > yūḷha
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change v > b
t > ḍ > ḷ
Variant vyūḷha
Commentary (MNa) ubhatobyūḷan'ti ubhato rāsibhūtaṃ.
Sanskrit vyūłha, vyūḍha
Sanskrit Root √ūh 1 (remove)

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ kāmānam'eva hetu asicammaṃ gahetvā, dhanukalāpaṃ sannayhitvā, ubhatobyūḷhaṃ saṅgāmaṃ pakkhandanti usūsu'pi khippamānesu, sattīsu'pi khippamānāsu, asīsu'pi vijjotalantesu.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
byohāra

masc. business activity; trading; commerce; business dealing [vi + ava + √har + *a] ~

Grammar masc, from voharati
Meaning business activity; trading; commerce; business dealing
Root Family vi ava √har
Root √har･1 a (carry)
Construction vi > vy > by + ava + √har > hār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change v > b
ava > o
a > ā
Variant vohāra, byavahāra
Sanskrit vyavahāra
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)
bravi

aor. (+acc) said [√brū + a + i] ✓

Grammar aor of brūti, trans (+acc)
Meaning said
Root Family √brū
Root √brū･1 a (say)
Base √brū + a > brava
Construction brava + i
Phonetic Change ū > av
Synonym avoca
Variant abravi
Sanskrit abravam
Sanskrit Root √brū 2, 6 (say)

Example

karoti, gacchati. yo koci karoti, taṃ añño, karohi karohi icc'evaṃ bravī'ti, atha vā karontaṃ payojayati, kāreti. saṅgho pabbatam'iva attānam'ācarati, pabbatāyati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 432
bravitu

imp. (+acc) may say; must speak [√brū + a + itu] ✓

Grammar imp of brūti, trans (+acc)
Meaning may say; must speak
Root Family √brū
Root √brū･1 a (say)
Base √brū + a > brava
Construction brava + itu
Phonetic Change ū > av
Sanskrit brūhi
Sanskrit Root √brū 2, 6 (say)

Example

kim'etaṃ bhavaṃ gotamo āha punabhavaṃ gotamo bravitū'ti

DN 3.7 ambaṭṭhasuttaṃ
bravīti

pr. (+acc) says; tells; speaks [√brū + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, irreg, trans (+acc)
Meaning says; tells; speaks
Root Family √brū
Root √brū･1 a (say)
Base √brū + a > bhava > bravī (irreg)
Construction bravī + ti
Phonetic Change brū > bravī (Kacc 520, 502)
ū > av
Synonym akkhāti, ācikkhati, āmantayati, ārocayati, āroceti, kathayati, katheti, pabrūti, pāvadati, pilapati, brūti, bhaṇati, lapayati, vadati
Sanskrit bravīti
Sanskrit Root √brū 2, 6 (say)

Examples

yo koci karoti, taṃ añño, karohi karohi, icc'evaṃ bravīti, atha vā karontaṃ payojayati, kāreti, kārayati, kārāpeti, kārāpayati. ye keci karonti, te aññe, karotha karotha, icc'evaṃ bruvanti, kārenti, kārayanti, kārāpenti, kārāpayanti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 438

brū'icc'etāya dhātuyā īkār'āgamo hoti timhi vibhattimhi. bravīti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 520
brahanta

adj. big; huge; large; enormous; (comm) with large girth [√brah + anta] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning big; huge; large; enormous; (comm) with large girth
Root Family √brah
Root √brah×1 a (increase)
Construction √brah + anta
Derivative kita (anta)
Synonym brahā, mahanta, visāla
Variant bruhanta, brahmatta
Commentary (ANa) brahantan'ti pariṇāhasampannaṃ.
Sanskrit bṛhanta
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh 1, 6 (make big or strong)

Example

evaṃ vutte āyasmā udāyī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, hatthim'eva nu kho, bhante, mahantaṃ brahantaṃ kāy'upapannaṃ jano disvā evam'āha, nāgo vata, bho, nāgo'ti

AN 6.43 nāgasuttaṃ
brahā

adj. big; huge; large; enormous [√brah + nta + ā] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, masc nom sg of brahanta
Meaning big; huge; large; enormous
Root Family √brah
Root √brah×1 a (increase)
Construction √brah + nta + ā
brahanta + ā
Synonym brahanta
Notes brahanta in compounds
Sanskrit bṛhanta
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh 1, 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

sabbe saṅgamma mantetvā,
māḷaṃ kubbanti satthuno,
ekatthambhaṃ alabhantā,
vicinanti brahāvane.

APA 14 ekatthambhika therāpadānaṃ

ṭhite majjhanhike kāle,
sannisīvesu pakkhisu,
saṇat'eva brah'āraññaṃ,
taṃ bhayaṃ paṭibhāti man'ti.

SN 1.15 saṇamānasuttaṃ
brahāchattajātaka

nt. Jātaka 336 (JA 336) ✗
brahārañña

nt. great wood; mighty forest [brahā + arañña] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning great wood; mighty forest
Construction brahā + arañña

Synonym brahāvana
Variant mahārañña

Example

ṭhite majjhanhike kāle,
sannisīvesu pakkhisu,
saṇat'eva brah'āraññaṃ,
taṃ bhayaṃ paṭibhāti man'ti.

SN 1.15 saṇamānasuttaṃ
brahāvana

nt. great wood; mighty forest [brahā + vana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning great wood; mighty forest
Construction brahā + vana
Compound kammadhāraya (brahanta + vana)

sabbe saṅgamma mantetvā,
māḷaṃ kubbanti satthuno,
ekatthambhaṃ alabhantā,
vicinanti brahāvane.

APA 14 ekatthambhika therāpadānaṃ

phuṭṭho ḍaṃsehi makasehi,
araññasmiṃ brahāvane,
nāgo saṅgāmasīs'eva,
sato tatr'ādhivāsaye.

TH 178 yasojattheragāthā
brahma 1

masc. God; creator god [√brah + ma] ✓

Grammar masc, atta group, irreg
Meaning God; creator god
Root Family √brah
Root √brah×1 a (increase)
Construction √brah + ma
Derivative kita (ma)
Sanskrit brahma
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh 1, 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

yathā brahmā tathā eko,
yathā devo tathā duve,
yathā gāmo tathā tayo,
kolāhalaṃ tat'uttarin'ti.

TH 178 yasojattheragāthā

brahmā'ti, bhikkhave, mātāpitūnaṃ etaṃ adhivacanaṃ … taṃ kissa hetu? bahukārā, bhikkhave, mātāpitaro, puttānaṃ āpādakā posakā imassa lokassa dassetāro'ti.

AN 4.63 brahmasuttaṃ
brahma 2

masc. Brahman; holy man [√brah + ma] ✓

Grammar masc, atta group, irreg
Meaning Brahman; holy man
Root Family √brah
Root √brah×1 a (increase)
Construction √brah + ma
Derivative kita (ma)
Commentary (SNPa) evaṃ thutiraho sa brahmā so brāhmaṇo'ti.
Sanskrit brahma
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh 1, 6 (make big or strong)

Example

bāhitvā sabbapāpakāni,
vimalo sādhusamāhito ṭhit'atto,
saṃsāram'aticca kevalī so,
asito tādi pavuccate sa brahmā.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
brahma 4

adj. divine; holy; (comm) highest; distinguished [√brah + ma] ✓

Meaning divine; holy; (comm) highest; distinguished
Root Family √brah
Root √brah×1 a (increase)
Construction √brah + ma
Derivative kita (ma)
Synonym brahmasama
Commentary (ANa) brahman'ti seṭṭhaṃ uttamaṃ visiṭṭhaṃ.
Sanskrit brahma
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh 1, 6 (make big or strong)

Example

idam'pi, bhikkhave, tathāgatassa tathāgatabalaṃ hoti, yaṃ balaṃ āgamma tathāgato āsabhaṃ ṭhānaṃ paṭijānāti, parisāsu sīhanādaṃ nadati, brahmacakkaṃ pavatteti.

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

so tadassādeti, taṃ nikāmeti, tena ca vittiṃ āpajjati. tattha ṭhito tadadhimutto tabbahulavihārī aparihīno kālaṃ kurumāno brahmakāyikānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.

brahmaghosa

SN 12.21 dasabalasuttaṃ
brahmacariya 1

nt. spiritual path; spiritual practice; holy life; celibacy [brahma + cariya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning spiritual path; spiritual practice; holy life; celibacy
Construction brahma + cariya
Compound kammadhāraya (brahma + cariya)
Antonym abrahmacariya
Synonym brahmacariyā
Commentary (SNa) brahmacariyan'ti methunavirati.
Sanskrit brahmacarya

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ duṭṭho doso appatīto amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃseyya app'eva nāma naṃ imamhā brahmacariyā cāveyyan'ti

VIN PAT SA 8 duṭṭhadosasikkhāpadaṃ

ettako ce'pi, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho abhavissa nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, na'y'idaṃ brahmacariyavāso paññāyetha sammā dukkhakkhayāya.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
brahmacariya 2

adj. related to the spiritual path; about the spiritual practice; regarding the holy life; about celibacy [brahma + cariya] ~

Grammar adj, comp

Construction brahma + cariya
Compound kammadhāraya (brahma + cariya)
Antonym abrahmacariya
Commentary (ANa) vusitabrahmacariyo'ti maggabrahmacariyaṃ vasitvā ṭhito.
Sanskrit brahmacarya

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning discussion about the incomplete spiritual life, etc.
Construction brahmacariya + aparipūra + ādi + kathā

masc. benefit of the spiritual path; goal of the holy life [brahmacariya + attha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning benefit of the spiritual path; goal of the holy life
Construction brahmacariya + attha
brahmacariyadukkha

nt. difficulty of the spiritual life; suffering of the holy life ✗

masc. danger to one's spiritual life [brahmacariya + antarāya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning danger to one's spiritual life

adj. with celibacy as the fifth [brahmacariya + pañcama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with celibacy as the fifth
Construction brahmacariya + pañcama
Compound kammadhāraya (brahmacariya + pañcama)
Sanskrit brahmacarya + pañcama

Example

so kho ahaṃ, bhante, diṭṭhadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogāḷhadhammo tiṇṇavicikiccho vigatakathaṃkatho vesārajjappatto aparappaccayo satthusāsane tatth'eva buddhañ'ca dhammañ'ca saṅghañ'ca saraṇaṃ agamāsiṃ, brahmacariyapañcamāni ca sikkhāpadāni samādiyiṃ.

AN 8.21 paṭhamauggasuttaṃ
brahmacariyaparāyaṇa

adj. finding support in the holy life [brahmacariya + parāyaṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning finding support in the holy life
Construction brahmacariya + parāyaṇa
Compound sattamī tappurisa (brahmacariye + parāyaṇa)
Commentary (ANa) brahmacariyaparāyaṇo'ti maggabrahmacariyaparāyaṇo. iminā lokuttaro aṭṭh'aṅgiko maggo kathito'ti.
Sanskrit brahmacarya + parāyaṇa

Example

n'āhaṃ bhabbo etarahi,
kāmāni paṭisevituṃ,
anivatti bhavissāmi,
brahmacariyaparāyaṇo'ti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
brahmacariyaparāyana

adj. finding support in the holy life; (or) living the holy life destined for Nibbāna [brahmacariya + parāyana] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning finding support in the holy life; (or) living the holy life destined for Nibbāna
Construction brahmacariya + parāyana
Commentary (SN 23.1) nibbān'ogadhañ'hi, rādha, brahmacariyaṃ vussati, nibbānaparāyanaṃ nibbānapariyosānan'ti.
brahmacariyapariyosāna

nt. perfection of the holy life; ideal of the spiritual path; culmination of the holy life [brahmacariya + pariyosāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning perfection of the holy life; ideal of the spiritual path; culmination of the holy life
Construction brahmacariya + pariyosāna
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (brahmacariyassa + pariyosana)
Sanskrit brahmacarya + paryavasāna

Example

atha kho so bhikkhu eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahit'atto viharanto nacirass'eva, yass'atthāya kulaputtā samma'd'eva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti tadanuttaraṃ brahmacariyapariyosānaṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.

SN 22.63 upādiyamānasuttaṃ
brahmacariyapariyosānasacchikiriyā

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning personal experience of the culmination of the spiritual path
Construction brahmacariyapariyosāna + sacchikiriyā
brahmacariyaphala

nt. fruit of the spiritual path; result of the holy life [brahmacariya + phala] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning fruit of the spiritual path; result of the holy life
Construction brahmacariya + phala
Synonym brahmaññaphala
brahmacariyamacari

aor. led the spiritual life; lived the holy life ✗
brahmacariyavant

adj. living the holy life; following the spiritual path; who is celibate renunciant; lit. having holy walk quality [brahma + cariya + vant] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from brahmacariya
Meaning living the holy life; following the spiritual path; who is celibate renunciant; lit. having holy walk quality
Construction brahma + cariya + vant
brahmacariya + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Antonym abrahmacariyavant
Sanskrit brahmacaryavat

Example

kāmesu brahmacariyavā,
vītataṇho sadā sato,
saṅkhāya nibbuto bhikkhu,
tassa no santi iñjitā.

SNP 57 tissametteyya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 2
brahmacariyavāsa

masc. living the holy life; following the spiritual path [brahmacariya + vāsa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning living the holy life; following the spiritual path
Construction brahmacariya + vāsa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (brahmacariyaṃ + vāsa)
Commentary (SNa) na y'idaṃ brahmacariyavāso paññāyethā'ti ayaṃ maggabrahmacariyavāso nāma na paññāyeyya. maggo hi tebhūmakasaṅkhāre vivaṭṭento uppajjati. yadi ca ettako attabhāvo nicco bhaveyya, maggo uppajjitvā'pi saṅkhāravaṭṭaṃ vivaṭṭetuṃ na sakkuṇeyyā'ti brahmacariyavāso na paññāyetha.
Sanskrit brahmacarya + vāsa

Examples

ettako ce'pi, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho abhavissa nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, na'y'idaṃ brahmacariyavāso paññāyetha sammā dukkhakkhayāya.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ

yo, bhikkhave, evaṃ vadeyya, yathā yath'āyaṃ puriso kammaṃ karoti tathā tathā taṃ paṭisaṃvediyatī'ti, evaṃ santaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyavāso na hoti, okāso na paññāyati sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāya.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
brahmacariyasāruppa

adj. in conformity with the spiritual path; proper for the holy life [brahma + cariya + sāruppa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning in conformity with the spiritual path; proper for the holy life
Construction brahma + cariya + sāruppa
Compound catutthī tappurisa (brahmacariyassa + sāruppa)
Commentary (ANa) brahmacariyasāruppānī'ti tāni'y'eva catumaggabrahmacariyassa sāruppāni anucchavikāni.
Sanskrit brahmacarya + sārūpya

Example

yāni ca kho tāni sikkhāpadāni ādibrahmacariyakāni brahmacariyasāruppāni tattha dhuvasīlo ca hoti ṭhitasīlo ca, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.

AN 3.89 tatiyasikkhāsuttaṃ
brahmacariyasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.25 (AN4.25) ✗
brahmacariyaṃ carati

idiom. lives the holy life; walks the spiritual path; follows a religion ✓

Grammar idiom, fem + pr
Meaning lives the holy life; walks the spiritual path; follows a religion
Sanskrit brahmacarya + carati

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kāme ca nappaṭisevati, pāpañ'ca kammaṃ na karoti, sahā'pi dukkhena sahā'pi domanassena assumukho'pi rudamāno paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carati.

AN 4.5 anusotasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena sabhiyassa paribbājakassa purāṇasālohitāya devatāya pañhā uddiṭṭhā honti, yo te, sabhiya, samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā ime pañhe puṭṭho byākaroti tassa santike brahmacariyaṃ careyyāsī'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
brahmacariyā

fem. spiritual path; spiritual practice; holy life; celibacy [brahma + cariyā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning spiritual path; spiritual practice; holy life; celibacy
Construction brahma + cariyā
Compound kammadhāraya (brahma + cariyā)
Antonym abrahmacariyā
Synonym brahmacariya
Commentary (ANa) brahmacariyan'ti ariyamaggasīlaṃ.
Sanskrit brahmacarya

Examples

acaritvā brahmacariyaṃ,
aladdhā yobbane dhanaṃ,
jiṇṇakoñcā'va jhāyanti,
khīṇamacche'va pallale.

DHP 155 jarāvaggo

khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā'ti abbhaññāsi.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
brahmacariyānuggaha

masc. support for the spiritual practice; help for the holy life [brahmacariya + anuggaha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning support for the spiritual practice; help for the holy life
Construction brahmacariya + anuggaha
Compound catutthī tappurisa (brahmacariyassa + anuggaha)
Sanskrit brahmacarya + anugraha

Example

paṭisaṅkhā yoniso āhāraṃ āharissāma n'eva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya yāva'd'eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā yāpanāya vihiṃs'ūparatiyā brahmacariy'ānuggahāya

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
brahmacariyānuggahāya

masc. to support the spiritual practice; to help the holy life [brahmacariya + anuggaha + āya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, dat sg of brahmacariyānuggaha
Meaning to support the spiritual practice; to help the holy life
Construction brahmacariya + anuggaha + āya
brahmacariyānuggaha + āya
Commentary (VISM) brahmacariyānuggahāyā'ti sakalasāsanabrahmacariyassa ca maggabrahmacariyassa ca anuggah'atthaṃ.
Sanskrit brahmacarya + anugrahāya

Example

n'eva davāya, na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya, yāva'd'eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā yāpanāya, vihiṃs'ūparatiyā brahmacariy'ānuggahāya

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
brahmacariyesanā 1

fem. seeking renunciation [brahmacariya + esanā] ~

Grammar fem, act, comp
Meaning seeking renunciation
Construction brahmacariya + esanā
Commentary (ANa) brahmacariyaṃ esissāmi gavesissāmī'ti evaṃ pavatt'ajjhāsayasaṅkhātā brahmacariy'esanā'pi arahattamaggen'eva paṭippassaddhiṃ vūpasamaṃ gacchati. diṭṭhibrahmacariy'esanā pana sot'āpattimaggen'eva paṭippasambhatī'ti veditabbā.
brahmacariyesanā 2

fem. seeking (false) religious beliefs [brahmacariya + esanā] ~

Grammar fem, act, comp
Meaning seeking (false) religious beliefs
Construction brahmacariya + esanā
Commentary (DNa) tattha katamā brahmacariy'esanā? sassato loko'ti vā … n'eva hoti na nahoti tathāgato parammaraṇā'ti vā, yā evarūpā diṭṭhi diṭṭhigataṃ vipariyesaggāho, ayaṃ vuccati brahmacariy'esanā'ti evaṃ vuttā diṭṭhigatikasammatassa brahmacariyassa gavesanadiṭṭhi brahmacariy'esanā nāma.
brahmacariyogadha

adj. immersed in the spiritual path; absorbed in spiritual practice [brahmacariya + ogadha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning immersed in the spiritual path; absorbed in spiritual practice
Construction brahmacariya + ogadha
Commentary (ANa) anuttaraṃ brahmacariyogadhan'ti arahattamaggasaṅkhātassa brahmacariyassa anuttaraṃ ogadhaṃ uttamapatiṭṭhābhūtaṃ nibbānaṃ.
brahmacariyogadhasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 55.2 (SN55.2) ✗
brahmacāri

masc. celibate man; spiritual practitioner [brahma + cārī] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning celibate man; spiritual practitioner
Construction brahma + cārī > cāri
Phonetic Change ī > i
Commentary (ANa) apace brahmacārayo'ti brahmacārino apacayati, nīcavuttitaṃ nesaṃ āpajjati.
brahmacāriabhipatthana

nt. excessive desire of the spiritual practitioner [brahmacārī + abhipatthana] ~

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning excessive desire of the spiritual practitioner
Construction brahmacārī + abhipatthana
Commentary (SNa) brahmacāriabhipatthanenā'ti brahmacārīnaṃ adhimattapatthanāsaṅkhātena catupaccayabhāvena.
brahmacāriabhibhavana

nt. overcoming the spiritual practitioner [brahmacārī + abhibhavana] ~

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning overcoming the spiritual practitioner
Construction brahmacārī + abhibhavana
brahmacārinī

fem. celibate woman; living the hoy life; following the spiritual path [brahma + cārī + inī] ✓

Grammar fem, comp, from brahmacārī
Meaning celibate woman; living the hoy life; following the spiritual path
Construction brahma + cārī + inī
brahmacārī + inī
Derivative taddhita (inī)
Commentary (THIa) sotthi siyā brahmacārinī'ti seṭṭhacārini mahesike tuyhaṃ ārogyam'eva bhaveyya.
Sanskrit brahmacāriṇī

Example

tassa ca viramāsi tāva'd'e,
rāgo tattha khamāpayī ca naṃ,
sotthi siyā brahmacārinī,
na puno edisakaṃ bhavissati.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
brahmacāripaṭiñña

adj. pretending to be celibate; claiming to be chaste [brahmacārī + paṭiñña] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning pretending to be celibate; claiming to be chaste
Construction brahmacārī + paṭiñña
Compound kammadhāraya (brahmacārī + paṭiñña)
Sanskrit brahmacārin + pratijña

Example

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dussīlo hoti pāpadhammo asuci saṅkassarasamācāro paṭicchannakamm'anto, assamaṇo samaṇapaṭiñño, abrahmacārī brahmacāripaṭiñño, antopūti avassuto kasambujāto.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
brahmacārī 1

adj. celibate; chaste; abstaining from sexual intercourse; holy [brahma + cārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning celibate; chaste; abstaining from sexual intercourse; holy
Construction brahma + cārī
Compound kammadhāraya (brahma + cārī)
Antonym abrahmacārī
Commentary (VIN 1.2.4) brahmacārin'ti methunadhammā paṭivirataṃ. (MNa) brahmaṃ seṭṭhaṃ paṭipadaṃ carantī'ti brahmacārī, methunā paṭiviratā'ti attho.
Sanskrit brahmacārin

Examples

abrahmacariyaṃ pahāya brahmacārī ahosiṃ ārācārī virato methunā gāmadhammā.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ

alaṅ'kato ce'pi samaṃ careyya,
santo danto niyato brahmacārī,
sabbesu bhūtesu nidhāya daṇḍaṃ,
so brāhmaṇo so samaṇo sa bhikkhu.

DHP 142 daṇḍavaggo
brahmacārī 2

masc. celibate man; who abstains from sexual intercourse [brahma + cārī] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning celibate man; who abstains from sexual intercourse
Construction brahma + cārī
Compound kammadhāraya (brahma + cārī)
Antonym abrahmacārī
Commentary (VIN 1.2.4) brahmacārin'ti methunadhammā paṭivirataṃ.
Sanskrit brahmacārin

Example

etadaggaṃ bhagini pāricariyānaṃ yā mādisaṃ sīlavantaṃ kalyāṇadhammaṃ brahmacāriṃ etena dhammena paricareyyā'ti methun'upasaṃhitena, saṅghādiseso.

VIN PAT SA 4 attakāmapāricariyasikkhāpadaṃ
brahmacārī 3

adj. living the holy life; following the spiritual path [brahma + cārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning living the holy life; following the spiritual path
Construction brahma + cārī
Compound kammadhāraya (brahma + cārī)
Antonym abrahmacārī
Commentary (SNa) brahmacārinan'ti seṭṭhacārīnaṃ maggabrahmacariyavāsaṃ vasantānaṃ.
Sanskrit brahmacārin

Example

araññe viharantānaṃ,
santānaṃ brahmacārinaṃ,
ekabhattaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ,
kena vaṇṇo pasīdatī'ti.

adj. of Brahman birth [brahma + ja + tya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of Brahman birth
Construction brahma + ja + tya
brahmaja + tya

Sanskrit brahmajanman

Example

brahmajacco pure āsiṃ,
udicco ubhato ahu,
sojja putto sugatassa,
dhammarājassa satthuno.

ahesuṃ kho ye, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ ... bhūtagarahakā bhūtajigucchakā, devagarahakā devajigucchakā, pajāpatigarahakā pajāpatijigucchakā, brahmagarahakā brahmajigucchakā

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
brahmañña 1

nt. devotion to Brahmans [√brah + ma + na + ya] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, from brāhmaṇa
Meaning devotion to Brahmans
Root Family √brah
Root √brah×1 a (increase)
Construction √brah + ma + na + ya
brāhmaṇa + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Synonym brahmaññatā
Sanskrit brāhmaṇya
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh 1, 6 (make big or strong)
brahmañña 2

nt. Brahmanhood; being a true Brahman; being a holy person [√brah + ma + na + ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from brāhmaṇa
Meaning Brahmanhood; being a true Brahman; being a holy person
Root Family √brah
Root √brah×1 a (increase)
Construction √brah + ma + na + ya
brāhmaṇa + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Antonym abrahmañña
Sanskrit brāhmaṇya
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh 1, 6 (make big or strong)

Example

evaṃ vutte, acelo kassapo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, dukkaraṃ, bho gotama, sāmaññaṃ dukkaraṃ brahmaññan'ti.

DN 8.5 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
brahmañña 3

nt. spiritual life; holy life [√brah + ma + na + ya] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, from brāhmaṇa
Meaning spiritual life; holy life
Root Family √brah
Root √brah×1 a (increase)
Construction √brah + ma + na + ya
brāhmaṇa + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Antonym abrahmañña
Sanskrit brāhmaṇya
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh 1, 6 (make big or strong)
brahmaññatā

fem. devotion to Brahmans; lit. devotion to Brahmans state [√brah + ma + na + ya + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from brahmañña
Meaning devotion to Brahmans; lit. devotion to Brahmans state
Root Family √brah
Root √brah×1 a (increase)
Construction √brah + ma + na + ya + tā
brahmañña + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Antonym sāmaññatā, abrahmaññatā
Synonym brahmañña
Sanskrit brāhmaṇyatā (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh 1, 6 (make big or strong)

Example

sukhā matteyyatā loke,
atho petteyyatā sukhā,
sukhā sāmaññatā loke,
atho brahmaññatā sukhā.

DHP 332 nāgavaggo
brahmaññattha

masc. goal of being a Brahman; purpose of priesthood; epithet of Nibbāna [brahmañña + attha] ~

Meaning goal of being a Brahman; purpose of priesthood; epithet of Nibbāna
Construction brahmañña + attha
Commentary (SNa) sāmaññatthaṃ vā brahmaññatthaṃ vā'ti ettha ariyamaggo sāmaññañ'c'eva brahmaññañ'ca. ubhayatthā'pi pana attho nāma ariyaphalaṃ veditabbaṃ.

nt. godliness; state of being god; fact of being the creator [√brah + ma + tta] ✓

Meaning godliness; state of being god; fact of being the creator
Root Family √brah

brahma + tta

Example

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

brahmanimmita

adj. created by Brahma [brahma + nimmita] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning created by Brahma
Construction brahma + nimmita
brahmapatta

adj. who has attained holiness; become divine; (comm) become foremost [brahma + patta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has attained holiness; become divine; (comm) become foremost
Construction brahma + patta
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (brahmaṃ + patta)
Commentary (MNa) brahmapattassā'ti seṭṭhapattassa.
Sanskrit brahma + prāpta

Example

isisattamassa akuhassa,
tevijjassa brahmapattassa,
nhātakassa padakassa,
passaddhassa viditavedassa,
purindadassa sakkassa,
bhagavato tassa sāvako'ham'asmi.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
brahmapatti

fem. attainment of holiness; attaining the highest state; lit. reaching god [brahma + patti] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning attainment of holiness; attaining the highest state; lit. reaching god
Construction brahma + patti
Commentary (SNa) brahmapattiyā'ti seṭṭhapattiyā.
brahmapatha

masc. holy path; spiritual path; lit. god road [brahma + patha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning holy path; spiritual path; lit. god road
Construction brahma + patha
Compound catutthī tappurisa (brahmuno + patha)
Commentary (THa) iriyamānaṃ brahmapathe'ti catubbidhe'pi brahmavihārapathe, brahme vā seṭṭhe phalasamāpattipathe samāpajjanavasena pavattamānaṃ. (ANa) brahmapathe'ti seṭṭhapathe, amatapathe, nibbānapathe.
Sanskrit brahmapatha

Example

manussabhūtaṃ sambuddhaṃ,
attadantaṃ samāhitaṃ,
iriyamānaṃ brahmapathe,
cittass'ūpasame rataṃ.

TH 247 udāyittheragāthā
brahmaparisā

fem. assembly of gods; Brahma's retinue [brahma + parisā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning assembly of gods; Brahma's retinue
Construction brahma + parisā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (brahmuno + parisā)
Sanskrit brahmapariṣad

Examples

nanu tvaṃ, bhikkhu, passasi brahmaparisaṃ sannipatitan'ti? iti kho maṃ, bhikkhave, māro pāpimā brahmaparisaṃ upanesi.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

yo c'eva, pāpima, brahmā, yā ca brahmaparisā, ye ca brahmapārisajjā, sabb'eva tava hatthagatā sabb'eva tava vasaṃgatā.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
brahmapasaṃsaka

adj. who praises god; who approves of god [brahma + pasaṃsaka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who praises god; who approves of god
Construction brahma + pasaṃsaka
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (brahmānaṃ + pasaṃsaka)
Sanskrit brahma + praśaṃsaka

Example

ye pana, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ ... bhūtapasaṃsakā bhūt'ābhinandino, devapasaṃsakā dev'ābhinandino, pajāpatipasaṃsakā pajāpat'ābhinandino, brahmapasaṃsakā brahm'ābhinandino, te kāyassa bhedā pāṇupacchedā paṇīte kāye patiṭṭhitā.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
brahmapārisajja

masc. member of god’s assembly; member of Brahma's council [brahma + pārisajja] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning member of god’s assembly; member of Brahma's council
Construction brahma + pārisajja
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (brahmuno + pārisajja)
Sanskrit brahman + pāriṣadya

Examples

atha kho, bhikkhave, māro pāpimā aññataraṃ brahmapārisajjaṃ anvāvisitvā maṃ etadavoca, bhikkhu, bhikkhu, m'etam'āsado m'etam'āsado

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

yo c'eva, pāpima, brahmā, yā ca brahmaparisā, ye ca brahmapārisajjā, sabb'eva tava hatthagatā sabb'eva tava vasaṃgatā.

Meaning holy; noble; lit. become like god
Construction brahma + bhūta
Compound kammadhāraya (brahma viya bhūta)
Commentary (ANa) brahmabhūtena attanā'ti seṭṭhabhūtena attanā
Sanskrit brahma + bhūta

Examples

so h'āvuso, bhagavā jānaṃ jānāti, passaṃ passati, cakkhubhūto ñāṇabhūto dhammabhūto brahmabhūto, vattā pavattā, atthassa ninnetā, amatassa dātā, dhammassāmī tathāgato

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ

so n'eva attan'tapo na paran'tapo diṭṭh'eva dhamme nicchāto nibbuto sītībhūto sukhappaṭisaṃvedī brahmabhūtena attanā viharati.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
brahmamanta

masc. Brahman mantra ✗
brahmayācanakathā

fem. discussion about Brahma's plea ✗
brahmayāna 1

nt. Brahma's vehicle; carriage of God [brahma + yāna] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Brahma's vehicle; carriage of God
Construction brahma + yāna
Commentary (SNa) brahmayānaṃ anuttaran'ti asadisaṃ seṭṭhayānaṃ.
brahmayāna 2

nt. epithet of the Noble Eightfold Path; lit. Brahma's vehicle [brahma + yāna] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning epithet of the Noble Eightfold Path; lit. Brahma's vehicle
Construction brahma + yāna
Commentary (SNa) ayañ'hi sabbadosavigamena seṭṭho, iminā ca ariyā nibbānaṃ yantī'ti brahmayānaṃ iti'pi
brahmayānarūpa

nt. vehicle suitable for Brahma; as if God's carriage [brahma + yāna + rūpa] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning vehicle suitable for Brahma; as if God's carriage
Construction brahma + yāna + rūpa
brahmayāniya

adj. leading to Brahma ✗
brahmaloka

masc. Brahma’s realm; world of the gods [brahma + loka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning Brahma’s realm; world of the gods
Construction brahma + loka
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (brahmānaṃ + loka)
Sanskrit brahmaloka

Examples

ayaṃ loko paro loko,
brahmaloko sadevako,
diṭṭhiṃ te n'ābhijānāti,
gotamassa yasassino.

SNP 70 mogharāja māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 15

ko sujjhati muccati bajjhatī ca,
ken'attanā gacchati brahmalokaṃ,
ajānato me muni brūhi puṭṭho,
bhagavā hi me sakkhi brahmajjadiṭṭho,
tuvañ'hi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.

SNP 31 māghasuttaṃ, mahāvaggo 5
brahmalokagāmī

adj. leading to Brahma's realm; going to the world of the gods ✗
brahmalokapariyosāna

adj. having Brahma’s realm as ultimate goal; with the world of the gods as ultimate purpose [brahmaloka + pariyosāna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having Brahma’s realm as ultimate goal; with the world of the gods as ultimate purpose
Construction brahmaloka + pariyosāna
Commentary (ANa) brāhmaṇānañ'ca, yaññaṃ yajissāmā'ti cittaṃ abhinivisati, brahmaloke patte pariyosānappattā nāma honti. tasmā te yaññābhinivesā brahmalokapariyosānā'ti vuttā.
brahmalokamaggadesanā

fem. teaching the path to Brahma's realm ✗
brahmalokasahabyatā

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning companionship (with those in) Brahma’s realm; company of the world of the gods
Construction brahmaloka + sahabyatā
brahmalokasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 6.6 (SN6.6) ✗
brahmalokādhimutta

adj. intent on Brahma’s realm; fixated on the world of the gods [brahmaloka + adhimutta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning intent on Brahma’s realm; fixated on the world of the gods
Construction brahmaloka + adhimutta
brahmalokūpaga

adj. reborn in the world of the gods; headed towards Brahma’s realm [brahmaloka + upaga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning reborn in the world of the gods; headed towards Brahma’s realm
Construction brahmaloka + upaga
Phonetic Change u > ū
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (brahmalokaṃ + upaga)
Sanskrit brahmaloka + upaga

Example

tuvaṭaṃ cittaṃ samādhiyati, mukhavaṇṇo vippasīdati, asammūḷho kālaṃ karoti, uttari appaṭivijjhanto brahmalok'ūpago hoti.

AN 11.15 mettāsuttaṃ
brahmalokūpagama

nt. going to Brahma's realm ✗

brahmavaccasī

adj. possessing sacred knowledge; having the glory of Brahma; (comm) with a body like Brahma himself [brahma + vaccasī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning possessing sacred knowledge; having the glory of Brahma; (comm) with a body like Brahma himself
Construction brahma + vaccasī
Variant brahmaḍḍhī, brahmavacchasī
Commentary (DNa) brahmavacchasī'ti mahābrahmuno sarīrasadisen'eva sarīrena samannāgato.
Sanskrit brahmavarcasin
brahmavacchasī

adj. possessing sacred knowledge; having the glory of Brahma; (comm) with a body like Brahma himself [brahma + vacchasī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning possessing sacred knowledge; having the glory of Brahma; (comm) with a body like Brahma himself
Construction brahma + vacchasī
Variant brahmaḍḍhī, brahmavaccasī
Commentary (DNa) brahmavacchasī'ti mahābrahmuno sarīrasadisen'eva sarīrena samannāgato.
Sanskrit brahmavarcasin
brahmavaḍḍhana

nt. ancient name of the city of Benares ✗
brahmavaṇṇī

adj. like Brahma in appearance; surpassingly beautiful ✗
brahmavāda

masc. divine doctrine; Brahman belief; lit. speech of Brahma [brahma + vāda] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning divine doctrine; Brahman belief; lit. speech of Brahma
Construction brahma + vāda
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (brahmuno + vāda)
Commentary (NPa) dhammena so brahmavādaṃ vadeyyā'ti so brāhmaṇo ahan'ti etaṃ vādaṃ vadeyya. (NPt) so brāhmaṇo brahmavādaṃ ahaṃ brāhmaṇo'mhī'ti vācaṃ vadeyyā'ti bhagavā avocā'ti yojanā.
Notes In Vedānta, the assertion that all things are Brahma. A typical Buddhist re-interpretation of a pre-Buddhist belief.
Sanskrit brahma + vāda
brahmavimāna

nt. heavenly mansion; Brahma's heavenly palace [brahma + vimāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning heavenly mansion; Brahma's heavenly palace
Construction brahma + vimāna
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (brahmuno + vimāna)
Sanskrit brahma + vimāna

Example

satta vassāni mettaṃ cittaṃ bhāvesiṃ. satta vassāni mettaṃ cittaṃ bhāvetvā satta saṃvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappe na'y'imaṃ lokaṃ punāgamāsiṃ. saṃvaṭṭamāne sud'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, loke ābhassar'ūpago homi, vivaṭṭamāne loke suññaṃ brahmavimānaṃ upapajjāmi.

AN 7.62 mettasuttaṃ
brahmavihāra

masc. sublime state; heavenly state; divine dwelling; collective name of the meditations on friendliness, compassion, happiness for and equanimity; lit. gods mansion [brahma + vihāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning sublime state; heavenly state; divine dwelling; collective name of the meditations on friendliness, compassion, happiness for and equanimity; lit. gods mansion
Construction brahma + vihāra
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (brahmuno + vihāra)
Notes a collective term for the states of friendliness, compassion, appreciation and equanimity
Sanskrit brahmavihāra

Example

so cattāro brahmavihāre bhāvetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā brahmalok'ūpago ahosi.

MN 83 maghadevasuttaṃ
brahmasabyatā

fem. companionship with Brahma; company of God ✗
brahmasama

adj. holy; divine; equal to Brahma; like god almighty [brahma + sama] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning holy; divine; equal to Brahma; like god almighty
Construction brahma + sama
Synonym brahma
Commentary (ANa) evaṃ kho doṇa brāhmaṇo brahmasamo hotī'ti evaṃ brahmavihārehi samannāgatattā brāhmaṇo brahmasamo nāma hoti. (VINt) brahmasamenā'ti brahmattabhāvasamena.
brahmasahabyatā

fem. companionship with Brahma; company of God [brahma + sahabyatā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning companionship with Brahma; company of God
Construction brahma + sahabyatā
brahmasaṃyutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 6 (SN6) ✗
brahmasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 47.18 (SN47.18) ✗
brahmasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.63 (AN4.63) ✗
brahmassara

adj. with deep voice; with a voice like god; twenty-eighth of the thirty-two marks of a great man; lit. with voice of god [brahma + sara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with deep voice; with a voice like god; twenty-eighth of the thirty-two marks of a great man; lit. with voice of god
Construction brahma + sara
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (brahmuno + sara)
Commentary (MNa) brahmassaro'ti aññe chinnassarā'pi bhinnassarā'pi kākassarā'pi honti, tathāgato pana mahābrahmuno sarasadisena sarena samannāgato.
Sanskrit brahmasvara

Example

brahmassaro kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo karavikabhāṇī, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
brahmassaratā

fem. fact of having a voice like god; lit. god sound state [brahma + saratā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning fact of having a voice like god; lit. god sound state
Construction brahma + saratā
Commentary (DNt) brahmassaratan'ti seṭṭhassarataṃ, brahmuno sarasadisassarataṃ vā.
Sanskrit brahma + svaratā
brahmassaratta

nt. fact of having a deep voice; fact of having the voice of god [brahma + sara + tta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning fact of having a deep voice; fact of having the voice of god
Construction brahma + sara + tta
brahmassara + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
brahmābhinandī

adj. who delights in god; who relishes god; who is very happy with god [brahma + abhinandī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who delights in god; who relishes god; who is very happy with god
Construction brahma + abhinandī
Compound sattamī tappurisa (brahmani + abhinandī)
Sanskrit brahma + abhinandin

Example

ye pana, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ ... bhūtapasaṃsakā bhūt'ābhinandino, devapasaṃsakā dev'ābhinandino, pajāpatipasaṃsakā pajāpat'ābhinandino, brahmapasaṃsakā brahm'ābhinandino, te kāyassa bhedā pāṇupacchedā paṇīte kāye patiṭṭhitā.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
brahmāyācanasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 6.1 (SN6.1) ✗

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 91 (MN91) ✗
brahmālittheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 163 (TH163) ✗
brahmāsahampati

masc. name of the Brahma who implored the Buddha to teach ✗
brahmujugatta

adj. with long and straight limbs; (comm) with straight limbs like a god; fifteenth of the thirty-two marks of a great man [brahma + uju + gatta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with long and straight limbs; (comm) with straight limbs like a god; fifteenth of the thirty-two marks of a great man

Commentary (MNa) brahm'ujugatto'ti brahmā viya ujugatto, ujum'eva uggatadīghasarīro.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
brahmujugattatā

fem. fact of having long and straight limbs ✗
brahmunā

masc. by God; with creator god [√brah + ma + unā] ✓

Grammar masc, instr sg of brahma, irreg
Meaning by God; with creator god
Root Family √brah
Root √brah×1 a (increase)
Construction √brah + ma + unā
brahma + unā
Sanskrit brahmaṇā
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh 1, 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

nikkhaṃ jambonadass'eva,
ko taṃ ninditum'arahati,
devā'pi naṃ pasaṃsanti,
brahmunā'pi pasaṃsito.

DHP 230 kodhavaggo

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, uṇṇābhassa brāhmaṇassa tathāgate saddhā niviṭṭhā mūlajātā patiṭṭhitā daḷhā asaṃhāriyā samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā mārena vā brahmunā vā kenaci vā lokasmiṃ.

SN 48.42 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ
brahmuno 1

masc. for god; for Brahma; to god [√brah + ma + uno] ✓

Grammar masc, dat sg of brahma, irreg
Meaning for god; for Brahma; to god
Root Family √brah
Root √brah×1 a (increase)
Construction √brah + ma + uno
brahma + uno
Sanskrit brahmāya
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh 1, 6 (make big or strong)

Example

tena kho pana, bhikkhave, samayena bakassa brahmuno evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ hoti, idaṃ niccaṃ, idaṃ dhuvaṃ, idaṃ sassataṃ, idaṃ kevalaṃ

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
brahmuno 2

masc. of god; of Brahma [√brah + ma + uno] ✓

Grammar masc, gen sg of brahma, irreg
Meaning of god; of Brahma
Root Family √brah
Root √brah×1 a (increase)
Construction √brah + ma + uno
brahma + uno
Sanskrit brahmasya
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh 1, 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

iti h'idaṃ mārassa ca anālapanatāya brahmuno ca abhinimantanatāya, tasmā imassa veyyākaraṇassa brahmanimantanikaṃ't'eva adhivacanan'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

mahābrahmuno'pi kho, bhikkhave, atth'eva aññathattaṃ atthi vipariṇāmo. evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako tasmim'pi nibbindati. tasmiṃ nibbindanto agge virajjati, pag'eva hīnasmiṃ.

Root √brah×1 a (increase)

Examples

handa carahi te, mārisa, passa antaradhāyāmī'ti. handa carahi me tvaṃ, brahme, antaradhāyassu, sace visahasī'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

anusāsa brahme karuṇāyamāno,
vivekadhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
yath'āhaṃ ākāso'va abyāpajjamāno,
idh'eva santo asito careyyaṃ.

SNP 60 dhotaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 5
brāhmaṇa 1

masc. Brahman; priest; man of the Brahman caste [√brah + ma + *aṇa] ✓

Grammar masc, from brahma
Meaning Brahman; priest; man of the Brahman caste
Root Family √brah
Root √brah×1 a (increase)
Construction √brah > brāh + ma + *aṇa
brahma + *aṇa
Derivative taddhita (*aṇa)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym abrāhmaṇa
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.10) brāhmaṇo nāma jātiyā brāhmaṇo. (SNa) brāhmaṇā'ti bhovādino.
Sanskrit brāhmaṇa
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh 1, 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

na jaccā vasalo hoti,
na jaccā hoti brāhmaṇo,
kammunā vasalo hoti,
kammunā hoti brāhmaṇo'ti.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7

imāni cattāri ariyasaccānī'ti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṃkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhī'ti. iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ idam'etaṃ paṭicca vuttan'ti.

AN 3.62 titthāyatanādisuttaṃ
brāhmaṇa 2

masc. arahant; enlightened being; saint; paragon [√brah + ma + *aṇa] ✓

Grammar masc, from brahma
Meaning arahant; enlightened being; saint; paragon
Root Family √brah
Root √brah×1 a (increase)
Construction √brah > brāh + ma + *aṇa
brahma + *aṇa
Derivative taddhita (*aṇa)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym saṅkhātadhamma, sappurisa
Commentary (MNa) brāhmaṇan'ti taṃ khīṇ'āsavaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ. (MNa) bāhitapāpattā brāhmaṇo hoti.
Sanskrit brāhmaṇa
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh 1, 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

tass'īdha diṭṭhe va sute mute vā,
pakappitā n'atthi aṇū'pi saññā,
taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ diṭṭhim'anādiyānaṃ,
ken'īdha lokasmiṃ vikappayeyya.

SNP 43 paramaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 5

aham'asmi, bhikkhave, brāhmaṇo yācayogo sadā payatapāṇi antimadehadharo anuttaro bhisakko sallakatto.

ITI 100 brāhmaṇadhammayāgasuttaṃ
brāhmaṇa 3

masc. monk; sage; holy man [√brah + ma + *aṇa] ✓

Grammar masc, from brahma
Meaning monk; sage; holy man
Root Family √brah
Root √brah×1 a (increase)
Construction √brah > brāh + ma + *aṇa
brahma + *aṇa
Derivative taddhita (*aṇa)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym muni, munī, samaṇa
Sanskrit brāhmaṇa
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh 1, 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

chinda sotaṃ parakkamma,
kāme panuda brāhmaṇa,
saṅkhārānaṃ khayaṃ ñatvā,
akataññū'si brāhmaṇa.

DHP 383 brāhmaṇavaggo

divā tapati ādicco,
rattim'ābhāti candimā,
sannaddho khattiyo tapati,
jhāyī tapati brāhmaṇo,
atha sabbam'ahorattiṃ,
buddho tapati tejasā.

DHP 387 brāhmaṇavaggo
brāhmaṇakaññā

fem. young Brahman woman; Brahman maiden [brāhmaṇa + kaññā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning young Brahman woman; Brahman maiden
Construction brāhmaṇa + kaññā
Compound kammadhāraya (brāhmaṇa + kaññā)
Sanskrit brāhmaṇa + kanyā

Examples

santi kho pana, bhante, imasmiṃ rājakule khattiyakaññā'pi brāhmaṇakaññā'pi gahapatikaññā'pi, tās'āhaṃ issar'ādhipaccaṃ kāremi.

AN 4.197 mallikādevīsuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, khattiyakaññā vā brāhmaṇakaññā vā gahapatikaññā vā pannarasavass'uddesikā vā soḷasavass'uddesikā vā, n'ātidīghā n'ātirassā n'ātikisā n'ātithūlā n'ātikāḷī n'āccodātā paramā sā, bhikkhave, tasmiṃ samaye subhā vaṇṇanibhāti?

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
brāhmaṇakaraṇa

adj. which makes one a Brahman; which should be done by a Brahman [brāhmaṇa + karaṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning which makes one a Brahman; which should be done by a Brahman
Construction brāhmaṇa + karaṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (brāhmaṇaṃ + karaṇa)
Commentary (MNa) ye dhammā samaṇakaraṇā ca brāhmaṇakaraṇā cā'ti ye dhammā samādāya paripūritā samitapāpasamaṇañ'ca bāhitapāpabrāhmaṇañ'ca karontī'ti attho ... ettha pana samaṇena kattabbadhammā vuttā. te'pi ca samaṇakaraṇā honti'y'eva. idha pana hir'ottapp'ādivasena desanā vitthāritā.
Sanskrit brāhmaṇa + karaṇa

Example

tesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, evaṃsamaññānaṃ sataṃ evaṃpaṭiññānaṃ sataṃ ye dhammā samaṇakaraṇā ca brāhmaṇakaraṇā ca te dhamme samādāya vattissāma, evaṃ no ayaṃ amhākaṃ samaññā ca saccā bhavissati paṭiññā ca bhūtā.

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
brāhmaṇakāraka

adj. which makes one a Brahman ✗
brāhmaṇakumāra

masc. Brahman youth; Brahman boy [brāhmaṇa + kumāra] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning Brahman youth; Brahman boy
Construction brāhmaṇa + kumāra
Compound kammadhāraya (brāhmaṇa + kumāra)
Sanskrit brāhmaṇa + kumāra
brāhmaṇakula 1

nt. family of the Brahman class [brāhmaṇa + kula] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning family of the Brahman class
Construction brāhmaṇa + kula
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (brāhmaṇānaṃ + kula)
Sanskrit brāhmaṇakula

Examples

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, brāhmaṇakulā ce'pi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ āgamma, evaṃ mettaṃ karuṇaṃ muditaṃ upekkhaṃ bhāvetvā labhati ajjhattaṃ vūpasamaṃ.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ

kulaṃ nāma cattāri kulāni, khattiyakulaṃ, brāhmaṇakulaṃ, vessakulaṃ, suddakulaṃ.

VIN 1.2.13 kuladūsakasikkhāpadaṃ
brāhmaṇakula 2

adj. belonging to a Brahman family [brāhmaṇa + kula] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning belonging to a Brahman family
Construction brāhmaṇa + kula
brāhmaṇakulīna

adj. Brahman by family [brāhmaṇa + kulīna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning Brahman by family
Construction brāhmaṇa + kulīna
brāhmaṇagaṇa

masc. group of Brahmans; crowd of Brahmans ✗
brāhmaṇagahapatikā

masc. Brahmans and householders [brāhmaṇa + gahapatika + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning Brahmans and householders
Construction brāhmaṇa + gahapatika + ā
brāhmaṇagahapatika + ā
Compound dvanda (brāhmaṇā ca gahapatikā ca)
Commentary (ITIa) brāhmaṇagahapatikā'ti brāhmaṇā c'eva gahapatikā ca. ṭhapetvā brāhmaṇe ye keci agāraṃ ajjhāvasantā idha gahapatikā'ti veditabbā.
Sanskrit brāhmaṇa + gārhapatika

Examples

brāhmaṇagahapatikānam'pi tasmiṃ samaye na phāsu hoti atiyātuṃ vā niyyātuṃ vā bāhirāni vā kamm'antāni paṭivekkhituṃ.

AN 2.40 samacittavaggo

assosuṃ kho mithileyyakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā, samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito videhesu cārikaṃ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi mithilaṃ anuppatto

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
brāhmaṇagāma

masc. Brahman village [brāhmaṇa + gāma] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning Brahman village
Construction brāhmaṇa + gāma
Compound kammadhāraya (brāhmaṇa + gāma)
Sanskrit brāhmaṇa + grāma

Examples

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā magadhesu viharati dakkhiṇāgirismiṃ ekanāḷāyaṃ brāhmaṇagāme.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā mallesu cārikaṃ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ yena thūṇaṃ nāma mallānaṃ brāhmaṇagāmo tadavasari.

UD 69 udapānasuttaṃ
brāhmaṇacaṇḍāla

adj. who is an outcaste of a Brahman; who is a low caste Brahman [brāhmaṇa + caṇḍāla] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who is an outcaste of a Brahman; who is a low caste Brahman
Construction brāhmaṇa + caṇḍāla
brāhmaṇajacca

adj. Brahman by birth; of Brahman descent [brāhmaṇa + jacca] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning Brahman by birth; of Brahman descent
Construction brāhmaṇa + jacca
brāhmaṇajāti

fem. priestly caste [brāhmaṇa + jāti] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning priestly caste
Construction brāhmaṇa + jāti
brāhmaṇajātika

adj. of Brahman birth; from a Brahman family [brāhmaṇa + jātika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of Brahman birth; from a Brahman family
Construction brāhmaṇa + jātika
Compound kammadhāraya (brāhmaṇa + jātika)
Commentary (UDa) brāhmaṇajātiko'ti brāhmaṇakule jāto. so hi uḷārabhogā brāhmaṇamahāsālakulā pabbajito. tassa kira evaṃ ahosi ime lokiyā ubhatosujātiyā brāhmaṇasikkhānipphattiyā ca brāhmaṇo hoti, na aññathā'ti vadanti, bhagavā ca ete āyasmante brāhmaṇā'ti vadati, hand'āhaṃ bhagavantaṃ brāhmaṇalakkhaṇaṃ puccheyyan'ti etadattham'eva hi bhagavā tadā te there brāhmaṇā'ti abhāsi. brahmaṃ aṇatī'ti brāhmaṇo'ti hi jātibrāhmaṇānaṃ nibbacanaṃ.
Sanskrit brāhmaṇa + jātīya, jātika (bsk)

Example

evaṃ vutte, aññataro brāhmaṇajātiko bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, brāhmaṇo hoti, katame ca pana brāhmaṇakaraṇā dhammā'ti?

UD5 brāhmaṇasuttaṃ
brāhmaṇatissabhaya

Compound kammadhāraya (brāhmaṇī + dārikā)
Sanskrit brāhmaṇī + dārikā

Examples

lohitañ'ca taṃ candanañcā'ti lohitacandanaṃ, brāhmaṇī ca sā dārikā cā'ti brāhmaṇadārikā, khattiyā ca sā kaññā cā'ti khattiyakaññā.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 324

kammadhārayasaññe ca samāse itthiyaṃ tuly'ādhikaraṇe pade pubbe bhāsitapum'itthī ce, pumā'va daṭṭhabbā. brāhmaṇadārikā, khattiyakaññā, khattiyakumārikā.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ

puna capar'āhaṃ, bho, passāmi idh'ekacce brāhmaṇapaṇḍite nipuṇe kataparappavāde vālavedhirūpe te bhindantā maññe caranti paññāgatena diṭṭhigatāni.

brāhmaṇamahāsāla

masc. wealthy man of the Brahman caste; lit. Brahman with a big hall [brāhmaṇa + mahāsāla] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wealthy man of the Brahman caste; lit. Brahman with a big hall
Construction brāhmaṇa + mahāsāla
Compound kammadhāraya (brāhmaṇa + mahāsāla)
Commentary (SNa) yesaṃ brāhmaṇānaṃ asītikoṭidhanaṃ nihitaṃ hoti, diyaḍḍho kahāpaṇakumbho valañjan'atthāya gehamajjhe rāsiṃ katvā ṭhapito hoti, te brāhmaṇamahāsālā nāma.
Sanskrit brāhmaṇa + mahāśāla

Examples

ye'pi te, mahārāja, brāhmaṇamahāsālā aḍḍhā mahaddhanā mahābhogā pahūtajātarūparajatā pahūtavitt'ūpakaraṇā pahūtadhanadhaññā, tesam'pi jātānaṃ n'atthi aññatra jarāmaraṇā.

SN 3.3 jarāmaraṇasuttaṃ

idh'āhaṃ, bhante, aḍḍakaraṇe nisinno passāmi khattiyamahāsāle'pi brāhmaṇamahāsāle'pi gahapatimahāsāle'pi aḍḍhe mahaddhane mahābhoge pahūtajātarūparajate pahūtavitt'ūpakaraṇe pahūtadhanadhaññe kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ sampajānamusā bhāsante.

SN 3.7 aḍḍakaraṇasuttaṃ
brāhmaṇamahāsālakula

nt. very wealthy Brahman family [brāhmaṇa + mahāsāla + kula] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning very wealthy Brahman family
Construction brāhmaṇa + mahāsāla + kula
Compound kammadhāraya (brāhmaṇamahāsāla + kula)
Sanskrit brāhmaṇa + mahāśāla + kula

Example

idh'ānanda, ekacco ucce kule paccājāto hoti, khattiyamahāsālakule vā brāhmaṇamahāsālakule vā gahapatimahāsālakule vā, aḍḍhe mahaddhane mahābhoge pahūtajātarūparajate pahūtavitt'ūpakaraṇe pahūtadhanadhaññe.

Examples

VIN 1.2.4 attakāmapāricariyasikkhāpadaṃ
bruvanta

prp. saying, speaking [√brū] ✗
bruvanti

pr. (+acc) they say; they tell; they speak [√brū + a + nti] ✓

Grammar pr 3rd pl of brūti, trans (+acc)
Meaning they say; they tell; they speak
Root Family √brū
Root √brū･1 a (say)
Base √brū + a > bruva
Construction bruva + nti
Sanskrit bruvanti
Sanskrit Root √brū 2, 6 (say)

Example

yo koci karoti, taṃ añño, karohi karohi, icc'evaṃ bravīti, atha vā karontaṃ payojayati, kāreti, kārayati, kārāpeti, kārāpayati. ye keci karonti, te aññe, karotha karotha, icc'evaṃ bruvanti, kārenti, kārayanti, kārāpenti, kārāpayanti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 438
bruvitvā

abs. having said, having spoken [√brū] ✗
brū

root. (gram) √brū (say) [√brū + ū] ✓

Grammar root, masc
Meaning (gram) √brū (say)
Root Family √brū
Root √brū･1 a (say)
Construction √brū + ū
Derivative kita (ū)
Sanskrit brū
Sanskrit Root √brū 2, 6 (say)

Examples

475, 565. brū bhūnam'āha bhūvā parokkhāyaṃ.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 475

520, 502. brūto ī timhi.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 520
brūti

pr. (+acc) says; tells; speaks; calls [√brū + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning says; tells; speaks; calls
Root Family √brū
Root √brū･1 a (say)
Base √brū + a > brū
Construction brū + ti
Synonym akkhāti, ācikkhati, āmantayati, ārocayati, āroceti, kathayati, katheti, pabrūti, pāvadati, pilapati, bravīti, bhaṇati, lapayati, vadati, vadeti
Sanskrit bravīti
Sanskrit Root √brū 2, 6 (say)

Examples

avijjāya nivuto loko,
vevicchā pamādā nappakāsati,
japp'ābhilepanaṃ brūmi,
dukkham'assa mahabbhayaṃ.

SNP 56 ajita māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 1

kassako paṭijānāsi,
na ca passāma te kasiṃ,
kasiṃ no pucchito brūhi,
yathā jānemu te kasiṃ.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
brūmi

pr. (+acc) I say; I tell you; I call [√brū + a + mi] ✓

Grammar pr 1st sg of brūti, trans (+acc)
Meaning I say; I tell you; I call
Root Family √brū
Root √brū･1 a (say)
Base √brū + a > brū
Construction brū + mi
Sanskrit brū
Sanskrit Root √brū 2, 6 (say)

Examples

avijjāya nivuto loko,
vevicchā pamādā nappakāsati,
japp'ābhilepanaṃ brūmi,
dukkham'assa mahabbhayaṃ.

SNP 56 ajita māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 1

yo ubho'nte viditvāna,
majjhe mantā na lippati,
taṃ brūmi mahāpuriso'ti,
so'dha sibbinim'accagā'ti.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ
brūsi

pr. (+acc) you say; you tell; you call [√brū + a + si] ✓

Grammar pr 2nd sg of brūti, trans (+acc)
Meaning you say; you tell; you call
Root Family √brū
Root √brū･1 a (say)
Base √brū + a > brū
Construction brū + si
Sanskrit bravīṣi
Sanskrit Root √brū 2, 6 (say)

Example

mātaraṃ kuṭikaṃ brūsi,
bhariyaṃ brūsi kulāvakaṃ,
putte santānake brūsi,
taṇhaṃ me brūsi bandhanan'ti.

SN 1.19 kuṭikāsuttaṃ
brūhana 1

nt. developing; increasing [√brūh + ana] ~

Meaning developing; increasing
Root Family √brūh
Root √brūh･1 a (increase)
Construction √brūh + ana

brūhana 2

nt. intensification [√brūh] ✗
brūhanā

fem. increasing in size; bulking up [√brūh + anā] ~

Grammar fem, act, from brūhati
Meaning increasing in size; bulking up
Root Family √brūh
Root √brūh･1 a (increase)
Construction √brūh + anā
Derivative kita (anā)

brūhanāhetu

ind. for the sake of increasing; because of bulking up [brūhanā + hetu] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for the sake of increasing; because of bulking up
Construction brūhanā + hetu
brūhayati

pr. (+acc) develops; practices; furthers; increases [√brūh + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of brūhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning develops; practices; furthers; increases
Root Family √brūh
Root √brūh･1 *aya (increase)
Base √brūh + aya > brūhaya (caus)
Construction brūhaya + ti
Synonym anubrūhayati, anubrūheti, pavaḍḍhati, vaḍḍhati, vaddhati
Sanskrit bṛṃhayati
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh √vṛṃh 1, 6 (make big or strong)

Example

ucchinda sineham'attano,
kumudaṃ sāradikaṃ'va,
santimaggam'eva brūhaya,
nibbānaṃ sugatena desitaṃ.

DHP 285 maggavaggo
brūhayanta

prp. (+acc) developing; practising; furthering; increasing [√brūh + *aya + nta] ~

Grammar prp of brūhayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning developing; practising; furthering; increasing
Root Family √brūh
Root √brūh･1 *aya (increase)
Base √brūh + aya > brūhaya (caus)
Construction brūhaya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym anubrūhanta, anubrūhayamāna, upabrūhayamāna, vaḍḍhamāna
Sanskrit bṛṃhayat
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh √vṛṃh 1, 6 (make big or strong)
brūhayamāna

prp. developing; practising; furthering [√brūh] ✗
brūhi

imp. (+acc) say!; tell!; speak! [√brū + hi] ✓

Grammar imp 2nd sg of bravitu, trans (+acc)
Meaning say!; tell!; speak!
Root Family √brū
Root √brū･1 a (say)
Construction √brū + hi
Sanskrit brūhi
Sanskrit Root √brū 2, 6 (say)

Examples

bahū devā manussā ca,
maṅgalāni acintayuṃ,
ākaṅkhamānā sotthānaṃ,
brūhi maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.

KHP 5 maṅgalasuttaṃ

kassako paṭijānāsi,
na ca passāma te kasiṃ,
kasiṃ no pucchito brūhi,
yathā jānemu te kasiṃ.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
brūhita

pp. increased, developed [√brūh] ✗
brūhetabba 1

ptp. to be increased in size; to be bulked up; lit. to be caused to increase [√brūh + *e + tabba] ~

Grammar ptp of brūheti, caus
Meaning to be increased in size; to be bulked up; lit. to be caused to increase
Root Family √brūh
Root √brūh･1 *e (increase)
Base √brūh + e > brūhe (caus)
Construction brūhe + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Sanskrit bṛṃhayitavya
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh √vṛṃh 1, 6 (make big or strong)
brūhetabba 2

ptp. (+acc) to be develop; to be practised [√brūh] ✗
brūhetar

masc. (+acc) who develops; who practices; who furthers; lit. increaser [√brūh + *e + tar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from brūheti, caus (+acc)
Meaning who develops; who practices; who furthers; lit. increaser
Root Family √brūh
Root √brūh･1 *e (increase)
Base √brūh + e > brūhe (caus)
Construction brūhe + tar
Derivative kita (tar)
Commentary (ANa) brūhetā suññ'āgārānan'ti vaḍḍhetā suññ'āgārānaṃ
Sanskrit bṛṃhayitṛ
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh √vṛṃh 1, 6 (make big or strong)

Examples

ākaṅkheyya ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu, sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo c'assaṃ manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo cā'ti, sīlesv'ev'assa paripūrakārī ajjhattaṃ cetosamatham'anuyutto anirākatajjhāno vipassanāya samannāgato brūhetā suññ'āgārānaṃ.

AN 10.71 ākaṅkhasuttaṃ

idh'āvuso sāriputta, bhikkhu paṭisallān'ārāmo hoti paṭisallānarato, ajjhattaṃ cetosamatham'anuyutto anirākatajjhāno, vipassanāya samannāgato, brūhetā suññ'āgārānaṃ. evarūpena kho, āvuso sāriputta, bhikkhunā gosiṅgasālavanaṃ sobheyyā'ti.

MN 32 mahāgosiṅgasuttaṃ
brūheti

pr. (+acc) grows; builds; increases; makes strong; lit. causes to increase [√brūh + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of √brūh, trans (+acc)
Meaning grows; builds; increases; makes strong; lit. causes to increase
Root Family √brūh
Root √brūh･1 *e (increase)
Base √brūh + e > brūhe (caus)
Construction brūhe + ti
Synonym pavaḍḍhati, phātikaroti, rūhati, vaḍḍhati, vaddhati
Commentary (MNa) brūhentī'ti vaḍḍhenti.
Sanskrit bṛṃhayati
Sanskrit Root √bṛh √bṛṁh √vṛṃh 1, 6 (make big or strong)

Example

te imaṃ kāyaṃ balaṃ gāhenti nāma, brūhenti nāma, medenti nāmā'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
brūhetuṃ

inf. (+acc) to develop; to practice; to increase [√brūh] ✗
brūhetvā

abs. having increased, having developed [√brūh] ✗
brūhenta

prp. increasing, developing [√brūh] ✗
brūhesi

aor. increased, developed [√brūh] ✗
